loans.name: Vera Luz

texts.es: Vera Luz G.  N. de 29 años de edad vive en el departamento de  Ahuachapán.  A pesar de su temprana edad, Vera Luz cuida y cría tres hijos todos menores de edad por sí sola. Para mantener a su extensa familia, Vera ha montado en su propia casa, una tienda y venta de ropa, a la que dedica  todo el tiempo diario. Vera solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio, con el objetivo de hacer crecer su tienda, y poder brindar  a sus tres hijos una vida estable y sana.
texts.en:
Vera Luz Garcia N., 29, lives in the "departamento" of Ahuachapan. Despite being still young herself, Vera Luz is raising and caring for three children, all still pre-schoolers, alone. In order to take care of her large family, Vera has set up a shop selling clothes in her house, a business that she operates all day, every day. Vera is applying for a loan so that she can stock her business and, in turn, grow her business and provide her three children with a stable and healthy life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem R., age 35, is married and has three school-aged children. She lives with her husband (pictured) in Siem Reap province. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a skillful fisherman who always works hard everyday at the nearby fishing spots, typically earning US$7 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her husband’s business. She is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a new motorbike and a boat machine. By doing so, she will be able to transport fish from her husband to sell at the nearby local markets. Also, she believes that the boat machine will be so useful for her husband to go fishing faster and easier and catch more fish to generate more income to raise a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and a boat machine

loans.name: Julius Mburu

texts.en: Julius K. is 29 years old, married to Lucy Njeri, and together they have one school-going child. Julius has been in the motorcycle transportation business for three years, operating in a place called Kwa-muhia, on the outskirts of Naivasha town. Julius heard about KADET through a friend and this will be his first loan with the organization. With this loan, he plans to buy a new motorbike. Julius’s future dream is to excel in the public transportation business. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: Teresa Del Carmen S. D. C. vive en el municipio D. Tacachico en el departamento D. La Libertad en la zona occidental del país. A sus 40 años D. edad, Teresa es responsable y madre D. tres hijos, todos menores D. edad y todos estudiantes D. educación básica. Desafortunadamente Teresa no logra pasar todo el tiempo que quisiera con sus hijos, pues tiene que trabajar largas horas diarias para poder mantener su casa y familia. Teresa solicita un préstamo para compra D. materia prima para surtir su negocio en productos lácteos, quesos y crema, que es el medio D. manutención D. la familia.
texts.en:
Teresa Del Carmen S. D. C. lives in the town of Tacachico in the eastern Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad. Teresa, 40, is a caring mother of three children, all still living at home and all still in school. Unfortunately, Teresa isn't able to spend as much time with her children as she would like because she has to work long hours every day to support them. Teresa is applying for a loan so that she can buy supplies to stock her dairy, cheese and cream business, the means of support for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for dairy business.

loans.name: Delmy Esperanza

texts.es: Delmy Esperanza H. A. vive en el departamento l de Ahuachapán. Delmy se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de caballeros, mediante el manejo de un pequeño puesto de venta ubicado en la calle principal del centro de Ahuachapán. Su negocio ha sido ya por años, el medio mediante el cual mantiene a sus dos hijas, quienes aun estudian en la escuela. Delmy solicita un préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo para tratar de costearles a sus hijas la educación superior y darles la posibilidad de un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
Delmy Esperanza Hernandez A. lives in the "departamento" of Ahuachapan. She operates a business selling men's underwear, a business that she manages from a small sales kiosk on the main street of the town of Ahuachapan. She has operated the business for years and it is the means by which she supports her two school-aged daughters. Delmy is applying for a loan to invest in working capital and, ultimately, to try and pay for her daughters' continued education and give them a more prosperous future.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell

loans.name: Magna Marlene

texts.es: Magna Marlene C. R. vive en Lourdes, municipio en el departamento de La Libertad. Magna maneja una pupusería en la casa donde vive  con su esposo y sus dos hijas, Fátima de 7 años y Katerine, recién nacida y de apenas un año de edad. El nacimiento de su nueva hija, ha llenado de ilusión a Magna, quien está decidida a trabajar fuerte y con disciplina para sacar su familia adelante. Magna solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio comprando materia prima para sus pupusas y hacerlo crecer cada vez mas.
texts.en:
Magna Marlene C. R. lives in Lourdes, a town in the "departamento" of La Libertad. Magna operates a "pupeseria" [a shop where she sells "pupesas", a traditional flat bread made from maize] in the house where she lives with her husband and their two daughters, Fatima, 7, and Katerina, a one-year old baby. The birth of her new daughter has fired Magna's hopes for the future and she's decided to work hard to push her family ahead. She is applying for a loan to buy basic supplies for making pupesas and to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann B.'s main source of income comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. Mary Ann is just starting this business. She is 20 years old, married and has one small child. They are from the village of Capucao, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental.

In 2009, Mary Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mary Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business and for daily needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gaba

texts.en:
Gaba is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock smoked fish to sell.

She is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a hotel at a nearby market.


About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun V. currently weaves bamboo baskets for sale. She sells her finished product to buyers who come directly to her house. She makes over 100 sets of baskets before selling out. She also orders baskets from the other villagers and sells them to make additional income. Her husband helps her buy the raw materials and weave baskets. Recently, Sun V. has run out of essential materials from her stock supply and she hopes to acquire other raw materials to continue making baskets. She depends on using her Kiva loan as an advance.

Sun V. is a 47-year-old married woman blessed with seven children. Two of her children are married: a daughter works in the shoe industry and a son is a diver at a sea port.

loans.use: To buy materials to make bamboo baskets

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 65 years old, is widowed, and has eight adult children.

Laureta owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Laureta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Laureta is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes Guardón M. vive en Lourdes, municipio del departamento de La Libertad. Junto a su esposo Héctor, manejan una tienda de productos de consumo diario, ubicada en su propia casa.  Tras años de existencia de la tienda, Mercedes se sienta segura, que es el momento de apostar un poco más y reinvertir en el negocio, es por eso, que solicita un préstamo para refinanciar la tienda y ampliar la gama de productos y mercadería.
texts.en:
Mercedes Guardon Mejia lives in Lourdes, a town in the "departamento" of La Libertad. With her husband, Hector, she operates a shop in her house selling everyday items. After years of managing the store, Mercedes feels sure that this is the moment to take a chance and again invest in the business so she's applying for a loan to refinance it and expand the range of products and merchandise on offer.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Ana Guadalupe

texts.es: Ana Guadalupe C. D. C. vive en el municipio D. Santa Tecla en el departamento D. La Libertad. La casa D. Ana y su esposo nunca esta vacía, pues cuentan con cuatro hijos, todos estudiantes y menores D. edad.  Ana maneja una pequeña librería desD. su casa, la cual se ha convertido además D. su fuente primario D. ingresos, en un espacio D. recreación y educación para sus cuatro hijos, quienes pasan mucho D. su tiempo libre, entre los libros y folletos D. la llamada “Librería Any”.  Ana Guadalupe solicita un préstamo para ampliar su librería, y convertirla en un espacio educativo para niños y adultos.
texts.en:
Ana Guadalupe C. D. C. lives in the town of Santa Tecla in the "departamento" of La Libertad. Ana's house is never empty because she and her husband have four children, all school-aged and still living at home. Ana operates a small bookshop from her house, a business that has become her main source of income and a space where her four children can both enjoy themselves and learn. The children often spend their spare time among the books in the so-called "Libreria Any". Ana Guadalupe is applying for a loan to expand her shop and convert it to an education space for both children and adults.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand bookshop

loans.name: David Kagiri

texts.en: David N. is a 33-year-old man married to Nancy Wanja and they have two children. He has been in the taxi business for the last three years around Naivasha town. His monthly income averages Kshs 12,160. David heard about KADET through one of its many outdoor promotions and he decided to join. With his first loan he bought the taxi he is using. He plans to use the second loan to service the engine and do body work, including panel-beating and spray-painting the taxi. In the near future he plans to buy a new taxi to supplement his income from the one he is currently using. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To service and repair his taxi

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando C. M. vive en el municipio de Zacatecoluca en el departamento de La Paz. A sus 39 años de edad, Orlando trabaja como motorista  para mantener a su esposa, quien se queda en casa cuidando y criando a sus cuatro hijos. Orlando y su familia solicitan un préstamo que le permita comprar materiales de construicccion, para construir y mejorar su vivienda, que ha sido descuidad, debido a los distintos y frecuentes gastos que su extensa familia requiere.
texts.en:
Orlando Chavez M. lives in the town of Zacatecoluca in the "departamento" of La Paz. He is 39 years old and works as a "motorista" [possibly a mechanic, but not clear] to support his wife who runs the household and takes care of their four children. Orlando and his family are applying for a loan to buy construction materials and improve their house which has become dilapidated due to the various and frequent expenses required by this large family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for improvements to house

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen A. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 40 years old, is married, and has four adult children.

Helen owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase piglets to raise and sell.

Helen is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita N. is from the village of Tuburan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 41 years old. Conchita is married and has two school-age children. To make a living, Conchita owns a business making and and selling specialty food called binangkal in the local community. Conchita has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Conchita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Conchita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale. Conchita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Conchita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food items for sale

loans.name: Antony Obwana

texts.en:
Antony J. is a 41-year-old married father of three children. His business is located at Baharini centre in Eldoret Town and his main clients are residents of Baharini.

He has been in the cereal business for the past six years and his business has been doing very well. 

He was introduced to KADET by a group member. He intends to restock his cereal and vegetable shop with the loan he is taking. 

In the future, he intends to expand his business to be a wholesale shop, and also be able to get good income which will enable him to diversify to a bigger shop and be able to provide a good education for his children.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add stock for his cereal and vegetabes shop

loans.name: Kenia Ivonne

texts.es: Kenia Ivonne M. vive en el municipio de  San Pedro Masahuat en el departamento de La Paz. Como madre soltera, Kenia trabaja cada día en su modesta venta de productos básicos, para mantener a sus tres hijos, todos menores de edad.  Kenia solicita un préstamo para  surtir de mejor manera su negocio, y generar de esta manera mayores ingresos, para abastecer las surgentes necesidades de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Kenia Ivonne M. lives in the city of San Pedro Masahuat in the district of La Paz. As a single mother, Kenia works every day selling everyday consumer products in order to support her 3 dependent children.

She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can generate more income. This will help her meet the increasing needs of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 63 years old. Fely is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Fely has been in business for over 39 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Fely is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Fely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for her clay manufacturing shop

loans.name: Atoo

texts.en:
Atoo F. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Atoo is 30 years old and is married with a husband who is a cattle keeper. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan T., 40, lives in the rural area of Kompong Chhnang Province, where she sells items to earn a living. She married years ago and has a young son who is already enrolled in the primary school. Typically, she generates an income of $6 per day from her investment and uses her profit to contribute her family’s daily living expenses. Her husband is a local teacher for a secondary school. She said that she will use half of her first loan to purchase more inventory to sell, and the rest to order rice in bulk from farmers, at which point she will store the rice awhile and resell it for income. The loan will provide her with extra revenue and improved living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase items to sell as well as rice in bulk for resale

loans.name: Rhea Joy

texts.en:
Rhea Joy F. is a 31-year-old mother of three children, ages 1 to 8 years old. She is married to a 33-year-old grocery worker and together with their children, they live in a beautiful village near the seashore in the municipality of Hamtic in the province where mountains meet the sea: Antique.

Rhea started earning her own income and independence from the income of her husband when she became a member of ASHI in 2005. She made a loan then, which she used as capital to start up her fish selling business. After several years of loaning and savings generated from her profits, she had put up another business for an alternative source of income in case fish were off season. Now, her business has grown and requires a larger amount of capital. Thus, Rhea Joy's loan amounting to Php 24,000 is intended for this purpose. Since fish is in demand, she wants to increase her inventory of it and also wants to finance her variety store.

By obtaining loans and being a member of ASHI, Rhea Joy wishes to make her business more stable and sustainable. She also dreams of sending all of her children to college with the profits her business generates and through the savings she makes in ASHI.

loans.use: To buy different varieties of fish to resell and to use a small portion of the loan to finance her variety store business.

loans.name: Mara Group

texts.en:
Rahma M., age 28, is single with one daughter who is three years old. She has a beauty salon that she started three years ago. She works from 10am to 7pm daily, and she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $113.

This will be Rahma’s third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to expand her salon and started selling clothes and bed sheets, which she sells from door to door. She has paid the loans back successfully. She now hopes for a new loan to expand both businesses.

Rahma will share this loan with her loan group, Mara, which totals 15 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rahma is first on the right, back row, in a red t-shirt.

loans.use: To expand the salon and clothing sale businesses

loans.name: Clara Luz

texts.es: Clara Luz V. A. vive en el municipio de Soyapango en el departamento de San Salvador. Tras pasar la desafortunada experiencia de separarse de su esposo, Clara se encuentra viviendo junto a su madre de 68 años.  Sus dos hijos, de 16 y 12 años de edad respectivamente completan el hogar V. A.. Con fe y superación, Clara maneja exitosamente una venta de celulares en el centro del país. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, para dar sin dudarlo, un paso más hacia su nueva vida.
texts.en:
Clara Luz V. A. lives in the town of Soyapango in the district of San Salvador. After she separated from her husband, Clara went to live with her 68 year old mother. Her two sons, ages 16 and 12 respectively, make up the rest of her family. With faith and determination, Clara successfully manages a business selling mobile phones in central El Salvador.

She is requesting a loan to use as operating capital to invest into her business. Without a doubt, Clara believes this will bring her one step closer to a new life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Paul Kahungo

texts.en:
Paul K. is 31 years old. He is married to Naomi Wambui and they have two children.

For the last three years, he has been employed carrying passengers with a motorbike in Gilgil town. He has also been running a grocery store on the side.

A friend introduced him to KADET, where he has applied for a loan to buy his own motorcycle. This will make him self employed and more financially secure.

Paul's vision is to prosper in the transport business by having a fleet of public transport vans and to create employment for others.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purshase a motorbike

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif was born in 1960. He is married. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, now settled in Baku city.

Sixteen years ago, he started taxi business. Now he needs s loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the spare parts needed to improve his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts needed to improve his taxi business

loans.name: María Reyna

texts.es: María Reyna R. Q. vive en el municipio de San Martin en el departamento de San Salvador. Desde hace ya varios años, maneja una tienda de productos varios, junto a su esposo y con la colaboración frecuente de sus dos hijos. La disciplina y dedicación de los R. ha dado frutos, pues la tienda es conocida en la comunidad y los alrededores. En este momento María Reyna solicita un préstamo para surtir su negocio y aumentar la mercadería de la tienda para ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
María Reyna R. Q. lives in the San Martin municipality in the San Salvador department. She has had a store selling various products for several years. She runs the store with her husband and with frequent help from their two children. The R.’ discipline and dedication have born fruit. The store is well known in the community and neighboring areas. María Reyna is now asking for a loan to stock her store and increase the merchandise that the store sells. She wants to do this to offer her customer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Teresa Patricia

texts.es: Teresa Patricia S. M. vive en el municipio de San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad. Teresa vive con su esposo William, quien es albañil, y su hija Patricia de tan solo tres años de edad. Teresa además de educar y criar a Patricia, maneja un puesto de venta de productos básicos desde su casa. Debido a que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo de albañil, Teresa es la mancuerna principal del hogar en cuanto a ingresos se refiere. Para ampliar su negocio y hacer crecer su tienda, Teresa solicita un préstamo para comprar nueva mercadería y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa Patricia S. M. lives in the municipality of San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad. Teresa lives with her husband William, who is a brick layer, and her daughter Patricia, who is only three years old. Besides educating and raising Patricia, Teresa manages a stall selling convenience goods from her home. This is because her husband doesn’t earn much working as a brick layer. Teresa is the principal support of the household insofar as income is concerned.

In order to enlarge her business and increase the size of her shop, Teresa is applying for a loan in order to buy new merchandise and supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her business

loans.name: Dorm

texts.en:
Dorm P., 40, is married and has two school-age children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works as a farmer, typically earning $3 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a skillful fisherman who works hard every day at nearby fishing spots, typically earning $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her husband’s business. She is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase fishing tools, a purchase with which she sees an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools

loans.name: Kit

texts.en:
Kit S., age 28, is married and has three school-age children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She owns a business producing Cambodian traditional cakes, typically earning $1 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a construction worker, typically earning $4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for many, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is seeking to increase her income and improve her husband’s business. She is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike, a purchase with which she sees an opportunity to raise her standard of living. By doing so, her husband will be able to commute to work easier and faster to his long distance construction site.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
The people shown in the picture above are Mrs. Chea S. and her husband with their grandchild. This older couple has always cultivated a rice crop and they have this crop as annual business. They also grow rice enough for their family’s eating.

The main source of their family’s current income comes from Chea S.’s work in selling grocery items in front of her home. She makes around of $3 each day to meet her family’s needs. Chea S. has two married children, all of whom earn a living as domestic farmers. 

Chea S. says that her business is currently too small because she lacks money to sustain her business' growth. She would therefore like a loan from Kiva’s partner, HKL, for capital which she will use to accumulate a larger quantity of merchandise into her store supply for resale.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.en:
Tunzala is the mother of two children. She was born in 1980. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, and she is now settled in Absheron region. She is a teacher and has been in this business for five years.

Tunzala teaches students at home also and now she needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy computers and a printer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy computers and a printer for her teaching business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca P. is from the village of Pigasag-an, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Rebecca is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Rebecca owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Rebecca is just starting this business.

In 2008, Rebecca joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rebecca from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Idalia Jacqueline

texts.es: Idalia Jacqueline M. D.
texts.en: Idalia Jacqueline M. D.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Mr. Mus Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank Group loan consists of 21 people who all live in Tuol Pongro village in Takeo province. Mr. Mus N. is the Village Bank Group president who has been selected by the members. He is a farmer who has a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for a living. He now faces a small problem because his field has infertile soil. He decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field. With the rest of the money, he will hire a laborer to plow the field. His wife, Mrs. Khon Khaem, also helps him with planting. Mr. Mus N. is 46 years old and the father of four children who are all attending the local school. 

Fourteen members in this group loans are End-of-Term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-Term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his rice field

loans.name: Sherlie

texts.en:
Sherlie S. is from the town of Panaon. She is 30 years old. Sherlie is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Sherlie owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Sherlie has has her business for over four years and earns approximately 70,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Sherlie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Sherlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Sherlie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Sherlie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa C. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 48 years old. Leonisa is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Leonisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Leonisa has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonisa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the products offered at her store

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita F. of Brgy. Nayon, San Enrique, Negros Occidental is a 51-year-old married woman with five children. She is single-minded in her mission to assist her husband in improving their family's quality of life.

For over fifteen years now, Mrs. F. has been engaged in buying and selling fish and shrimps in the community and other neighboring towns. This earns for the family Php 8,000 per month and she says that the income is a big help. The goal that she had when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon - to improve her family's condition, is slowly being fulfilled. Strong determination, hard work, courage, perseverance and patience are the keys to her success.

Mrs. F.' new loan of Php 15,000 from Project Dungganon is her 13th. The loan will be utilized as additional capital for her business. She plans to invest in a transport vehicle so that she can deliver her products faster and with more efficiency.


About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gismala

texts.en:
Gismala R. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop such as, sweets, toothpaste, toothbrushes, etc., and she is requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell. Gismala is 49 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has three children who attend school. 

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a bar and stock crates of beer to sell. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell at her shop

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es: María Julia C. de 55 años de edad vive en Mejicanos departamento de San Salvador junto  a su esposo Julio de 42 años quien trabaja como técnico en computación, María y su esposo se encuentran solos ya que sus hijos se han ido y han hechos sus familias, pero María siempre trabaja con el mismo entusiasmo que siempre la caracterizo por una mujer muy responsable y luchadora por su familia aunque ahora solo tenga las responsabilidad de sostenerse ella misma y su esposo, María maneja su propio negocio donde cuenta con una tienda y venta de pollo en el mercado de la Col. Zacamil, ahora María solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio y seguir ampliando su gama de productos.
texts.en:
María Julia C., 55, lives in the Mejicanos department of San Salvador with her husband, Julio, who is 42. He works as a computer technician. María and her husband find themselves alone now that their children have gone and made their own families. But, María always works with the same enthusiasm that has always characterized her as a very responsible woman who fights for her family. Now she only has the responsibility to support herself and her husband. María manages her own business, which is a store and chicken sales in the Col. Zacamil market. María is now asking for a loan to stock her business and to keep increasing her range of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Alimurod

texts.ru: Алимурод Джурабеков проживает в районе Абдурахмон Чоми. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алимурод более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует  мужской одеждой. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Alimurod D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 42 years old, married and has 5 children. Alimurod has been involved in sales for over 6 years. He has a retail store at a market, where he sells men's clothing. He is requesting a loan to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Making baskets is a part of 63-year-old But T.’s daily routine. But T. and her husband currently buy raw materials to make baskets to sell at the market. They also buy baskets from other weavers at a reasonable price and resell them to gain extra profits. They have done this since 1980. But T. is an older mother who has seven children. Two of her children are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh. 

But T. will be using her loan to add to her personal savings to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland near her house, which is a good location for farming. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee. The loan will provide her with an additional new asset.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland to rent to farmers

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila (her husband is pictured) is the mother of four children. She was born in 1970. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Khankendy town. She is now settled in Baku city.

Her husband has been in the taxi business for ten years. Now Nazila needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for her husband's taxi business.

loans.use: to buy the spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. is currently in the business of selling sandals at her shop and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and clothes to sell. Margret is 49 years old and is married to a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es: Lorena Elizabeth M. A. de 26 años de edad reside en Ayuxtuctepeque municipio de  San Salvador. Lorena  vive con sus tres hijos todos menores de edad y estudiantes, Lorena ha logrado sostener a su familia a través de lo que ella sabe hacer confeccionar, profesión con  la cual ha conseguido establecer su propio negocio donde confecciona a la medida y produce todo tipo de ropa para comercializar; el crédito que solicita Lorena es  para compra de materia prima como tela, hilo y elástico que le ayuden a sacar su producción en ropa.
texts.en:
Lorena Elizabeth M. A. is 26 years old and lives in the Ayuxtuctepeque area of the city of San Salvador. She has three dependent children who are students. Lorena has managed to support her family by sewing, a skill that allowed her to start her own business making all types of clothing.

Lorena is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials such as fabric, thread and elastic that are necessary for making clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Турсун

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Содиров  Турсун- мужчина 48ми лет, Женат, имеет 3 сына и дочку. Его дело это закупать и откармливать овец на дому. Турсун  покупает овец на скотном рынке на базарный день и присматривает за ними 4-6 месяцев. Затем он продает их на базаре за хорошую цену и снова покупает скот для откорма. На выручку он содержит семью. Его жена Содиева Суюда тоже присматривает за скотом помогая мужу. На полученный кредит Турсун купил жене телёнка, который уже стал большим быком. Они собираются его продать и получить прибыль .Эта семья благодарна нашей организации. И в дальнейшем планируют  снами работать.

loans.use: покупка скота

loans.name: Iris Maribel

texts.es: Iris Maribel Q. D. Vive en Ayuxtuctepeque en el  departamento de  San Salvador junto a su madre. Iris es una persona muy trabajadora ha logrado mantener a flote y con mucho esfuerzo y éxito su negocio, con 10 años de experiencia Iris maneja su  tienda y tortillería ubicada en su casa, donde cuenta con una clientela muy fiel y estable, ahora Iris intenta surtir su tienda para ofrecer más variedad de productos a su clientes lo que le ayudara  a aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Iris Maribel Q. D. lives with her mother in Ayustuctepeque in the San Salvador department. Iris is a very hardworking person who has managed to stay afloat through much effort and success in her business. Iris has ten years of experience running her store and tortilla shop in her house. She has loyal and stable customers. Now Iris intends to stock her store to offer a greater variety of products to her customers. This will help her to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her business

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Гулбахор Уракова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Гулбахор имеет торговую точку на рынке, где сама же торгует овощами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 10 лет. Муж также помогает супруге. Он занимается перевозкой товара. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборта.
texts.en:
Glubakhor U. is 33-years-old , lives in Rumi District, and is married with 4 children. She has a shop at the market, where she herself sells vegetables. She’s been in this type of business for 10 years. Her husband, who transports goods for a living, also helps her out. She plans to use her loan to increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ream

texts.en:
Mrs. Ream M. is a villager in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she faces a small problem because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field. She would use the rest of the loan to hire laborers to work in the field. Her husband, Mr. Dom Rum, is an electric cow driver who can make a small income to support the family. 

Mrs. Ream M. has two children who are both too young to work or study. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer to support the field and  hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Iris Concepción

texts.es: Iris Concepción R. D. vive en la capital de El Salvador junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 11 y 2 años de edad,  Iris maneja su propio negocio  obtiene ganancias con las que ayuda a su esposo a los gastos del hogar, el negocio de Iris es un comedor y pupuseria ubicado en una de las calles principales de San Salvador donde la afluencia de personas es mucha, Iris es muy reconocida en la zona y sus ventas son muy estables el crédito lo solita para compra de materia prima para aumentar producción de su comida.
texts.en:
Iris Concepción R. D. lives in the capital of El Salvador with her husband and two children ages 11 and 12. Iris runs her own business. She gets earnings to help her husband with the household expenses. Iris’ business is a restaurant, and she sells “pupusas” (corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, beans, and pork, then grilled). It is located on one of the main streets in San Salvador, and it is a heavily trafficked area. Iris is very well known in the area. Her sales are very stable. The loan she is asking for is to buy raw material to increase her food production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material for her food

loans.name: Arzu

texts.en:
Arzu is a teacher in a school. She was born in 1960. She is married and has 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Kalbadjar region, now settled in Khirdalan town. She also is a home tutor, also. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy computers, printers and necessary books to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy computers, printers and necessary books

loans.name: Гайбулло

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Гаффоров Гайбулло- молодой мужчина, ему 32 года. Женат, у него один ребенок .Гайбулло мастер по ремонту автомашин. Имеет цех на дому, где работает со своими учениками. Его услуга пользуется большим спросом, так как в районе таких мастеров к5ак он мало. Он получил у нас кредит и купил себе запчасти по оптовой цене. После сотрудничества с нами он не думает о проблеме с деньгами  и рекомендует нашу организацию всем.

loans.use: покупка автозапчастей

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Исакова Дилбар проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 37 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж работает в строительной компании  в районе Ура-Тюбе. Сама клиентка имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует национальными лепешками. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборта.
texts.en:
I. Dilbar is 37 lives in Rumi District with her husband and three children. Her husband works for a construction company in Ura-Tube. For the past five years I. has been in business selling traditional flatbreads from her shop at the market. She plans to use her loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat P. lives in Slaeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living; her field is far from her house. Her husband, Mr. Bin Reth, is an electric cow driver who can make only a small income to support the family.

Since the field is far from the house and Mrs. Phat P. has difficulty transporting fertilizer to use in the rice field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy an electric cow cart for her husband in order to transport fertilizer.

Mrs. Phat P. has two children who are both attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: to buy electric cow cart for her husband in order to transport fertilizer

loans.name: Abduzarif

texts.ru: Ураков Абдузариф проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 28 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Абдузариф занимается семейным бизнесом. Он имеет хлебопекарню, где изготавливает национальные лепешки. Женат занимается продажей лепешек у себя на дому. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет.  Кредит просит для закупа муки, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Abduzarif U. lives in Rumi District. He's 28, and married with two children. For the past 5 years he has worked in the family business, a bakery, where he bakes traditional flatbreads, which his wife sell from their home. He is seeking a loan to buy flour, so he can increase his sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Уктам

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Уктам 1958 года рождения, женат, имеет одного ребенка. Его жена помогает по хозяйству. Уктам занимается откормом крупно рогатого скота. У него в хозяйстве есть большой огород где растут растение для корма скота. Поэтому он хочет получить займ на увеличение поголовье скота. Он благодарен за поддержку кредиторов в осуществление его плана.

loans.use: На покупку крупно рогатого скота

loans.name: Комил

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каримов Комил- мужчина со средним образованием. Ему 38лет, он разведенный, живет с родителями. Занимается торговлей на Джабборрасуловском продуктовом рынке, продаёт продукты питания и игрушки для детей . Закупает свой товар в городе, где и узнал о нашей программе. Решил попробовать и ему понравилось. Получив свой первый кредит, он смог получить хорошую прибыль и теперь он кредитуется у нас по сей день . Свой  следующий кредит он снова хочет закупить большую партию товара  по оптовой цене.

loans.use: оптовая покупка продуктов

loans.name: Ray

texts.en:
Ray R., age 65, is married and has two children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business producing Cambodian traditional cakes and vegetables, typically earning US$ 2 per day. The family is also assisted by her two children who are currently employed, one with a private company as a tourist car driver, and the other one is a grocery seller.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, R. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, R. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase rice and more ingredients for her business. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to generate more income to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing rice and more ingredients for cooked food

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng K. S., age 24, is married and has three children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business providing laundry services for the people in the town, typically earning US$ 1.50 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a tourist car driver for a private company, typically earning US$ 4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, S. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, S. is working hard to increase her income and improve her standard of living. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase construction materials to repair her house. By doing so, she will be able to have good living conditions for her family and her beloved children.

loans.use: purchasing construction materials

loans.name: Mrs. Sovann Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who are all in Kandal village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan group, and they will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sovann P. is the village bank president, and she is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Aside from this planting, she is a silk weaver in the local village. 

Her husband, Mr. P. Pheurn, is a construction worker. Since his work place is far from house, Mrs. Sovann P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work in order to reduce their expenses. Mrs. Sovann P. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are attending the local school. The other two are too young to work or study so they stay home. 

Mrs. Phen P. did not come to take the loan but her father did, so he is in the picture instead her. He is sitting behind the other villagers. 

Eleven members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok P., age 33, is married and has a school-aged child. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a grocery seller, typically earning US$ 5 per day which is the primary source of income for her family. Her husband is a motorbike repairman, typically earning US$ 4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase more various kinds of groceries, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing various grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Башорат

texts.ru: Тошматова Башорат, женщина продолжает свою деятельность .Башорат 3 года является активной клиенткой в МЗФ Микроинвест. Она торгует на Чумъа и Якшанбе базаре женскими костюмами и плащами. Товар она закупает из Бишкека.  В период кредитования она увеличила свой товарооборот и улучшила финансовое положении семьи. Она планирует на запрашиваемый займ в осенний сезон закупить женские плащи.

loans.use: На закупку женских плащей в осенний сезон.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim H., age 27, is married and has two young children who have not been enrolled in school yet. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a grocery seller, typically earning US$ 5 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a tourist car driver for a private company, typically earning US$ 8 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, H. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, H. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase various kinds of groceries, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing various grocery items for re-sale

loans.name: Абдугапур

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Абдуваитов Абдугапур- колхозник с высшим  образованием. Ему 65лет, Женат и имеет 4х  детей и много внуков. Живет и работает в Джаборрасуловском районе. Он откармливает скот на дому всю свою жизнь, так как сейчас сидит на пенсии. Вместе со своей женой Абдугапур-амак присматривают за хозяйством и скотом. У нас он кредитуется больше 6ти лет и не выходит из программы потому что считает что с нами работать интересно.

loans.use: покупка скота

loans.name: Sek

texts.en:
Sek P., age 29, is married and has five children. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She has been engaged in a business as a vegetable seller, typically earning US$ 4 per day. Her husband’s business is the primary source of income for her family. He is a motor-taxi driver who always provides his transportation services to the people at the local markets and in his village, typically earning US$ 4 per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, P. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, P. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a convenient stand at the market, a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to sell her vegetables well and to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: purchasing a stand at the market

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn V., age 53, is married and has a child who is now a farmer. She lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She and her husband have been farming since 1998, collectively earning $6 US per day. They work hard every day to ensure a good standard of living for their family.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This has factored into a difficult economic year for much of the country, V. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, V. is seeking to increase her income and improve her agriculture business. She is asking for a loan of $500 US to purchase more farmlands – a purchase that she sees as an opportunity to produce more crops to sell and to raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase farmland

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun L., age 26, makes a living by singing at wedding parties, typically earning $3 US per day. She is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. Her husband is a security guard at a private security company in town, typically earning $2 US per day.

The financial crisis has been difficult for business in Cambodia this past year. This has factored into a difficult economic year for much of the country, L. included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, L. is seeking to increase her income and improve her business. She is asking for a loan of $700 US to purchase wood to build a wooden house for her family. By doing so, she will be able to provide good living conditions for her future child and the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase wood to build a house

loans.name: Mrs. Phul Phai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phul P. is a farmer who owns a small piece land to cultivate rice and she is also a silk weaver in the local village. She is a widow with three children who are all attending the local school. Since the second business is going well, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy silk for her weaving. She is the village bank president, who has been selected by the members.

This village bank consists of 18 people located in Kandal village in Takeo province. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Eleven members in this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy silk for weaving

loans.name: Назирчон

texts.ru: Турсунбоев Н. продолжает расширять свою деятельность .Назир  год является клиентом МЗФ Микроинвест. Он занимается услугой по ремонту сотовых трубок. Целенаправленно используя займ он улучшил качество  обслуживания. Назир планирует  расширить свою деятельность  продажей сотовых трубок. На  запрашиваемый займ он хочет закупить сотовые трубки.

loans.use: На закупку сотовых трубок

loans.name: Эркинжон

texts.ru: Ашуров 1977 года рождения. Женат имеет троих детей. Жена домохозяйка помогает мужу по хозяйству. Эркин с детства  ходил с дедушкой на скотный рынок продавать скот. Он 15 лет занимается  этой деятельностью. Эркин покупает скот, откармливает и продает на рынках области. За счет займа он хочет увеличить количество скота и получить больше прибыли.

loans.use: На покупку скота

loans.name: Mrs. Chhorn Ben Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhorn B. is a silk weaver in her village. She is 45 years old and the mother of five childrE.: two of tH. are attending the local school while the others are still at home because they are young. Her husband, Mr. Aom Sreav, is a construction worker. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to weave. She hopes to increase her income to improve her living conditions. Mrs. Chhorn B. is the village bank president who has beE. selected by the members.

Twenty people, who all live in Kandal village in Takeo province, make up this village bank. The members will use their loans for different purposes. Eight members in this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. They allow tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave

loans.name: Биробия

texts.ru: Джумаева Биробия 1966 года рождения. Замужем имеет троих детей . Муж работает маляром в частной фирме. Биробия занимается продажей парфюмерии на базаре Костокоз. Товар она закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Она планирует закупить  новую коллекцию духов и тем самим разнообразить свой ассортимент.

loans.use: На закупку духов

loans.name: Фахриддин

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Рахимбоев Фахриддин-молодой мужчина.Ему 26 лет,женат и имеет двоих маленьких детей.Занимается откормом скота дома.Сам Фахриддин разнорабочий,подрабатывает на стройке,работает у соседей по заказу.Он покупает скот на скотном рынке в Джаборрасуловском районе и откармливает его несколько месяцев.Когда скот готов к продаже,Фахриддин продает его и на вырученные деньги покупает необходимые вещи для семьи.С нашей организацией  это семейка работает почти год и продолжает брать кредит и умножить своё поголовье.

loans.use: закуп скота

loans.name: Чамшед

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Зарипов Джамшед мужчина. Работает аранжировщиком в театре «Кохи Рудаки» города Худжанда. Многие артисты этого театра благодарны ему за то что он профессионально аранжирует музыку. Для улучшения своего деятельности он хочет купить синтезатор.

loans.use: На покупку синтезатора

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат Сулейманова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст  31 год. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама Саломат более 5 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует овощами. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Salomat Sulemanova lives in Rumi District. She's 31 and married with 2 children. Her husband is working in Russia. She has been working by herself in sales for more than 5 years. She has a stall at the market, where she sells vegetables. She plans to use her loan to expand her sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her sales.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Илхом

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Илхом, женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка присматривает за детьми.Илхом торгует на Афган базаре хоз-товарами. Товар он закупает на оптовом рынке города Истаравшана. Он хотел бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого он предпочел взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента и обратился в нашу организацию. Он благодарит инвесторов за поддержку.

loans.use: На закупку стирального порошка и моющих средст.

loans.name: Шухрат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Орипов Шухрат 1976 года рождения. Женат имеет двоих детей. Жена домохозяйка присматривает за детьми. Шухрат с малых лет увлекался игрой на барабане и мечтал стать артистом.
