He is thankful to the microfinance institution for this loan so he can improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is the proud owner of her own in-home daycare business in Massachusetts. In her home country of Ecuador she was also a businesswoman. Ten years ago she came to the United States to start something new and it was natural for her to pursue a business of her own. Teresa is married with two children. Her husband cleans commercial businesses and her two children are grown professionals. 

Teresa has had a low number of children this summer, which can be a common challenge for many daycare providers. To help her through the fluctuation in her income, she has requested a loan from ACCION USA to provide her with working capital and to purchase supplies and toys for the children. This loan will help her to stay in business during the slow season. Without the loan she was worried that she may have to close her doors.

Teresa has been a victim of predatory lending in the past, but working with ACCION USA she says: "I felt secure – they gave me a hope, a medium, a way to continue forward; they’ve opened a pathway to proceed."

Teresa adores children. She says that it is a lot of responsibility to care for other people's children – their safety is her top concern. Currently Teresa has two employees and she has even higher hopes for the future. Teresa's plan is to one day own a daycare training institute where she would train future daycare providers.

loans.use: To use as working capital and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Maria es separada, tiene 44 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un restaurante llamado Estrella del Mar, en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca del Mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de sus 2 hijos.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, carne y comprar mas muebles.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio y apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the communal bank, "Glorioso." She is separated, is 44, and has 2 children. She has a restaurant called "Estrella del Mar" in a rented location near the Magdalena market. She works here every day with the help of her two children. Maria needs a loan of 1050 PEN that she will invest in the purchase of rice, meat, and more furniture. Her dreams are to improve her business and to support her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, meat, and more furniture

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old and single with no children.  She has a business selling fruit juice in the morning in front of her home in the city of Pucallpa.  Local juices are generally made from papayas, bananas, beets, carrots, and apples.  

Maria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for one year and four months and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  She used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in the sale of cooked foods typical of the region.  She plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to purchase a blender, glasses, spoons and plates to implement her current business selling juices.

Maria has a number of goals for the future.  One day she would like to have her own business selling pastries.  She would also like to complete her studies in elementary education.

loans.use: A blender, glasses, spoons and plates (to be used for a business selling juices)

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Angélica es casada, tiene 54 años y 4 hijos, Angélica es técnico dental y tiene un laboratorio dental en un local alquilado, sus insumos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Lima.
Angélica necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. material dental.
Los sueños D. Angélica son que sus hijos salgan adelante siendo profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Angélica is a member of the communal bank, "Glorioso." She is married, is 54, and has 4 children. Angélica is a dental technician and has a dentist's office in a rented location. She gets her supplies in the city of Lima. She needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of dental supplies. Her dreams are that her children get ahead since they are professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of dental materials

loans.name: Hildaura

texts.es:
Hildaura es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Hildaura es viuda, tiene 64 años y 2 hijos, Hildaura venD. cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, además Hildaura venD. ropa a pedido, la gran parte D. sus ventas son al crédito.
Hildaura necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cosméticos.
Los sueños D. Hildaura son tener una tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Hildaura is a member of the Glorioso Community Bank. She is a 64 year old widow and has two children. Hildaura sells cosmetics from a catalog to friends and acquaintances. She also sells clothing. A large part of her sales are on credit. Hildaura needs a loan for 1050 soles, which she will use to purchase cosmetics. Hildaura's dream is to have a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es:
Teodosia es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Teodosia es casada, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Teodosia vende leña en su casa, producto que es adquirido en los diferentes pueblos de la región, además Teodosia vende emoliente (bebida caliente preparada con semillas de lino y hierbas) actividad que realiza por las mañanas y noches.
Teodosia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Teodosia sueña con educar a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Teodosia is a member of the Glorioso Community Bank. She is 35 years old, married, and has 4 children. Teodosia sells firewood out of her house. The firewood is acquired in the different towns of the region. In addition, she sells emoliente (a hot drink that is prepared with flax seeds and herbs) in the mornings and evenings. Teodosia needs a loan for 1050 soles to purchase firewood. Teodosia's dream is to educate her children and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase firewood.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Maria es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Maria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, ropa, y de las ferias compra quesos, cereales, que vende en el mercado de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
Los sueños de Maria son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Solución Community Bank. She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. Maria travels to different markets in the region, where she sells groceries and clothing. At the markets she purchases cheeses and grains, which she sells at the market in the city of Ayacucho. Maria needs a loan for 900 soles to purchase clothing. Maria's dream is for her children to complete their studies and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Nancy Gladys

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Nancy es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Nancy tiene una botica llamada Unión Gómez, en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo, además Nancy vende material quirúrgico a pedido.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicinas.
Los sueños de Nancy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una cadena de farmacias.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Solution cooperative bank. Nancy is married, 40 years old, and has 3 children. She has a boutique called “Gómez Union” in a rented location, an activity she carries out with the help of her son. Nancy also sells medical supplies on order. Nancy needs a loan of 1,800 Peruvian soles, which she will use to invest in the purchase of medicines. Nancy’s dreams are for her children to become professionals, and to own a chain of pharmacies.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase medicines.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Glorioso.
Irene es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Irene vive en el distrito de Chiara en donde tiene un pequeño restaurante, en donde también vende abarrotes en general, bebidas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Además se dedica a la crianza de cuy.
Irene necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y gaseosas.
Los sueños de Irene son ahorrar mas y tener una polleria en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
texts.en:
Irene is a member of the Glorious cooperative bank. Irene is married, 34 years old, and has 2 children. Irene lives in the Chiara district, where she has a small restaurant in which she also sells groceries and beverages. She carries out these activities with her husband’s help. She also raises guinea pigs. Irene needs a loan of 2,100 Peruvian soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and sodas. Irene’s dreams are to save more and to have a poultry store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and sodas.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 23 years old and a single mother of one child.  She has a business purchasing and reselling wood for construction purposes.

Jennifer has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles in wood and plans to use this loan of 2500 soles for the same purpose.  Jennifer will purchase planks, boards and beams.  Much of the wood she sells is used to make widow shutters and to construct houses.  

Jennifer reports that with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos, her business has been growing.  Jennifer's goal is to continue to expand her business.  She would eventually like to have her own warehouse from which she can sell her wood for export.

loans.use: To purchase wood for resale

loans.name: Edith Dina

texts.es:
La señora Edith, es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 44 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente y esta al cuidado de 03 hijos, ella pudo estudiar solo la primaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde la fundación del Banco Comunal, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder adquirir abarrotes tales como, azúcar, fideos, leche, conservas, harina, jugos, huevos, etc. Para su kiosco.

Su deseo es poder llenar su kiosco con mas productos y bien surtidos

A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros.
texts.en:
Edith is a member of the 30th of August cooperative bank, located in the Ilave district of El Collao, in Puno. She is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children in her care. She was only able to finish her education through primary school. She has been working with the Manuela R. movement since the establishment of the cooperative bank. Her first loan of 300 soles served the purpose of helping her buy groceries. Currently, she needs an additional loan of 3,000 soles to buy supplies such as sugar, noodles, milk, preserves, flour, juices, eggs, etc. for her kiosk. Her wish is to fill her store with more products and to keep it well-stocked. She enjoys the reunions and meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sugar, noodles, milk, preserves, flour, juices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Clotilde Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Reyna es soltera, tiene 25 años y 2 hijos, Reyna viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende verduras, cereales y de la selva compra fruta que luego comercializa en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad.
Reyna necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Reyna sueña con que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y tener un puesto estable para su negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna is a partner of "Banco Comunal Solución." Reyna is 25 years old and a single mother of two children. She travels to the Ayacucho forest to sell vegetables and cereals. While in the forest, she buys fruits to sell in the supplies market of the city. Reyna needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles for the purchase of cereals. Reyna dreams of her children completing their education and having a permanent location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Alejandra es casada, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Alejandra vende materiales de construcción, como arena, piedra, ladrillos, en un local propio, los ladrillos los manda hacer en la comunidad de Compañía, sus ventas algunas oportunidades son a domicilio.
Alejandra necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de leña.
Los sueños de Alejandra son comprar un carro y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a partner of the "Banco Comunal Solución." She is married, is 39 years old, and has two children. Alejandra sells construction materials like sand, rocks and brick from her own place of business. She has the bricks made in a community in Compañía. Some of her sales and other opportunities are to residences. Alejandra needs a loan of 900 Peruvian soles which will be invested in the purchase of wood. Alejandra dreams of buying a car and for her children to become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wood.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha es socia del Banco Comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera de 02 hijos, ella tiene estudios de educación superior completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar joyas en la Ciudad de Arequipa para luego venderlo en  Ilave y ferias de la zona.

Su sueño es poner una joyería  y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan mucho los encuentros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Bertha is a partner of "Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto" which is located in Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in Puno. She is 34 years old and is a single mother of two children. She has completed her studies in higher education. For the past six years, Manuela Ramos has been her Field Partner. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian soles, an amount which helped her acquire goods. Now she is asking for a loan of an additional 3,000 Peruvian soles. The loan will help her buy jewelry in Arequipa that she will sell in Ilave and in several markets in the area. Bertha's dream is to open a jewelry shop and to educate her children. She enjoys meeting people and social gatherings.

Translated from Spanish by Cristina Bejarano, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase jewelry.

loans.name: Isabel Esther

texts.es:
La señora ISABEL RAQUEL VALLE VELASQUEZ, tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de OBSTETRICIA, ejercio durante 5 años, pero al casarse se dedico a la crianza de su hijo el cual tiene 3 años de edad y depende económicamente de ella.
ISABEL se dedica  a la preparación de pasteles, bocaditos y tortas.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra productos alimenticios para elaborar sus pasteles, bocaditos, y tortas, como mantequilla, pasas, huevos, vainilla, harina, entre otros.
 Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de un horno industrial puesto que su negocio ha ido incrementándose y necesita preparar con mas frecuencia sus pedidos.
ISABEL sueña con ambientar su domicilio, para poder colocar allí una fuente de soda y vender sus postres.
texts.en:
Sra. Isabel Raquel Valle Velasquez is 32 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of “La Delicias II” Communal Bank. She is an obstetrician who practiced for 5 years. After she got married, she decided to devote herself to raising her son, who is now 3 years old and financially dependent on her. Sra. Isabel generates an income by making and selling pastries, sandwiches and cakes. Her first loan of 300 soles was used to buy ingredients such as butter, raisins, eggs, vanilla, flour, etc. Her current loan of 800 soles will be used to purchase an industrial oven since demand is increasing and she needs to keep up with customer orders. Sra. Isabel dreams of creating a livelier atmosphere for her business by installing a soda fountain and selling desserts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an industrial oven

loans.name: Isabel Raquel

texts.es:
La señora ISABEL RAQUEL V. V., tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito de Moche , provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios superiores de OBSTETRICIA, ejercio durante 5 años, pero al casarse se dedico a la crianza de su hijo el cual tiene 3 años de edad y depende económicamente de ella.
ISABEL se dedica  a la preparación de pasteles, bocaditos y tortas.
El crédito de 300 nuevos soles lo invirtió en la compra productos alimenticios para elaborar sus pasteles, bocaditos, y tortas, como: mantequilla, pasas, huevos, vainilla, harina, entre otros.
 Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de un horno industrial puesto que su negocio ha ido incrementándose y necesita preparar con mas frecuencia sus pedidos.
ISABEL sueña con ambientar su domicilio, para poder colocar allí una fuente de soda y vender sus postres.
texts.en:
32-year old Señora Isabel Raquel V. Velásquez lives in Moche district in Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Banco Las Delicias II. Isabel is a businesswoman who has also studied obstetrics. She practised this profession for five years, but when she got married, she concentrated on raising her son who is now three years old and dependent on her. She now earns her living by baking cakes, snacks, and tarts. Her previous loan of S/.300 loan was used to buy ingredients for the cakes, snacks, and tarts such as butter, raisins, eggs, vanilla, flour etc. This S/.800 loan will be used to buy an industrial oven as her business has been growing, and she needs to bake more frequently in order to fill her customers’ orders. Isabel’s dream is to convert part of her home into a soda fountain and sell her baking there.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven

loans.name: Pablo David

texts.es:
Pablo es un padre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo con su esposa y el último de sus hijos de 20 años de edad que se encuentra estudiando una carrera técnica.

Desde 1997 Pablo posee un pequeño taller en el lugar donde brinda servicios de reparación de  electrodomésticos y aunque su negocio esté lejos de la zona en donde se agrupan otros establecimientos que mantienen la misma actividad, el se las ingenia para seguir brindando este servicio a sus clientes habituales.

El está solicitando por primera vez un crédito de 500 nuevos soles el cual piensa utilizar en la compra de repuestos para la reparación de electrodomésticos, como transistores y circuitos integrados que le ayuden a desarrollar su trabajo de manera eficaz y así ampliar la cobertura de su negocio. Su trabajo es la única fuente de ingreso familiar y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio el sigue manteniendo a su familia y brindando educación a su hijo.

Pablo tiene muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de sus clientes y vecinos, y lo que más anhela es poder solventar los gastos económicos de su hijo hasta que termine su carrera.
texts.en:
Pablo is a 57 year-old father who lives in the city of Chiclayo with his wife and his youngest child, who is 20 years old and who is studying a technical career. Since 1997, Pablo has had a workshop where he provides repair services for household appliances. Even though his business is far from the area where other such businesses are concentrated, he finds ways to keep providing this service to his regular clients. He is requesting his first loan of 500 PEN, which he plans to use for the purchase of parts for repairing electronics, such as transistors and integrated circuits, which will help him to be efficient in his work and expand his business. His work is the only source of family income; it is with much effort and sacrifice that he continues to provide for his family and educate his son. Pablo has very good work and personal references from his clients and neighbors. What he most hopes for is to be able to provide for his son until he has finished his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for repairing electronics

loans.name: Rita Ingrid

texts.es:
La señora RITA INGRID C. D. C., tiene 46 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 4 hijos D. 38, 32, 21, 18 años y solo los dos ultimos depenD. económicamente D. ella porque se encuentran estudiando.
RITA se dedica a la venta D. ropa, en el mercado D. Moche.
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertio en la compra D. mas ropa, D. la ciudad D. Lima para venderlo en su puesto y en su casa.
Este credito D. 800 lo invirtira en la compra D. mas ropa (para niños, damas y caballeros)D. la ciudad D. Lima . RITA sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
46-year old Señora Rita Ingrid C. D. C. lives in Moche district in Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Banco Las Delicias II and has completed 5th graD. of high school. She is a businesswoman and has four children aged 38, 32, 21, and 18, but now only supports the two youngest as they are still studying. Rita earns her living by selling clothing in the Moche market. Her previous loan of 300 soles was used to buy more clothing from Lima to sell from her stall and also from her home. This loan of 800 soles will be used to buy additional clothing (for children, women, and men) from Lima. Rita’s dream is to expand her business and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothing from Lima

loans.name: Eusebia Imelda

texts.es:
L. señora EUSEBIA IMELDA D. L. C. D. H., tiene 59 años, vive en el distrito D. Moche , provincia D. Trujillo, departamento L. Libertad – Perú.
Pertenece al Banco Las Delicias II.
L. empresaria presenta estudios superiores, estudio para profesora D. secundaria y lo ejerció durante 15 años y casarse dejo D. ejercer y se dedicó al negocio D. venta D. ropa junto a su esposo y a L. crianza D. sus hijos.  Tiene 3 hijos D. 38, 35 y 33 años y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. elL..
EUSEBIA se dedica a L. venta D. ropa, zapatos, zapatillas en su domicilio, las cuales las venD. a sus vecinos D. las Delicias, Moche, San Borja, L. Esperanza.
Este crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo invertirá en L. compra D. mas ropa, zapatillas, zapatos para distribuir.
 EUSEBIA sueña con ambientar un espacio en su casa y comprar vitrinas , maniquíes para colocar en exhibición L. ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
59-year old Señora Eusebia Imelda D. L. C. D. H. lives in Moche district in Trujillo province, L. Libertad department, Peru. She is a member of the Banco Las Delicias II. Eusebia is a businesswoman with post-secondary education—she studied to be a high school teacher and then practised her profession for 15 years. When she got married, she left teaching and earned her living by selling clothes alongsiD. her husband, and also raised three children who are now 38, 35, and 33. None of them now depend on her financially. Eusebia sells clothing, shoes, and sneakers out of her home to her neighbours in Las Delicias, Moche, San Borja, and L. Esperanza. She will use the loan of 300 soles to buy more clothing and footwear. Her dream is to equip part of her house with display cabinets and mannequins to display the clothing and footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more dairy products (cheese, "quesillo", "manjar blanco", etc).

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es:
Aquilina es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Aquilina es soltera, tiene 53 años y 1 hijo, Aquilina se dedica a la agricultura en la comunidad de Compañía , produce verduras, alfalfa, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Aquilina necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de semillas.
Los sueños de Aquilina son techar el cuarto piso de su casa y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of the Solución Community Bank. Aquilina is 53, single, and has one child. Aquilina is a farmer in the Compañía community. She produces vegetables and alfalfa. She sells in the Abastos market in the city of Ayacucho. Aquilina needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy seeds. Aquilina’s dreams are to put a roof on the fourth floor of her house and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Solución.
Olga es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 7 hijos, Olga vende gelatinas que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoriamente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Olga necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de vasos y gelatina.
Los sueños de Olga son cambiar de negocio por otro mas rentable y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the Communal Bank “Solución”. She is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has 7 children. She prepares gelatin and then sells it every day in the wholesale market in Ayacucho.

She needs a loan of 750 soles to purchases glasses and gelatin. Olga dreams of pursuing a more profitable line of business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchases glasses & gelatin

loans.name: Vicenta Eliana

texts.es:
La señora Vicenta es socia del banco comunal “30 de Agosto”, en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 51 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 01 hijo, ella cuenta pudo estudiar educación secundaria completa.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 9 años, su negocio es la venta de abarrotes, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para adquirir abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, el préstamo le servirá para poder comprar  sacos de sal para vender en forma ambulatoria.

Su deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de sacos de sal.

A ella le gustan los ahorros.
texts.en:
Señora Vicenta is an associate of the communal bank called "the 30th of August", in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 51 years old, a single woman and mother of 1 son. She tells us that she was able to complete secondary school. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 9 years. Her business is the sale of groceries. Her first loan was for 300 Soles, an amount that allowed her to acquire groceries. At present, she requires an additional loan and has requested 600 Soles. The loan will allow her to buy bags of salt to sell on foot. Her desire is to be become a wholesaler of salt bags. She likes saving.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy salt bags for resale.

loans.name: Virtud Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal virtud inicia su ciclo 18 con 21 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. verduras, helados, artesanías, comida, quesos, frutas, cereales.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 200 soles, 400 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 8,500 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. aceite, arroz, artesanía, carne, verduras, frutas variadas, cereales.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, salir adelante, ahorrar y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The "Virtud" Communal Bank begins its 18th cycle with 21 members. The members have different businesses, such as selling vegetables, ice cream, handicrafts, food, cheese, fruit and cereals. The members need different loan amounts, such as 200 soles, 400 soles and 1,000 soles, which comes to a total of 8,500 soles in loans from the Communal Bank. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of oil, rice, crafts, meat, vegetables, various fruits and cereals. The members dream of improving their businesses, advancing, saving and watching their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of oil, rice, crafts, meat, vegetables, various fruits and and cereals.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Aydee, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Juleñita”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Juli, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 30 años de edad, estado civil soltera, sin hijos y tiene estudios Universitarios (Físico matemático), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru  Jr. Ilave 716.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de abarrotes. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, gelatinas, golosinas y manjares, etc. al por mayor para llevar al Cuzco 

Su deseo es crear una empresa grande tipo mini market.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Aydee belongs to the “La Juleñita” Communal Bank, which is located in the Juli district of the Chucuito province in the Puno area. She is 30 years old and single, does not have any children and has had a college education (Mathematical physics). She lives in the Tupac Amaru Jr. neighborhood at no. 716. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 7 years, with an initial loan of 300 nuevos soles, which she used to buy groceries. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles for the wholesale purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, gelatin, candy and manjar (sweet filling made of condensed milk) to take to Cuzco. Her wish is to create a large business in the mini market style. She likes discussing savings and punctuality at the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, milk, noodles, gelatin and candy

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.en:
Martha is 43 years old and married with three children.  Martha works together with her husband in timber sales.  The family lives in the city of Pucallpa.

Martha has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  Martha used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in a business selling cold drinks that she had at that time.  Martha will use this loan of 2000 soles to purchase timber.  Though she works together with her husband in timber sales, Martha is pleased that her loans provide her with some financial independence.  

Martha's goal is to construct a warehouse from which she can sell her wood.  She also wants to support her son through his studies at a technological institute, a three-year degree.

loans.use: To purchase wood for resale

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 24 años se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles, adicionalmente, todos los días elabora bellos bordados en la comodidad de su casa y los fines de semana, viaja para vender sus productos, los cuales son principalmente lácteos, de esta manera, garantiza para su familia los ingresos necesarios. En todo este tiempo de trabajo y con la experiencia ganada ha podido obtener buenas ganancias necesarias para la manutención de su familia. Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, ella es muy puntual en sus pagos y su historia crediticia es la mejor carta aval que recomienda su responsabilidad. El dinero que viene solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales necesarios para incrementar su producción de bordados y así aprovechar la época de festividades costumbristas de su zona, que es cuando hay mayor demanda de estas prendas.
texts.en:
Claudia is 42 years old. She lives with her husband and their 2 children in their own house. For 24 years she has been dedicated to the sale of edible products. In addition every day she creates beautiful embroidery in the comfort of her home and on weekends she travels to sell her products, which are chiefly dairy products. In this manner, she guarantees for her family the necessary income. In all this time of work and with the experience she has earned, she has been able to obtain good profits necessary for the maintenance of her family. This is her 19th loan with MFP. She is very punctual in her payments and her credit history is the best letter of recommendation for her responsibility. The money that she requests will be invested in the purchase of the necessary materials to increase her production of embroidered goods in order to take advantage of the local period of festival costumes of her zone. That is when there is greater demand for these items.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textile materials for creating embroidered items

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Imilda

texts.es: Imilda tiene 35 años, vive con sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir en todas sus variantes, desde moda casual, hasta deportiva. Esta actividad la realiza en su propio taller de costura, el cual implementó en su propia casa. Imilda trabaja según los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes, quienes generalmente son comerciantes. Recientemente ha incorporado en su negocio el alquiler de trajes de fiesta para damas, que está teniendo mucha acogida entre sus vecinas y amistades. Para un futuro cercano Imilda quiere mejorar las máquinas de coser que tiene a nivel industrial. Esta es la décima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP,  por lo que está muy contenta de seguir siendo parte de su grupo, pues su deseo es continuar con una actitud positiva y responsable. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de tela y cierres para su trabajo textil.
texts.en:
Imilda is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her 2 children. For 10 years she has been making all types of clothing, everything from casual fashion to sportswear. She operates out of a workshop located in her home. Imilda receives orders from her customers, who are retail merchants. Recently she added women’s party dress rentals to her business, which has been well received by her neighbors and friends. In the future, Imilda would like to upgrade her equipment by purchasing industrial sewing machines.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. She is happy to be a part of her communal bank group and hopes that they continue to be positive and responsible. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fabric and zippers for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics & zippers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La señora Ada, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 59 años, 04 hijos, tres que aun dependen de ella.

Nos cuenta que se inicio con la venta de cosméticos desde hace muchos años atrás, gracias a las ganancias obtenidas  logró implementar su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en su misma casa al viene dedicándose desde hace muchos años.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió logro implementar mejor su bodega, hoy sus vecinos y amigos ya le conocen y tiene mucha acogida, sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca y piensa seguir adelante y prosperar con otros negocios.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará abarrotes como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, paquetes de leches y aceites; gaseosas en paquetes de diferentes sabores y tamaños e insumos para la limpieza del hogar e higiene personal. Así de esta manera mantener a sus clientes satisfechos y contentos.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que vale el sacrificio para cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y a  demás mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Señora Ada belongs to the Communal Bank named "Santa Rosa de Lima", district of Juanjui, Mariscal Cáceres province, department of San Martin. She is married and 59 years old with 4 children, three of whom still depend on her for support. She tells us that she started with the sale of cosmetics many years ago. Thanks to the profits she obtained she managed to start her own convenience store business in her own home, to which she has been dedicated for many years. With the first loan that she received she was able to improve her store. Today her neighbors and friends know her well and she has much reknown. Her sales grow by word of mouth and she hopes to continue ahead and to prosper with other businesses. With this loan of 3,000 soles she will buy groceries such as: bags of rice and sugar, packages of milk and oils; carbonated water in packages of different flavors and sizes and supplies for cleaning the home and personal hygiene. In this manner she will keep her happy and satisfied clients. She feels very satisfied with the work that she does. She believes that it is worth the sacrifice to pursue her dreams and goals that she has planned for life. Thus she gives thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for offering their support to her and to other women that want to do well.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase the products she offers in her store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos 02 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Anteriormente Elenita, como le dicen de cariño, se dedicaba a la venta de verduras en el Mercado Central de la Ciudad de Juanjui. Hoy en día se dedica a la venta de ropas usadas, que los realiza en su casa, como también viaja a los pueblos aledaños, en épocas festivas.  Lleva poco tiempo en este tipo de actividad de venta de ropa y nos cuenta que le va muy bien es así que logro ahorrar su dinero que le permitió comprar  mas ropa variada, ya que tiene como meta implementar su negocio con ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, a su edad el trabajo que realiza no le causa mucha molestia, y esta muy tranquila con lo que hace. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio y cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada,  en el barrio ya es muy conocida y es la única que cuenta con este tipo de negocio  y esto le da mayores ventajas para sus ventas y sus precios son muy cómodos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, comprará ropas como pantalones, polos, vestidos y blusas, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Se siente muy contenta, tiene muchas fuerzas aun para seguir adelante, por lo que reconoce el gran apoyo que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos le viene brindando a ella y otras mujeres de la región San Martín.
texts.en:
Ms. Elena O. is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” Microfinance Institute in the Junajui district of the Mariscal Cáceres province, department of San Martín. She is a 40-year-old woman with a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of whom are her dependents and are in school.

Elenita, as she is lovingly referred to, used to sell vegetables at the Central Market in the city of Juanjui. Nowadays, she sells used clothing both from home and at the nearby towns during the holidays. She has not been in this business for very long, but she states that she is prosperous. This is how she managed to save the money she needed to purchase a large variety of clothing because her goal is to launch an apparel business for men, women and children. This job is not very strenuous for a person her age, and she is at ease with what she does.

She still runs the same business and now has faithful customers. She is very well-known in her neighborhood because she is the only person with this type of business. This gives her a sales advantage, and her prices are very reasonable.

With this 1,500.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more apparel like pants, T-shirts, dresses, and shirts for men, women and children. She feels very satisfied and still has the energy to keep getting ahead in life, which is why she recognizes the support that the Manuela Ramos Movement has been giving her and other women in the San Martín region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Elida Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Elida Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y 01 hijo, que aun están bajo su poder.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Angelita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Señora Elida Angélica belongs to the Communal Bank called "Holy Rose of Lima", District of Juanjui, Province Marshall Cáceres, Department of San Martin. She is lives in a shared home. She is 26 years old and has 1 son who is in her care. Her character and desire to fulfill her dreams motivated her to undertake her own convenience store business. The profits from the store allow her to contribute to the economic income of her home. From the start her business has won many clients. Nowadays she counts on many regular clients that come to her store daily to buy because in her store they find all the products that the housewife needs, and because it is she who personally attends them with the charisma that characterizes her. With this loan of 1,000 Soles she will buy rice and sugar in bags; crackers, noodles and salt in packages, milk and preserved fish in boxes and in a variety of brands, eggs in cartons and articles of personal hygiene to continue giving better service to her clients. Angelita, as they say with affection, feels very good to continue working and this very thankful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women such as her to have opportunities to grow in the field where they apply themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries to increase the products she offers in her store.

loans.name: Elith

texts.es:
La señora Elith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 26 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun depende de ella.

Su impulso y empeño de ver a sus hijos profesionales, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de útiles escolares, se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, un local muy bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. 

Las ganancias que genera ayuda al ingreso económico de su familia. En la actualidad, es muy querida por sus clientes y alumnos que acuden a su pequeña librería a comprar, ya que ella cuenta con lo necesario que sus clientes necesitan y es ella misma quien les brinda su atención con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará utiles escolares como: cuadernos grandes y pequeños (cuadrados y rayados), cartulinas y lapiceros en diferentes colores, gomas, cintas y útiles de oficina para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Elith, se siente con muy capaz y es una mujer muy trabajadora, día a día agradece a la vida, por brindarle una gran oportunidad de salir adelante como mujer, igualmente al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por   iniciarla a convertirse en una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Elith belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima Community Bank in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She is in a common law marriage, 26 years old, and has one dependent child. Her desire and effort to see her children become professionals have motivated her to undertake her own business selling school supplies. The business is located in her own house in a place well set up to wait on her customers. The earnings generated help with the family economic income. She is now very dear to her customers and the students who come to her small bookstore to shop. She has what her customers need, and she herself waits on them with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy school supplies like large and small notebooks (square and lined), cardboard, different colors of pens, erasers, tape, and office supplies to continue giving her customers great attention. Elith feels very capable. She is a very hard working woman. Day to day she is grateful for life for giving her a wonderful opportunity to get ahead as a woman. She feels the same about the Moviemento Manuela Ramos for starting to change her into an enterprising woman.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy school and office supplies

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 39 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.

Desde hace muchos años, Elsita se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya sus amigos, vecinos y familiares, conocieron su negocio y sus ventas aumentaron. 

Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco  a poco  fue ahorrando, en la actualidad complementó  su negocio con la venta de  gallinas vivas, ubicada afuera de su casa y cuenta como herramienta principal, una jaula donde se encuentran sus gallinas de chacra, para mostrar a sus clientes y moradores de la Ciudad.

Sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca, ya que su casa se encuentra cerca del Mercado central  en la  sección de venta de gallinas de chacra. 
Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará 150 tercios de leña. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en comprando a diario sus gallinas de chacra. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the "Holy Rose of Lima" Communal Bank, District of Juanjui, Province Marshal Cáceres, Department of San Martin. She is a single woman, 39 years old with 2 children that still depend on her. For many years, Elsita has been dedicated to the sale of firewood. She tells us that at first her sales were a little low, but with time her friends, neighbors and family came to know her and her sales grew. She started with 300 Soles and little by little she saved. She has recently added the sale of live chickens to her business. Located outside of her house is a cage where her poultry is found. The cage acts as her main tool to show her wares to her clients and inhabitants of the city. Her sales grow by word of mouth, since her house is located near the central Market in the small poultry section. With the loan of 2,000 Soles she will buy 150 units of firewood. Part of the money will also be invested in buying poultry. Nowadays she feels like a very accomplished woman, with more goals to achieve and the ability to realize her dreams. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her business and also many women that want to grow businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy firewood and live chickens

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Lucia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”,  Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años; 06 hijos que ya son independientes.

Anteriormente Lucia se dedicaba a la Venta de Abarrotes y sus ganas de salir adelante, con sus propios medios le ha valido para implementar su propio negocio de Alquiler de habitaciones, ubicada en su misma casa.  

En la actualidad tiene cuenta con una clientela ya fidelizada, tiene muchas ventajas ya que se encuentra ubicada cerca de un Instituto y sus inquilinos en la mayoría son alumnos y docentes, que vienen de otras zonas por estudio o trabajo. Sus ganancias los obtiene cada fin de mes, en los pagos de sus habitaciones, nos cuenta que es muy responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así e implementarse en otro tipo de negocio. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 600.00, comprará accesorios, para modificar los servicio higiénicos (baños y duchas) de los cuartos y valdes de pintura, para dar una mejor infraestructura a sus habitaciones.

Lucia, se siente con mucha fortaleza para continuar trabajando y seguir adelante y asegurarse una vejez tranquila y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresivas II” (Progressive Women II), in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province and state. She is married, 42 years old, and has 6 grown children. Previously Lucia sold groceries and her desire to succeed, with her own means, enabled her to open her own business renting rooms in her own home. Today she has a faithful client. She has many advantages in that she is located near an Institute and her renters are primarily students and teachers who come from other zones to study or work. She receives her earnings at the end of each month, in the form of rent payments, and she tells us that she is very responsible with her payments and is thinking of opening another type of business. With the loan for S/600.00, she will buy accessories, modify the bathrooms in the rooms and paint in order to give a better infrastructure to her rooms. Lucia has great strength to continue working and moving forward, assuring herself a tranquil old age and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fruition of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accesories and modify the bathrooms

loans.name: Nilvani

texts.es:
La señora Nilvani, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 36 años y 02 hijos, que son su orgullo para seguir adelante.

Nilvani, es una mujer eficiente, que viéndose en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos, decidió implementar su negocio de venta de abarrotes, que se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa, empezó poco a poco y ahora ya se encuentra mejorada y con productos surtidos y al alcance de sus clientes y amas de casas, donde encuentran lo que necesitan. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta que le va muy bien.  

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,800.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos, fideos en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, utensilios de aseo para el hogar y de higiene personal paquetes de gaseosas de diferentes sabores y marcas para de esta manera satisfacer y brindar una mejor  atención a sus clientes. 

Nilvani, se siente una mujer muy satisfecha con lo que ha  logrado. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y a cumplir sus sueños y metas y otras  mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Nilvani belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Holy Rose of Lima), in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín state. She has a partner, 36 years old, and has 2 children who are her inspiration to succeed. Nilvani is an efficient woman who sees the necessity of generating her own income. She decided to open a business in her home selling groceries. She began little by little, and now she has improved and with the stocked products she meets the needs of her customers and housewives; they find what they need in her store. Today she continues with the same business and she tells us it is going very well. With the loan for S/2,800.00, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, milk and canned fished in a variety of brands, household utensils, personal hygiene products, different brands and flavors of soda pop and in this way satisfy and provide better customer service to her customers. Nilvani feels very satisfied with what she has achieved. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and fulfilling her dreams and goals and those of other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice and sugar, packages of noodles, and more to stock her store

loans.name: Reidelinda

texts.es:
La señora Reidelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 48 años, 04 hijos, el mayor ya independiente y los tres menores aun son estudiantes. 

Reidelinda, es una mujer muy alegre y optimista, que se inicio vendiendo sus frutas en el Mercado Central de su Ciudad, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida, por sus clientes y amistades, que día a día acuden a su negocio a comprar sus frutas.

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden al Mercado a comprar frutas de la Región muy variados  y de muy buena calidad para preparar jugos o para comerlos como postre, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, comprará sacos de naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas, piñas  y plátanos verdes y guineos en racimos para así mantener surtido su negocio y dar una buena  atención a sus clientes y encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Reidelinda, sueña con mantener su negocio, hasta que Dios le de fuerzas para seguir trabajando. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Reidelinda belongs to the Communal Bank “Santa Rosa de Lima” (Holy Rose of Lima), in the Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín state. She is married, 48 years old, and has 4 children, the oldest is grown and the three youngest are students. Reidelinda is a very optimistic, happy woman who daily goes to the market to buy a variety of good quality regional fruits in order to prepare juices or to eat as a desert. It is she who personally serves her customers with a smile. With the loan for S/2,000.00, she will buy sacks of oranges, mandarin oranges, lemons, limes, taperibas (a fruit native to the Peruvian jungle), pineapple, plantains and bunches of baby bananas in order to maintain a stock for her business and provide good customer service so her customers find what they need. Reidelinda dreams of keeping her business; God is the one who provides her the energy to continue working. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping other women who want to learn both professionally and personally.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of oranges, mandarin oranges, lemons, limes and other fruit

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años y 03 hijos, 02 de ellos que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a sus hijos, y tener sus propios ingresos para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por altas y bajas, su carácter emprendedor que le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas prepararas. Rosa María, vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un local acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares por su buena sazón y sus ventas le van muy bien,  lo ofrece en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprara insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites en docenas, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Rosita, como le dicen de cariño, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir con sus ventas de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa María belongs to the "Holy Rose of Lima" Communal Bank in the District of Juanjui, Province of Marshal Cáceres, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home and is 38 years old with 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her. She hopes to see her children become professionals and to have their own income. To be able to achieve this, she decided to undertake her own business. She tells us that her life has had it's highs and lows. With the enterprising nature that has characterized her and her desire to do well, she has been able to start her own business selling prepared foods. Rose María sells her foods in her own home, in an area setup to attend her clients. Little by little she has grown in recognition among her clients, who are her neighbors, friends and relatives, for her flavorful seasonings. Her sales go very well. She offers her foods for sale in the mornings and afternoons. With this loan of 1,000 Soles she will buy supplies for preparing her foods, such as: bags of rice and sugar, chickens and eggs in cartons, bananas in bunches, noodles and oils in dozens, and also kitchen utensils in order to offer quality service. Rosita, as they say with affection, feels motivated by many forces to still continue with her food sales. In the future she would like to augment her business with a well-laid-out restaurant in order to offer her clients better service and attention. She gives thanks to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contributing to the realization of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing foods for sale.

loans.name: Sergia

texts.es:
La señora Sergia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, , Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, los 03 que aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre le ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de panes, ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado en el Mercdo central de su Ciudad, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende diariamente  por las mañanas. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará de diferentes panaderías bolsas de panes, biscochos y kekes, para venderlos a un buen precio, posteriormente en cada una de sus ventas, ganará por porcentaje. Nos cuenta que brinda un servicio de calidad e higiene.

Sergia, se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace  y  agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sergia belongs to the “Santa Rosa de Lima” Communal Bank in the Juanjui district in the Mariscal Cáceres province of the San Martín area. She's married, is 43 years old, and has 3 children that depend on her. Her fighting spirit and desire to succeed on her own have helped her start her own bread-selling business located in a well-situated area in her city's central market, where little by little she has become well-known among her clients. Now she reports that business is going very well. Currently, she continues to be involved with the same business where she sells goods every morning. She has worked for years in this business and she feels happy about what she does. With the loan of 1,000 soles, she will buy bags of bread, sponge cakes and other cakes from different bakeries in order to sell them at a good price and then earn a profit on each one of her sales. She tells us that she provides quality and clean service. Sergia feels at ease and happy with what she does and thanks the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of bread, sponge cakes and other cakes from different bakeries

loans.name: Yunely

texts.es:
La señora Yunely, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Progresivas II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 28 años y es madre de 01 hija, que aun dependen de ella.

Tiene años dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicio de Internet, tipeos e impresiones, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, en un local muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes. Así, siguió superándose y hoy en la actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio, donde brinda el servicio, a los moradores de la comunidad y hoy se encuentra mas implementada. Sus principales clientes son alumnos, ya que esta ubicada cerca de un Instituto.
También se dedica a la venta de zapatos brasileños de la marca Grenda y Azaleia y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00,  realizara sus pedidos a Lima, para el envió de mas zapatos brasileños, para así brindar un mejor servicio, satisfacer y poner a la moda a sus clientes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando cables de red, canaletas y así brindar seguridad a sus clientes.

Hoy en día es una mujer muy independiente y es ella misma quien toma las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Yunely nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas.
texts.en:
Señora Yunely belongs to the "Progressive Women II" Communal Bank in the District of Tarapoto, Province San Martin, Department of San Martin. She lives in a shared home, is 28 years old and the mother of 1 daughter that still depends on her. She has for several years been dedicated to offering Internet service, printing and copies. Her business is located in her own home, in an area well setup to attend to her clients. She has managed this business up to the current day, where she offers this service to the inhabitants of the community and today she is even more well equipped. Her main clients are students, since her business is located near an Institute. Also she is dedicated to the sale of Brazilian shoes of the 'Grenda and Azaleia' brand. She tells us that things are going very well. With this loan of 1,300 Soles she will place her order to Lima for more Brazilian shoes, in order to offer better service, to satisfy her clients and make them fashionable. A portion of the money will also be used to buy network cables and firewalls in order to offer security to her clients. Nowadays she is a very independent woman and she is the one who makes the decisions and administers her business. Yunely tells us that belonging to a group of women has helped her to better know her rights and that together they can ensure those rights are respected.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Brazilian shoes and network cables for her business

loans.name: Ricardo Esteban Emiliano

texts.es:
Ricardo es padre de familia, tiene 47 años de edad y vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos de 21, 16 y 12 años de edad en la casa de sus padres, ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Tiene un automovil que utiliza en el servicio de transporte a escolares desde hace un año y actualmente moviliza a 10 menores hacia sus respectivos centros de estudio.

Ricardo trata de mantener a su familia y pagar la educación de sus hijos trabajando en su vehículo, que es su única fuente de ingreso, pero este, debido a su constante uso, ha empezado a necesitar mantenimiento urgente.

Por este motivo, el está solicitando por primera vez un crédito de 1100 nuevos soles, los cuales piensa invertir en la compra de un nuevo juego de llantas para su vehículo y así poder seguir brindando sustento a su familia.

El es consciente de la responsabilidad que con lleva el trabajar en el transporte de menores de edad, los padres de los niños confían mucho en él.

Su sueño de Ricardo es ver a sus tres hijos convertidos en profesionales y tener la satisfacción de haberles brindado un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a family man. He’s 47 and lives in his parents’ house in the city of Chiclayo with his wife and their three children, aged 21, 16, and 12. For the past year he has used his car to provide a transportation service for school children, and currently he drives 10 children to their respective schools. Ricardo tries to support his family and pay for his kids’ education using his vehicle, which is his only source of income. As a result of its continual use, the car is starting to need urgent maintenance, which is why Ricardo is seeking his first loan, for 1100 soles. He plans to invest in new set of tires, so he can keep bringing in income for his family. Ricardo is aware of the responsibility that comes with transporting children, whose parents put a lot of trust in him. His dream is to see his three children become professionals, and to have the satisfaction of having given them a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a set of tires for his car

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta B. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Marietta is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Marietta owns & operates a fishing business, harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipments

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida T. is from the village of Danao. She is 38 years old. Nida is married. To make a living, Nida operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Nida has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $63) a month for these activities.

In 2007, Nida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Nida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets. This will be the third loan taken out by Nida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets

loans.name: Josephin

texts.en:
Josephin V. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 42 years old. Josephin is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Josephin owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Josephin is just starting this business.

In 2000, Josephin joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Josephin is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 13th loan taken out by Josephin from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Aily

texts.en:
Aily B. is a 47-year-old seasoned businesswoman from Pasay City, a bustling city in the southern part of metro Manila, Philippines. She lives with her husband, Maximo, 46, a butcher.  They have eight children; three are already earning on their own, one is enrolled in college, two are in high school and two are in grade school.

Aily is in the business of selling fresh hog meat to consumers. She has a meat stand along the busy street of her community. She also sells barbecue (a Filipino delicacy where small cuts of meat are seasoned, skewered on thin bamboo sticks and then cooked over charcoal). She earns a total of around 20,000 Philippine pesos (about $419) a month from her business.

She has successfully repaid her latest loan with CCT Credit Cooperative and has applied for a new loan of P11,000.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to buy fresh meat for her business. A portion of the amount will go to her children’s education.

Aily joined the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative in 2003 and has since been enjoying the fellowship of other businesswoman in the community.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy fresh meat

loans.name: Ma.  Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe B., 28, is a rice grower in Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. She helps her husband, Vicente B., till a small parcel of farmland that she inherited from her parents. They have been married a long time and wish to have a baby someday to complete their family.

She would like to ask for a loan worth php 8,000. She will use the loan to buy four bags of urea and one bag of complete fertilizers. The loan will eventually help her out with improving her farm. This, according to her, hopefully will give her family not just an abundant harvest but income as well.

Through the CEVI micro-credit program, she has been able to sustain her livelihood. She enjoys having the CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase four bags of urea and one bag of complete fertilizers

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet Y., a rice grower and mother of five children, is 44 years old and wishes to have a stable income from her farm that can provide for all of her family's needs including food, clothing, and education.

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy one sack of seeds and one quart of herbicides and fertilizers. She thinks that these purchases will eventually result in an abundant harvest and increased family income.

Now, in addition to growing rice, she is starting to raise ducks and is very pleased with the services of CEVI and wishes to avail loans in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a sack of seeds and a quart of herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby S. is 29 years old and the mother of two children. She married very young and she was not able to graduate in college because of lack of money to support her tuition. Currently, she is helping her husband, Joenifer S. to till the 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) farm. In addition to rice, she also raises chickens in their backyard to be able to help supplement their income for all their family daily expenses.

Ruby is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy thirty liters of fuel and two bags of complete fertilizer.

Ruby is convinced of the value of the wide services offered to her by CEVI. She doesn't just have loans but she receives training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase thirty liters of fuel and two bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn A. is 42 years old and is the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming and what she does on her farm is help her husband till the land and sow quality rice seeds for an abundant harvest. Currently, they are tilling a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. While waiting for the harvest, she is also planting vegetables in their backyard.

Rosalyn would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. The loan will be used to buy two bags of complete fertilizer and four bags of urea fertilizer.

Because she has already transplanted their rice seedlings, she hopes that by buying the fertilizers it will help increase their yield.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of complete fertilizer and four bags of urea

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda A. is 51 years old and is the mother of three children. Her business is rice farming. Up to now, she still helps her husband get everything done on the farm to ensure that they will reap a bountiful harvest.

Erlinda requested a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She intends to use the loan to purchase a quart of herbicide and a quart of insecticide.

Now, she actively participates in CEVI cluster meetings. She is very pleased with CEVI services, especially that they are offering the lowest interest rates among MFI's in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase a quart of herbicide and a quart of insecticide

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino D., is the 52-year-old father of four children. His business is rice farming and he started tilling a 4-hectare (10-acre) farm when he married Amelita Dequino. The income that he gets from growing rice has gone far in supporting the daily needs of his family.

Saturnino is asking if he could obtain a loan from CEVI to support his business. He said that the loan will definitely go to purchasing five bags of complete fertilizer and three bags of potassium fertilizer.

Saturnino is actively participating in the CEVI micro-credit program. He likes CEVI because they are offering the lowest interest rates among micro-finance organizations in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase 5 bags of complete fertilizer and 3 bags of potassium fertilizer

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
