Beverly B. is a hard working farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She always makes sure that everything needed for her farm is provided to ensure a quality rice harvest. She has four children and a supportive husband, Edgardo B., who helps her manage the 3-hectare rice field.  

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 1 quart of Nominee herbicide and fertilizers.

She is pleased with the services offered by CEVI. According to her, CEVI had the lowest interest rates among micro-finance organizations in the Philippines.

loans.use: To purchase 1 quart of Nominee herbicide and fertilizers

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily D. is a 27 year old married farmer in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur.  She is excited to have a baby. She dreamed to finally have a son so that she can teach him how to plant rice and have an abundant harvest in the farm.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase 1 unit of sprayer, 2 sacks of fertilizers, and other farm items. She thinks that by doing so, she will reap a better yield and earn a bigger income from her farm.

She is very pleased with CEVI's humble efforts for the poor. CEVI, according to her, is offering the lowest interest rates compared to the other MFI she has seen before.

loans.use: To purchase 1 unit of sprayer, 2 sacks of fertilizers and other farm items

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P. is a 35 year old rice farmer.  She is having difficulty financing her farm. She said that her harvest and the income from her farm is what her family depends on for buying food, clothing, school tuitions, and supporting their entire family daily cost.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers, herbicides, and seeds.

She is happy with CEVI's services especially in that her loans whether big or small will earn only 2% interest a month. In CEVI, she met different entrepreneurs and learned something from them about their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, herbicides and seeds

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah L. is 21 years old and her business is rice-farming. What she does is help her husband till their 2-hectare (5-acre) rice field. She also helps in selling the harvest to her friends, neighbors and regular buyers. The income from her farm, she said, is helpful enough in buying food and clothing and in paying the tuition of her children and their family daily costs.

Dinah is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, herbicide and rice seed. 

She likes the services of CEVI because their interest rate is only 2% per month which is the lowest among the micro-finance organizations in the Philippines that she loaned from before.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, herbicide and rice seed

loans.name: Mukama Talemwa A Bageya Jessica Group

texts.en:
B. Jessica is using this loan to purchase yeast, millet and so forth, for making local brew to sell. The loan is improving her business so that she is able to pay school fees for her children and look after her family's needs. Her hope is to set up a cloth business in the future for extra income.

B. Jessica is the representative of her group. She is 35 years old and married with four children. Three of her children are going to school and she is looking after three dependents that also go to school.

loans.use: To purchase yeast, millet and so forth for making local brew

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel C. is a 29-year-old rice grower from Bunawan, Agusan Del Sur. He is also the young father of two children. He wants to achieve success, especially in having an abundant harvest to provide for the needs and demands of his family.

Roel is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to purchase insecticide, two bags of ammonium sulfate fertilizer, and other farm inputs. These, according to him, will help the size of his harvest and his income as well.

Roel likes CEVI because it offers very low interest rates (2% a month). He said that, aside from loan, he also receives insurance and training from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase insectide, two bags ammonium sulfate fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mukama Talemwa Nagobi Rebecca Group

texts.en:
N. Rebecca is twenty three years old and is married with two children. She has operated a spare-parts shop for over five years. She is using the loan to buy shop items – that is, spare parts for bicycles – in much more volume.

Being so encouraged, Rebecca’s future hope is to enlarge her business and obtain another shop aside from the one that sells spare parts.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for bicycles in much more volume

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley B., 29 years old, is managing a 1 hectare rice field. She has one child and a supportive husband who also helps her manage the farm. Their harvest is intended for family consumption but, because they also need money to cover their daily expenses, they have decided to sell some of their grain to their neighbors.

Shirley is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will buy two sacks of potash, two bags of fertilizer and herbicides to support her farm. She is hopeful, and very optimistic, that her loan will result in a better harvest in the future. She likes CEVI because they offer very low interest rates (2% a month) to their clients. Aside from that, she receives training and insurance from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase potash, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Rosalea

texts.en:
51-year-old Rosalea J. is a rice-grower in Bunawan, Agusan del Sur. She doesn't have a child. She owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm and now she doesn't have enough money to buy fertilizer because she already spend it in paying the laborers during land preparation. The rice-farm that she manages is her only treasure so that she wants to preserve it and make it flourish.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 to support her business. She will use the loan to purchase two sacks of urea fertilizer and insecticide.

She chose CEVI because of its low interest rate. CEVI also gives training and insurance coverage, aside from the loans that it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of urea fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Tweyambe Kawala Rose Group

texts.en: K. Rose has had a charcoal business for almost four years. She is using this loan to purchase bags of charcoal to increase her stock. She is 28 years old and a married lady with four children. She is also taking care of two more dependents. She is a hardworking and inspiring business lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn L., 35 years old is having difficulty budgeting her money to buy the needs of her home. She is a rice grower too and when she is not busy doing some chores in their house, she helps her husband till the farm to have food to eat at their table. She doesn't have child at this time. She really dreams of having at least one child, so that they will be truly a complete picture of family.

She would like to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy 5 sacks of seeds and karate insecticides.

She chose CEVI for its low interest rate which is 2% per month. Aside from loans, she also receives training and insurance from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase seed and insecticide

loans.name: Tweyambe Kadama Betty Group

texts.en:
K. Betty is group representative of Tweyabe, she is a married business-woman aged forty-years old and blessed with six children, all in school. Additionally she is looking after four dependents that are also going to school.

K. Betty has a maternity home where by she helps women deliver babies well. She has been in this business so far for sixteen years. She is using the loan to acquire maternity equipment such as gloves, medications, etc. for safe delivery of babies. She is always happy and encouraged when she helps mothers to give birth safely to healthy babies. Her dream is to obtain a shop which will serve her customers whenever they are in need of anything.

loans.use: To acquire maternity supplies

loans.name: Melma

texts.en:
Melma D. is a rice grower and a mother of two children. She dreams of improving her business and buying another farm. Currently, she has an almost two hectare rice field and 2 carabaos. She said that she just had her planting last week. Now, she is a bit worried about where to get money to buy fertilizer to improve the soil condition.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community economic Ventures Inc (CEVI). She will use the money to purchase 2 sacks of Urea, rice seeds, and other farm inputs.

She really appreciates CEVI's efforts in serving poor people like her. She said in CEVI everybody is able to pay their loans because it has the lowest interest rates. She also said that aside from loans, CEVI also gives insurance coverage to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en:
Ma. Linda D. is a 41-year-old rice grower and mother of two. She is also a chicken, pig and duck farmer. She has been in these various businesses to help her husband earn income to pay for the food, clothing, electricity, tuition and daily costs of their family.

She would like to ask for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos. She will use the loan to purchase 3 sacks of rice seeds, urea, and insecticides.

She is very pleased with the CEVI credit services. She doesn't just receive loans with very low interest, but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loans.name: Lugedo Nakitadwe Sylvia Group

texts.en: N. Sylvia is a young businesswoman of twenty-six representing the Lugendo women's group. She is married and  blessed with two children. She has been in the clothing business so far for three years. She is requesting the loan to purchase variety of clothing to increase her stock and add capital to her business to meet her customer demand. She is an active businesslady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To expand clothing store inventory

loans.name: Lugendo Kagoya Rehema Group

texts.en: K. Rehema, a forty-five year old businesswoman, represents this group. She is married and blessed with five children, all of whom go to school. She deals in used clothes and has been in business for three years. She sells ladies' clothing, that is, skirts, blouses, dresses, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' clothing, probably she wants to add value to her business. She is an encouraging lady and her future plan is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn S., a 29 year old mother of three, is a rice grower in Sta. Josefa Agusan del Sur. She is helping her husband, Marcial S., till and prepare the land for their next planting. The income of her business is what she utilizes to buy milk for her youngest child as well the food, clothing and daily costs of their home.

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and herbicides. She believes that these things are indispensable to have healthy rice and an abundant harvest.

She likes CEVI's services very much. In CEVI, she said, you don't just receive loans of the lowest interest rate, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: Fertilizer and herbicide

loans.name: Lugendo Namuwaya Mary Group

texts.en: Mary N. is twenty-three years of age. She is a single mother blessed with three children and one dependent going to school. She is a tailor and she has been tailoring for over four years. She will use the loan to purchase material for making dresses, uniforms, and so forth for her customers. Her business makes it possible for her to purchase what she wants. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase material for making dresses, uniforms, etc.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela P. is currently in the business of selling beer and alcohol at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Manuela is 29 years old and is married with a husband that is a builder. She has 2 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Lugendo Kauma Sania Group

texts.en: K. Sania is a married businesslady representing her group. She is blessed with two children going to school and additionally she is looking after two dependents that are also going to school. K. Sania has been in the charcoal business for four years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to improve her business. She is a hardworking free healthy lady whose dream is to construct a house.

loans.use: To buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Silverward Nakakade Florence Group

texts.en: N. Florence has a grocery store which she has been operating for over three years. She is 24 years old and a married lady blessed with one child who is going to school. She is also looking after four dependents who also go to school. She is using this loan to purchase grocery items such as tomatoes, passion fruits, avocados, onions, etc. Her business is improving so fast. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: For purchasing grocery items such as tomatoes, passion fruits, avocados, onions, etc.

loans.name: Silverward Mugera Mary Group

texts.en: M. Mary has been operating a clothing business for two years. She is 25 years of age and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is using this loan to purchase more clothing to add stock to her business. She is a hardworking and inspiring business lady whose dream is to educate her children and enlarge her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Buligo United Nabatazi Shifa Group

texts.en: N. Shifa is thirty-years old, married with two children, of whom one child is schooling. She has been selling soft drinks for one year so far. She is using the loan to purchase a variety of fresh fruit for making juice and soft drinks such as water, sodas, passion fruit juice, Splash, Safi, and so forth for sale. She is a hard-working lady whose future hope is to work very hard to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fresh fruit for making juice, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Buligo United Anyago Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is thirty-four years old, married with one child, and looking after two dependents, going to school. She operates a business selling used clothes from market to market. She has been in her business for ten years. She is using the loan to improve her business, that is, buying more clothes for sale. She wishes to prosper at least if, God willing, she wants to obtain a house.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Iyau

texts.en:
Iyau E. is currently in the business of selling various items in her shop and is requesting a loan to expand her stock. Iyau is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her stock

loans.name: Buligo United Edith Nabirye Group

texts.en: Edith N. is thirty-five years of age, married with two children, both going to school. She has been in the grocery business for three years. She is using the loan for purchasing groceries such as sweet potatoes, cassava, and also bags of charcoal. Before she was receiving loans, she could bring back two bags of charcoal, two bags of sweet potatoes and some cassava, but now she is bringing back more than that, at least four bags of each sort. She is so encouraging and a hard-working business woman whose future hope is to construct a house.

loans.use: For purchasing groceries such as sweet potatoes, cassava, and also bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is currently in the business of selling beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more beer to sell. Lucia is 42 years old and married to a husband who is a businessman. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a little store for selling foodstuffs.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more beer to sell

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 Namagogwe Sauti Group

texts.en: N. Sauti has had a new clothing business for six years. She is a business woman, age 45, married and blessed with nine children: of whom, five are going to school. In addition, she is taking care of two siblings who are also in school. She is using this loan to add capital to her business so she can purchase bags of charcoal in much greater volume – that is, more than ten bags of charcoal for resale. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to purchase a motorcycle to use for daily income to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 South C Isabirye Hadija Group

texts.en:
I. Hadija is using her loan to purchase used clothing to sell. She is an active woman, age fifty years old. She is married and blessed with ten children. Seven children are still going to school, and she is also looking after three orphans who are going to school. Her dream is to educate her children. 
I. Hadija is representing this group.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ijura

texts.en:
Ijura E. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery. Ijura is 33 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel at Gumbo market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open a bakery

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 East Namawa Mutesi Group

texts.en: N. Mutesi is 35 years old, married with five children, and taking care of three dependents also attending school. She has been operating her business of selling used clothes for over five years. She will be utilizing the loan to purchase more used clothes for sale. She is an encouraging business lady whose dream is prospering.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes for resale

loans.name: Idongi

texts.en:
Idongi V. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials. Idongi is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has two children and her children attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar and stock more alcohol and crates of beer to sell.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase brewing materials

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 East Namagada Betty Group

texts.en:
Betty N. is a representative of her group. She is 38 years old, married and blessed with eight children who are going to school. Also, she is taking care of two dependents who attend school. She has sold used clothing for ten years.

She is using the loan to purchase used clothing in bulk to expand her business. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is prospering and she is trying very much to uplift her family.

loans.use: To purchase used clothing in bulk for resale

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 East Basalaki Mwayikuma Group

texts.en: Basalaki M. is 31 years old. She is blessed with seven children going to school and she is taking care of two dependents within her family. She has a video library where she sells movies and recorded music and rents movies, so far for one year. She is using the loan to purchase items such as movies and so forth for her customers. According to her, her business is beneficial to her community in that is she is bringing a service to her customers, because people from her area could collect movies from Iganga town, but now the library is closer. She is a creative married businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase movies for her video library

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фотима - женщина, которая кредитуется несколько лет. Она торгует на оптовом рынке «Солор» конфетами. Сейчас, в сезон разгара свадеб, она хочет пополнить ассортимент своего товара.  Фотима хочет получить займ в сумме 7000 сроком на 8 месяцев. Она благодарит KIVA за поддержку и понимания.

loans.use: Закуп конфет

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 Tamubula Jemia Group

texts.en: Jemia T. is 40 years old, married with seven children all attending school, and she looks after three orphans who are also in school. For ten years she has had a business buying and selling matooke (bananas). She is using the loan to purchase bunches of matooke (bananas) in much more volume for sale. The loan is also adding capital to her business in improving the stock. She is encouraging and a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is prospering.

loans.use: To purchase bunches of matooke (bananas) for sale

loans.name: Tojidin

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Тоджидин торгует мужской одеждой на базаре. У него качественный товар, поэтому имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Тоджидин кредитуется у нас с 2008 года. Он успешно закончил два предыдущих займа и теперь запрашивает новый займ для закупки летних мужских одежд.

loans.use: Закуп летних  мужских одежд.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Мавлюда  уже 2 год кредитуется. За это время она показала себя как порядочный клиент. За период кредитования у неё улучшалось семейное положение. Она на кредит закупает сезонные ткани. У неё очень много клиентов.  Мавлюда хочет получить займ в сумме 5000 сроком на 4 месяцев.

loans.use: Закуп тканей

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 Nanyoga Nalongo Group

texts.en: Nalongo Nalongo is 50 years old. She is blessed with ten children, six of whom are going to school, and she takes care of eight siblings who are also going to school. She is utilizing the loan to purchase clothing. Also, she is a tailor and after sewing or making clothes, she puts them out for sale. Her business is improving and she is happy that she is surviving. She is an encouraging and hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 North Kwayidi Alaisa Group

texts.en: Alaisa K. is 45 years old. She is married with eight children, one of whom is going to school. Also, she is taking care of three dependents who are also schooling. She has a soft drinks business selling juice like splash, Safi, soda, fresh passion fruits, water and so forth. She is using the loan to purchase the soft drinks mentioned above for resale. She is operating this business to earn a living and moreso to educate her children. She is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to construct a house and educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Nakalama C 1 North Muwanika Aisha Group

texts.en: Aisha M. is a married business lady who is 29 years old. She is blessed with four children, three of whom are going to school. She is a hardworking business lady who buys and sells cattle. She is using the loan for adding capital to her business by purchasing cattle and transporting them from villages to market place for sale. She is an active lady whose future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and transport them from villages to market place for sale

loans.name: Hurshedjon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тагойев Хуршедчон Муродалиевич – родился 1985 году в районе Гиссар. После учебы в Вузе он устроился на работу в МВД РТ инспектором. Он с детство мечтал иметь собственное авто. Услышав об условиях нашей организации, захотел участвовать. Хуршедчон хочет получить займ в сумме 4400 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев и купить себе автомобиль.

loans.use: Покупка автомобиля

loans.name: Lidia

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 



Филимонова Лидия Николаевна родилась 1945. Она замужем и имеет  2 детей.  Лидия Николаевна работает в Психиатрической Больнице г. Душанбе старшей медсестрой. У нее мизерная зарплата. Она хочет получить займ в сумме 2300 сомони сроком на 8 месяцев  и  сделать косметический ремонт квартиры. Она благодарна инвесторам KIVA за финансирование и поддержку.

loans.use: Ремонт квартиры

loans.name: Sailon

texts.ru:
Негматова Сайлон  1971 3 дети вдова портниха 10000 12 мох 

Сайлон – 38 лет. Вдова, мать 3-х детей. Она занимается любимым делом больше 10 лет. Она – портниха. Год назад она открыла свой ателье, где шьют на заказ постельное белье, а также национальные платья. Сайлон хочет получить займ в сумме 10000 сомони сроком на 12 месяцев для закупа х/б тканей для постельного белья.

loans.use: Закуп Х/Б тканей для постельного белья

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr: Fanta D. est une femme de 37 ans, mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK 1 depuis deux ans et y a reçu quatre (4) prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Son petit commerce d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron lui procurera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Fanta D. is a woman of 37, married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack 1 for two years and has received four loans which she has always reimbursed in a timely manner. Her little business selling palm oil, honey, and lemons brings in income that permits her to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing various items for re-sale

loans.name: Angélique

texts.fr: Angèle M., 39 ans, mariée est mère de 03 enfants. Elle membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK depuis deux ans et demi et a reçu quatre prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron et les bénéfice générés de son activité lui permettent de participer à la nourriture de la famille et à la santé de ses enfants. le prêt de 300000 francs CFA qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois
texts.en:
Angèle M., 39, is married and the mother of 3 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack for two and a half years and she has received four loans which she has always reimbursed without difficulty. She sells palm oil, honey, and lemons and the income from her little business permits her to help feed her family and see to the health of her children.

The loan of 30,000 F CFA that she is requesting will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise her income to strengthen her capacity to support herself

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline M. est une femme de 39 ans, mariée et mère de deux (2) enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK 1 depuis trois ans et demi et y a reçu sept (7) prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés régulièrement. Son petit commerce d'huile de palme, de miel et de citron lui procurera des bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins familiaux. son prêt de 400000 francs CFA sera remboursé en une seule échéance au bout de six mois
texts.en:
Jacqueline M., 39, is married and the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack 1 for 3 and a half years and has received 7 loans which she has always reimbursed correctly. Her little business selling palm oil, honey, and lemons brings in profit that allows her to support her family.

Her loan of 40,000 F CFA will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her inventory in order to raise her income

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.fr: Marie Louise M., 32 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MPACK1 depuis deux et a reçu quatre fois de suite des prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. les 300000 francs CFA qu'elle remboursera en une seule échéance au bout de six mois, lui procureront des bénéfices qui lui permettront de soutenir son mari dans les besoins de la famille et la santé des enfants.
texts.en:
Marie Louise M., 32, is married and raising her 3 children. She has been a member of the Village Bank of Mpack 1 for two years and has received 4 loans in a row, which she always reimbursed without difficulty.

The 30,000 F CFA will be reimbursed in one single repayment at the end of 6 months, and will help her earn profit that will permit her to help her husband support the family and cater for the health of the children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 10 jerrycans of palm oil, 6 containers of honey, and 15 containers of lemons

loans.name: Dandy

texts.es:
Dandy trabaja como transportista tiene una movilidad de servicio público en la ciudad de La Paz, es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo cual cubre la manutención de su esposa, la cual se encarga de las labores de casa, tiene su pequeño hijo, viven en casa de su tía ubicado en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para el cambio de motor de su movilidad ya que por el permanente uso empezó a tener fallas mecánicas.
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado.
texts.en:
Dandy works as a taxi driver. He operates a public service vehicle in the city of La Paz. This is his main source of income with which he pays for the maintenance of his wife, who takes charge of the housework and their small son, They live at the home of his aunt located in the zone of Villa Nuevo Potosí of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to replace the engine in his taxi, since it has begun to fail mechanically from constant use. This is the third loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies Impro to offer him the requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a  motor and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel vive en la zona Belen, calle “P”  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos  los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar.

El Sr. Se dedica a la confección de chamarras y chalecos adecuados para el clima frío de la región, dicha producción lo vende en la ciudad de Oruro y en centros mineros.

También se desempeña como pastor de una iglesia evangélica con sede en la zona

El crédito lo destinara  como capital de trabajo, en la adquisición de materia prima  y así aumentar su producción. 
 
Es el segundo  crédito con Impro y el segundo  via Kiva la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Daniel lives in the Belen zone, "P" street of the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and their children, who are all school age. Daniel is dedicated to the making of jackets and vests appropriate for the cold climate of the region. He sells his products in the city of Oruro and in mining centers. He also serves as the pastor of an evangelical church with headquarters in the zone The loan will serve as working capital, in the acquisition of supplies in order to grow his production. This is the second loan with Impro and the second one via Kiva. The evaluation carried out qualifies Impro to offer him the credit.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to make warm jackets and vests for sale.

loans.name: Vanessa Kristabel

texts.es:
Vanesa, se dedica a la venta de perfumes y cosméticos en los colegios oficinas y mercados, es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder ayudarse en los gastos de alimentación y educación de la universidad.
Vive en la zona de obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de perfumes y cosméticos, y otros)
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Vanesa sells perfumes and cosmetics in markets and school offices. It is the only source of income that she has to help herself with her food and educational expenses. She lives in her parent’s home in the Obrajes zone of La Paz. The loan will be used for working capital to buy perfume, cosmetics, and other items. This is her third loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a good client with her payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Marythza

texts.es:
Marythza, vende perfumes y cosméticos en todas las oficinas y vecinos de la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz
Vive en la zona de Alto obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa de sus suegros..
El crédito será destinado para el capital de inversión (compra de perfumes, cosméticos, y otros productos de belleza).
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Marythza sells perfumes and cosmetics in all the offices and to her neighbors in the southern zone of La Paz city. She lives in her in-laws’ home in the Alto area of La Paz. The loan will be used as working capital (to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and other beauty products). This is her 2nd loan with Impro. Her credit history qualifies her as a good client with regard to her previous payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CAPITAL DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto, es comerciante vende mercadería, viaja a el interior del país para  la compra de electrodomésticos y vajillas.
Vive en la zona de Villa Armonia de la ciudad de La Paz. En casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para el capital de trabajo ( vajillas ropa, y electrodomésticos.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Roberto is a storekeeper. He travels to the interior of the country to buy electrical appliances and dishes. He lives in his own house in the Villa Armonia area of the city of La Paz. This loan will be used for business (dishes, clothes, and electrical appliances). This is the first time he has applied for a loan from Impro. His desire to work has given him the opportunity to have access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Marcela vive en la c/ J. Choquehuanca de la zona Villa Nueva Potosi en la ciudad de La Paz, 
 
La señora vive junto a sus hijos y se dedica a la venta de hortalizas, por las distintas ferias que se realizan en la zona de Calacoto

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marcela lives on J. Choquehuanca Street, in the Villa Nueva Potosi area in the city of La Paz. She lives with her children and sells vegetables in the various street markets in the area of Calacoto. Thanks to previously granted loans, she has a small amount of business capital, which has enabled her to have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Carmen Maruja

texts.es:
Carmen vive en la AV/Buenos Aires de la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz.
 
La señora vive junto a sus hijos y trabaja como portera dentro del mismo Celegio, en donde  tiene puesto de venta de dulces.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen lives on Buenos Aires Avenue in the Tembladerani district of the city of La Paz. She lives with her children and works as a school caretaker. She also sells candy from a stand in the same building where she works.

Thanks to her previous loans, she was able to secure operating capital to help her improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ronilda

texts.es:
Ronilda vive en la c/Caupolican la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad D. La Paz
 
Ella, vive en alquiler junto a sus hijos, trabaja como empleada y se dedica a la venta D. productos D. la canasta familiar (arroz, fideos, edredones, aceite) los cuales los venD. en la misma empresa donD. trabaja.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital D. trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones D. vida
texts.en:
Ronilda lives on Caupolican Street in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz.

She lives in a rented home with her husband and children. She works as a housekeeper and sells household items (rice, noodles, cooking oil, and comforters) at the same company in which she works.

Thanks to her previous loans, she has some working capital with which she has obtained better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ronald Agustin

texts.es:
Ronald vive en la c/San Cristobal la zona Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz
 
El señor vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hijos, trabaja en su propio taller de costura, realiza costura de chalecos a pedido y se dedica a la venta en la zona de la plaza Eguino.

Gracias a los préstamos otorgados anteriormente, cuenta con un pequeño capital de trabajo con el cual tiene  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ronald lives in the San Cristobal housing development of the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz.

He lives in his parents’ home with his children. He works in his own garment factory in which he makes custom-order vests that he sells at the Eguino Plaza.

Thanks to his previous loans, he now has some working capital with which he has obtained better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Doris Patricia

texts.es:
La Sra. Doris S. cuenta con un negocio de salon de belleza que opera bajo el nombre de "BEAUTIFUL IMAGE" tiene 7 años de tener su negocio, ella cuenta con muchos clientes fijos ya que Doris hace un buen trabajo en los cortes de pelo y tintes. los servicios que sus clientes prefieren es el lavado y sacado de cabello, tintes, rayitos. su negocio tiene un amuy bonita apariencia y cuenta con todas las herramientas para poder brindar un servicio de calidad. el negocio esta ubicado en la colonia Arturo Quezada de la ciudad capital, tambien en su negocio ella vende shampoos, cremas, acondicionadores, esmaltes para uña y una gran variedad de productos para belleza.
doris abre su negocio desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. ella es una persona cristiana y asiste a la iglesia por las tardes, ella tiene la ayuda de la hija en el negocio, su hija hace los trabajos de pedicure y manicure.
Doris es casada, tiene una hija y un hijo. tambien tiene un nieto.
ella necesita el dinero para la compra de mercaderia al por mayor, ya que sus clientes le piden estos productos.
ella es muy amable y simpatica, su mayor sueño es llegar a tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Doris S. owns a beauty salon called "BEAUTIFUL IMAGE." She has been in business for 7 years and has many faithful customers because of her skills in cutting and dying hair. She washes, dries, dyes, and highlights hair. Her salon is very appealing, and she has all the tools she needs to provide high quality services.

Her business is located in the Arturo Quezada housing development in the capital city. She also sells shampoos, conditioners, lotions, nail polish, and a great selection of other beauty products.

Doris operates her business from 8:30 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She is a Christian woman who attends church in the evening. She gets help from her daughter, who provides manicures and pedicures.

Doris is a married mother with a daughter and son. She also has a grandson. She needs this loan in order to purchase the merchandise that her customers ask for at wholesale prices.

She is very kind a likable. Her biggest wish is to someday own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase hair dyes, shampoos, hair treatments, lingerie, and fragrances

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edwin Edgardo

texts.es:
el sr. Edwin M. tiene 27 años de edad y es residente de la colonia San Francisco, el tiene un  negocio en el cual vende accesorios para telefonos moviles, los productos que el vende son protectores, cobertores, cargadores de carro y pared, baterias y pantallas para celulares, este negocio lo tiene hace 6 años, anteriormente el vendia repuestos para vehiculos en el parque el obelisco y tambien se dedicaba a la albañileria.
el tiene un hijo, esta casado y su esposa es ama de casa, con este negocio el logra sacar adelante su hogar, el necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia al por mayor, quiere abastecerse de mucho producto para poder tener para varios meses. tambien quiere comprar diferentes estilos.
texts.en:
Mr. Edwin M. is 27 years old and lives in the San Francisco housing development. He owns a cellular phone accessory business, selling products like covers, cases, car and wall chargers, batteries, and screens. He has been in business for 6 years. He used to sell spare parts for cars at the El Obelisco Park, and he also worked as a bricklayer.

He is a married father with one son. His wife is a homemaker, but he has managed to support his household with this business. He needs this loan in order to purchase more merchandise at wholesale prices. He wants to stock up with enough products to last him several months. He would also like to purchase a variety of styles.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cellular phone accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Rogelio

texts.es:
el sr. francisco H. tiene 41 años de edad, el tiene un negocio de venta de repuestos y accesorios para carro, el anda su producto en su carro pick-up y se pone frente a una pollera en un bulevar muy transitado en la ciudad capital, este punto es muy estrategico ya que por ahi pasan  muchos carros todos los dias. antes el vendia en el parque el obelisco.
el vende forros para timon, gatas, llaves, halogenas, radios, parabrisas, antenas, tapa sol, copas para rines etc.
el tiene 4 hijos de los cuales a logrado darles alimentacion y estudio, con ellos tambien vive su madre la cual es una persona de la tercera edad a quien tambien el provee los medicamentos y alimentos, ella es una persona que pasa enferma.
el necesita el credito para surtir mas su negocio. comprar al por mayor que asi es como se obtienen mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco H. is a 41-year-old man who sells car accessories and spare parts. He sells his products out of his Pick-up truck in front of a chicken restaurant on a bustling boulevard in the capital city. This is a very strategic location because many cars pass by every day. He used to sell his products at the El Obelisco Park.

He sells steering wheel covers, jacks, keys, halogen lamps, car stereos, windshields, windshield covers, antennas, hubcaps, etc.

He has 4 children, to whom he has managed to provide sustenance and an education. His elderly mother lives with them, and he must also provide her with food and medication, as she is sick quite often.

He needs this loan in order to purchase more products wholesale because that is how one can obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car accessories and spare parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Dagoberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose R. tiene 44 años de edad, el tiene un negocio de venta de accesorios para carros y herramientas para carros, lo tiene ubicado en el bulevar miraflores de la ciudad capital, este lugar es muy transitado, es una de las vias mas transitadas de la ciudad capital. el antes se dedicaba a vender electrodomesticos, viajaba a guatemala a comprarlos, pero en dicha actividad no le fue muy bien y decidio vender este tipo de producto.
el tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 2 dependen de el, con este negocio el ha logrado hacerle pequeñas remodelaciones a su casa, el tiene el apoyo de su esposa con los gastos del hogar ya que ella tambien trabaja para aportar con los gastos del hogar.
el desea comprar mas producto yal por mayor ya que quiere tener mercaderia como unos 4 meses.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose R. is a 44-year-old man who sells car tools and accessories. His business is located on Miraflores Boulevard—a very bustling street in the capital city. He used to sell home appliances, traveling to Guatemala to purchase them, but this business failed and he decided to get into his current business.

He has 5 children, 2 of whom are still his dependents. With this business, he has managed to make small home improvements. He has his wife’s support with the household expenses since she also works.

He would like to purchase more products wholesale because he needs to have merchandise for about 4 months.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase car accessories

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Manuel R. V., tiene la edad de 35 años, habita en el barrio las conchitas, ubicado en le municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual le apoya con las actividades del hogar , ellos tiene dos hijos de ocho y cinco años de edad los pequeños estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Manuel desde hace 10 años se dedica a la agricultura , durante este tiempo la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento , el inicio esta actividad con el apoyo de sus padres , los planes futuros hacia su cultivo es poder diversificarlo. Con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha y poder saldar sus necesidades. Da las gracias Afodenic por el préstamo ya que lograra poder salir adelante con su negocio como con su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Manuel R. V. is a 35-year-old man who lives in the Las Conchitas neighborhood, located in the Ticuantepe municipality. He lives with his wife, who helps him with the household affairs, and their two children ages 8 and 5, who are currently in school. His family plan is to improve their living conditions. For 10 years, Mr. R. has been working in agriculture, during which time his biggest problem has been funding. He started in this field with the help of his parents. He plans on diversifying his crop fields in the future. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and supplies so that he can yield a good harvest and help pay for the necessities in life. He gives thanks to Afodenic for the loan because with it, he will be able to get ahead with his business and family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Erving Manuel

texts.es: El señor Erving Manuel A. C. tiene la edad de 23 años habita en el barrio San José los ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus padres , el es soltero , los planes hacia su familia es mejoras las tierras introduciendo diversificación de cultivo , para que en futuro logre tener mejor ingreso y apoyar mas a su papá , el desde la edad de doce años trabaja como agricultor , los rubro que le da mantenimiento es a la piña y al plátano , los planes hacia un futuro en su negocio es conservar su pequeña finca con obras de conservación de suelo . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Erving Manuel A. C. is a 23-year-old single man who lives with his parents in the San José Los Ríos neighborhood, located in the Ticuantepe municipality. He plans on improving his family’s crop fields by diversifying so that he can earn better wages and help out his father more. Ever since he was 12, he has been working as a farmer, growing plantains and pineapples. His future plan is to maintain his small farm by providing soil maintenance. He wants this loan in order to purchase fertilizer and supplies so that he can yield a good harvest and sell his produce at a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Carolina De Jesus

texts.es: La Señora Carolina Gómez de 37 años de edad vive en villa del carmen, madre soltera de dos lindos hijos de nueve y cinco años de edad, mujer emprendedora que lo mas importante es ofrecerle seguridad y protección a sus hijos, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen desde hace seis meses, en el cargo de Asistente de la secretaria de  Consejo, con muchas dificultades ha ido construyendo su vivienda pero no ha logrado terminarla por falta de financiamientos. Gracias al préstamo que solicita en Afodenic lograra realizar la compra de materiales como: cemento, hierro, azulejos, persianas  para remodelar la parte de la sala. Lo cual esta contenta y espera en el futuro seguir trabajando con la institucion
texts.en:
Ms. Carolina Gómez, who lives in Villa del Carmen, is a 37-year-old single mother with two lovely children ages 9 and 5. She is an enterprising woman who thinks that giving her children safety and protection is that most important thing in life. She has been working as the assistant council secretary at the Mayor’s Office in Villa del Carmen for six months. After many difficulties, she has been building her own house, but has not been able to complete construction due to a lack of funds. Thanks to the loan that she is requesting from Afodenic, she will be able to purchase building materials like cement, iron, tile, and blinds so that she can remodel part of her living room. She is very satisfied and hopes to continue working with the institution in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to continue home construction

loans.name: Alcon Group

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA VIOLETA QUINTERO ES ORIGINARIA DE UN POBLADO CONOCIDO COMO HUEHUETAN EN EL ESTADO DE GUERRERO, DESDE HACE APROXIMADAMENTE 6 AÑOS RADICA EN LA COMUNIDAD DE MARQUELIA, DONDE VIVE ACTUALMENTE CON SU ESPOSO Y 2 HIJOS EN CASA DE SUS SUEGROS. DOÑA VIOLETA SE HA DEDICADO A LA VENTA DE COCTEL DE FRUTAS Y BOTANAS LAS CUALES VENDE EN UNA ESCUELA DESDE HACE 2 AÑOS.

ELLA NECESITA DEL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO YA QUE ADEMAS QUIERE VENDER OTROS PRODUCTOS POR LAS TARDES COMO JUGOS Y LICUADOS, CON ELLO  PODRA INCREMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y SUS INGRESOS PARA MEJORAR EL NIVEL DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA, BRINDAR UNA MEJOR EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS Y ADEMAS EMPEZAR A CONSTRUIR SU CASA.

ES POR ELLO QUE SE ACERCÓ A FUNDACION REALIDAD Y JUNTO CON OTRAS 9 PERSONAS FORMARON UN GRUPO AL QUE LLAMARON "ALCÓN", EN SU MAYORÍA SE DEDICAN A LA VENTA DE COMIDA ECONÓMICA, JUGOS, VENTA DE PESCADO Y CALZADO.  

AL IGUAL QUE VIOLETA, TODO SU GRUPO ESPERAN PODER EMPRENDER SUS NEGOCIOS Y TENER MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES PARA SUS FAMILIAS.
texts.en:
Ms. Violeta Q. is originally from a community called Huehuetan in the state of Guerrero. She has been living in Marquelia for approximately 6 years with her husband and two children in her in-laws’ house. Ms. Q. has been selling fruit cocktail and snacks at a school for 2 years. She needs this loan in order to expand her business because she also wants to sell other products—such as juice and shakes—in the evening. In so doing, she will be able to boost sales and increase her income so that she can improve her family’s standard of living, provide a better education for her children, and start to build her own house. Just like Violeta, the rest of the group members hope to be able to launch their businesses and offer their families better opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fruits

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Don José R. M. tiene 38 años de edad, habitante de la comarca Samaria de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, municipio de Managua, casado, su esposa ama de casa, tiene cuatros hijos, viven en casa propia y dentro de sus planes es ofrecerle mayor protección y comodidad a su familia. Don José se desempeña como Conductor en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses, anteriormente trabajaba como conductor en una empresa privada. Ha encontrado como principal dificulta la falta de financiamiento para construir su vivienda. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, piedrines. Logrando la construcción de un anexo y poder tener comodidad y seguridad con su familia.
texts.en:
Don José R. M. is 38 years old. He is an inhabitant of the Samaria region of the community Villa del Carmen, municipality of Managua. He is married. His wife is a housewife. They have four children and live in their own home. His plan is to provide greater protection and comfort to his family. José has worked as a driver in the city Hall of Villa del Carmen for six months. Previously he worked as a driver in a private enterprise. His greatest problem is the lack of financing to build his dwelling. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he bought building materials such as: cement, iron, and stone. He hopes to complete the construction of an annex to his home to be able to have comfort and security with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to complete an annex to his home.

loans.name: Evenor Esau

texts.es: El señor Evenor D. tiene 55 años de edad, habita en los cedros, casado, tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores, uno de sus hijos le ayuda económicamente, vive en casa propia tiene como proyecto la reconstrucción de la vivienda. Trabaja como responsable de relaciones comunales en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen desde hace seis meses. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción  como: cemento, hierro, zinc y otros. También tiene otros ingresos como buhonero el cual permite que su familia tenga otras opciones. Para lograr sus objetivos a futuro.
texts.en:
Señor Evenor D. is 55 years old. He lives in the cedars. He is married and has four children, all grown. One of his children helps him economically. He lives in his own home and has as his current project the reconstruction of the dwelling. He has worked as a head of communal relations in the city Hall of Villa del Carmen for six months. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic he managed to buy building materials such as: cement, iron, zinc and others. Also he has other income which he earns as a peddler which permits his family to have other options to achieve their objectives for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for his house.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Señor Julio Pérez tiene 32 años de edad, soltero, habita en Villa del Carmen, vive con su madre en casa propia, trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa del Carmen en el cargo e concejal desde hace seis meses, con muchos esfuerzo ha ido cambiando madera por paredes seguras, ladrillando  y realizando modificaciones por la gran falta de créditos que no le permite terminar su casa. Gracias al préstamo en Afodenic comprara materiales de construcción: cemento, hierro, ladrillo, zinc y otros materiales. Brindando seguridad y protección a su familia. Se siente contento por el apoyo y por la seguridad de lograr tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Pérez is 32 years old, single, and lives in Villa del Carmen. He lives with his mother in his own home. He has worked in the city Hall of Villa del Carmen in the office and council for six months. With much effort he has worked changing wood to more secure walls, laying bricks and making modifications. But the severe lack of money does not permit him to finish his house. Thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he bought building materials such as: cement, iron, brick, zinc and other materials. He is anxious to offer security and protection to his family. He feels happy for the support and security to manage to have a worthy house.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy building materials for his house

loans.name: Lucia Iveth

texts.es: La señorita Lucia M. tiene 27 años de edad, habitante de la comarca los Cedro, de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen del departamento de Managua, trabaja en el cargo de Responsable de Caja desde hace seis meses anteriormente trabaja en el mismo cargo con el otro gobierno. Agradece a la Institución por brindarle el acensó a un préstamo del cual comprara materiales de construcción  como: cemento, hierro, bloque, piedra y otros materiales. Construir un anexo de su vivienda, da las gracias a la institución por el préstamo ya que lograra tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Lucia M. is 27 years old. She lives in the Los Cedros region in the Villa del Carmen community, located in the state of Managua. She has worked as a cashier for the past 6 months, a position she also held under the prior government administration. She thanks the Bank for providing her with access to a loan that she will use to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, concrete blocks, stone and other materials. She will be building an addition to her home and thanks the Institution for the loan that will provide her with a decent house.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to build her home

loans.name: Jhonnys Bismarck

texts.es: Don Jhonnys de 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio villa Carlos Fonseca, de la comunidad de Villa del Carmen, Municipio de Managua, casado, su esposa se dedica ha a dar clase en un colegio de la región y se ayudan mutuamente para ofrecerle un mejor porvenir a su familia, tiene seis hijos que actualmente estudian. Trabaja en la Alcaldía de Villa de Carmen en el cargo de concejal desde hace seis meses, en el gobierno anterior esta en el cargo de vice-alcalde del mismo municipio. La construcción de una oficina de abogado en su casa de habitación. Siendo un ingreso más. Por falta de financiamiento no se ha realizado su proyecto. Agradece a la Institución por el préstamo, permitiendo comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, zinc, bloques, ladrillo y otros. Generándole mayores utilidades y beneficio a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Jhonnys is 40 years old. He lives in the Villa Carlos Fonseca neighborhood, in the Villa del Carmen community of Managua. He is married and his wife teaches at a school in the region. They help each other out to provide a better future for their family. They have six children who are all in school. He has worked for the municipal administration of Vila de Carmen as an attorney for the past 6 months. In the previous administration, he was deputy mayor of the municipality. The loan is for the construction of an attorney's office at his house, for additional income. He has not completed his project due to a lack of financing. He is grateful to the Institution for the loan that will allow him to purchase construction materials such as cement, rebar, zinc, concrete blocks, bricks, etc. This will increase his earnings and benefit his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build an office

loans.name: June

texts.en:
June A., a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Vavau, is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, June owns and operates a general store whose main income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. June has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately $3500 WST a month.

In 2002, June joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of $2500 WST from SPBD that was used to expand the business, she is now requesting a new loan of $3250 WST to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. The loan will be her seventh from SPBD, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: To purchase new equipment & tools to expand the business.

loans.name: Soloi

texts.en:
Soloi M. is a 40-year-old woman living in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has four small children. Soloi makes and sells food for a living: the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling baked goods in the local community. Soloi has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Soloi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. This is the first time she has requested a loan from SPBD. She is requesting 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale. Soloi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make baked products for sale

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela K., age 39, lives in the town of Fasirtoo Tai. She is married and has five school-aged children. Ela's business is in the agriculture sector and involves the planting and harvesting of bananas and offering them for sale. Ela has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2009, Ela joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Ela is requesting a loan from SPBD in the amount of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase harvesting equipment. This will be her first loan taken out from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business venture.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Tafaimaa

texts.en:
Tafaimaa V. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Fasitoo Tai. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Tafaimaa makes and sells fried foods in the local community. Tafaimaa has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 300 WST a month.

In 2009, Tafaimaa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Tafaimaa is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale. The loan will be her first taken out from SPBD. Tafaimaa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make fried food products for sale

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau T. is a 50-year-old woman who lives in the town of Sataoa.  She is married and has six grown children.  To make a living, she runs a farm where she grows fruit. Tuinanau has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately $350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Tuinanau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business.  She is requesting her first loan from SPBD to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  Tuinanau plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her life and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena L. is a 54-year-old woman who lives in the town of Sataoa. She is married and has seven grown children. To make a living, Elena runs a banana plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than one year, and earns approximately $500 WST a month from her work.

Elena joined SPBD earlier this year to gain access to financial services that can improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1,250 WST from SPBD. She used this loan to buy fertilizers such as manure. Elena has applied for a new loan of $750 WST to buy additional fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve her family's standard of living

About SPBD:

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Senia

texts.en:
Senia A. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Lalovaea village. She is married and has one grown child.  To make a living, Senia owns and operates a food stall where she sells many different types of products. She has been engaged in this business for more than one year and earns approximately $500 WST a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Senia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services that can improve her life and business. She is applying for her first loan from SPBD to buy additional products to sell. Senia plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.
