Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Havea

texts.en:
Havea I. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Lalovaea village. She is married and has two school-aged children.  To make a living, Havea owns and operates a store where she sells products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste.  She has been in this business for more than two years, and earns about $700 WST a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Havea joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and business. She is applying for her first loan from SPBD to buy more products to sell. Havea plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena M. is a 47-year-old woman who lives in the town of Lotofaga Aleipata B. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Filomena runs a banana plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years, and earns about $500 WST a month from her work.

In 2005, Filomena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her business. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of $1,750 WST from SPBD. She used this loan to buy fertilizer. Now she is applying for a new loan of $2,250 WST which she will use to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Filomena plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Taumaia

texts.en:
This is Taumaia U.. She is a 45-year-old woman living in the town of Vaiee. She is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Taumaia operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Taumaia has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 550 WST a month.

In 2006, Taumaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Her wish was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Taumaia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

Taumaia is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. This will be the fourth loan she has taken out from SPBD. Taumaia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

loans.name: Señor De Santiago Group

texts.es: Un Banco D. Emprendimiento que esta en su 6º Ciclo y su nombre es "SEÑOR D. SANTIAGO"  esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio, ademas que se conocen D. muchos años. Este grupo nunca entro en mora por lo tanto se les dio este tipo D. credito. Como presidenta L. señora Olga Hilda  L. G., quien es una D. las fundadoras, se dedica a L. venta D. edredones (ropa D. cama) a credito y algunas otras mercaderias D. temporada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es taxista. Como tesorera esta L. socia Ruth G., quien tiene L. venta D. comida en su domicilio, es una mujer soL. y tiene dos hijas las cuales ya tienen su familia propia,  pero D. igual manera elL. les ayuda. Bertha B.,socia antigua, secretaria del Banco, se dedica a L. costura y venD. al por mayor, es muy trabajadora y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
The "SEÑOR D. SANTIAGO" group is maD. up of women who live in the same neighborhood who have known each other for many years. They are in their sixth loan cycle with the Entrepreneurship Bank. This group has never been late in its payments which is why it can receive this type of loan. Olga Hilda L. G. is the President and one of the founders of the group. She sells comforters (bedding) on credit and other seasonal merchandise. She has three children and her husband is a taxi driver. Ruth G. is Treasurer, and she sells meals from her home. She lives alone and has two children who already have their own families, but whom she still helps out. Bertha B., a longtime member, is Secretary of the Bank. She is a seamstress and sells to wholesalers. She is a hard worker and very responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: 10 De Febrero Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo muy cumplido en sus pagos, esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio y se conocen D. muchos años. Su grupo se llama "10 D. FEBRERO", donD. el Banco D. Emprendimiento esta en su  6 º ciclo y esta organizado D. la siguiente manera: como presidenta esta la socia Lidia C. A., quien dirige al grupo, ella tiene 5 hijos,trabaja vendiendo refrescos y los domingos venD. chicharron, utiliza el credito para comprar azucar y otros viveres para su venta, el esposo es albañil. 
La tesorera es la socia Julia B. D. A. quien es una D. las fundadoras del grupo, es muy responsable con el manejo del dinero, tiene su caseta donD. venD. todo D. chifleria (hierbas medicinales), el credito es para aumentar su mercaderia. Y como secretaria del grupo esta la socia Maxima M. C., ella se dedica a la venta D. regalos y cosmeticos, tiene 6 hijos, pero ella solo mantiene a 3 hijos, es mujer sola.
texts.en:
This group is very prompt in their payments. It was formed by ladies that live in the same neighborhood that have known each other for many years. Their group is called "the 10th of FEBRUARY". They are in their 6th loan cycle with the Bank of Undertaking. The group is organized in the following way: The president is the associate Lidia C. A., who directs the group. She has 5 children. She works selling refreshments and Sundays she sells chicharron (fried pork rind). She uses the loan to buy sugar and other supplies for her sales. Her husband is a bricklayer. The treasurer is the associate Julia B. D. A. who is one of the founders of the group. She is very responsible with the management of money. She has a cottage where she sells all kinds of medicinal herbs (chifleria). The loan is to grow her merchandise. And as the secretary of the group, the associate Maxima M. C. is dedicated to the sale of gifts and cosmetics. She has 6 children, but she only provides support for 3 of the children. She is a single woman.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies for food preparation, medicinal herbs, and gifts and cosmetics for sale

texts.es: Las socias D. este grupo D. Banco D. Emprendimiento "SAN SEBASTIAN"  esta formado por señoras que viven en un mismo Barrio y se conocen D. muchos años. Este grupo es muy antiguo estando en su 7º ciclo, como presidenta la señora Carol C. Como tesorera esta la socia Primitiva G., quien es tambien  una D. las fundadoras del grupo, ella venD. velas en las distintas fechas D. fiestas religiosas, es viuda y tiene un hijo mayor. texts.en:
The San Sebastian group is comprised of women who live in the same neighborhood and have known each other for many years. This group has been around for a while and is now in its 7th loan cycle. Carol C. S., president of the group, is one of the founding members. She has 4 children and works at a small restaurant and neighborhood market. Thanks to her efforts, she is almost finished building her little house. Primitiva G., treasurer and founding member of the group, sells candles during different religious festivities. She is a widow with one grown-up son. The group secretary is Casilda T., a senior member who sells food. She is very polite.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer
