Savalia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Noemi Carla

texts.es: La cliente es soltera  ha demostrado ser responsable en sus pagos, hace un año ya que tiene la farmacia,  donde le va muy bien, es por eso que necesita del credito para poder surtir su farmacia; ella es del Departamento de Potosi, se vino a estudiar y se quedo a trabajar en su profesion que es Bioquimica, ayuda a dos hermanos menores que estan estudiando en la Universidad.
texts.en:
Our client is a single woman who has demonstrated responsibility in making her payments. She has been running her own pharmacy for a year now. She has been very prosperous, but she now needs a loan in order to restock her pharmacy. She is from the department of Potosi, where she came to study and stayed to work in the Biochemistry field. She is helping her younger siblings who are now attending the university.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Karema Group

texts.en: Karema is the group leader of Karema group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants a loan for expanding their business. So they are requesting a group of loan of 42,000 Afghani. Karema wants to take a loan for her husband who has car parts shop. Sediqa wants to take a loan for the business of carpet weaving. Hanefa wants to take a loan for her husband who has cookie shop.  They are very happy for this process of getting a loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: For expanding the business

loans.name: Safora Group

texts.en: Safora is the group leader of the Safora loan group. There are four members in this group and they want to take out loans for growing their businesses.  They are requested a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Safora wants to take out a loan for the business of tailoring. Hqala wants to take a loan for her husband who has general store. Qamar and Bibi Gul want loans for the business of carpet weaving.  They are thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders that can support entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Setara Group

texts.en: Setara is the group leader of the Setara group. There are two members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan to grow their businesses.  They are requesting a group of loan 20,000 Afghani.  Setara wants to take out a loan for her husband who has a dried fruit shop. Mena wants to take out a loan for the business of tailoring. They thank Kiva lenders that can support poor people.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Rawiah

texts.en:
Rawiah is a 32-year-old woman, who lives with her husband and their six children in Gaza, Palestine. She is a fighter, and she is motivated to get a good future for her children. That is why she has her business – a mini market. The business is located in her home and she sells basic grocery items seven days a week. With this loan she will buy more merchandise for her store. Rawiah has done everything to get ahead with her family and with her small business.
Her husband and three of her children are in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more merchendise for a store

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
This is the Ekirirwa Eira group in Jinja. Rose M. is the leader of this borrower group.

Rose has a retail shop that she has managed for eight years now. She has received a previous loan and is happy about her success in repaying it promptly. Thanks to that loan, Rosei was able to increase stock in her shop. The resulting profits and savings were a particular blessing because she has had to pay school fees and medical bills, as well as dealing with family emergencies. She was also able to increase revenue by offering refrigerated items such beer and other cold drinks. Her evening customer base has increased dramatically as a result, with the demand especially high for beer.

Rose is the mother of five children and she pays their school fees with the help of her husband, who helps her with the shop.

She needs a loan to help stock more products, particulalrly since it is now holiday time and more homesteads buy supplies in bulk.

loans.use: To re-stock her retail shop with more goods for sale

loans.name: Kyanzire Hiv/aids Association Group

texts.en:
Zaida K. is the leader of this borrower group.

Zaida is 49 years old and is a friendly lady who runs a business of selling goats in Kashenshero Ruhinda County. She is married and has four children, ages 12, 15, 18, and 21, and she also cares for one orphan. 

Zaida has been in business for five years and the loans have allowed her increase her stock of goats in the farm. She is good at her work in animal sales and is able to make a weekly profit of approximately 60,000. This enables her to support her family, pay her children’s school fees, buy food and clothing, and pay health care costs. 

Zaida's plan is to turn her business into a permanent one with a fixed location where her customers can come directly to purchase goats. She also strives to have a permanent house for her family as well as ensuring that her children receive the best education possible. She will use this loan to bring her closer to these goals, particularly by purchasing more goats so as to increase profits, which she will use to improve the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goats for sale

loans.name: Sula's Group

texts.en:
This is the Tusitukire Wamu group in Jinja. Sula M. is the leader of this borrower group.

Sula is 49 years old and married. Thanks to his hard-working nature, his businesses are thriving. Sula is in the business of making cakes which he has sold from his home for 10 years now. The biggest challenge he has is that the market for cakes is on and off, thus affecting his cash flow. All the same, he is able to make 30,000 in approximate weekly profits, which he then diverts to his farming business and uses to pay the children’s school fees. Sula has also started a poultry business for his wife, and they hope that the future will be bright if all their businesses continue to be handled well.

In his cake-making business, Sula needs cassava flour, soya, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and firewood, and the loans have been allowing him to stock these in large quantities, just as he hopes to do this time with his share of the loan.

Sula is the father of six children between the ages of three and 20. All but the youngest are enrolled in school. He cares for four additional dependents who also attend school.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour, soya, cooking oil, salt, sugar, and firewood for his cake-making business.

loans.name: Joab's Group

texts.en:
This is the United Youth Association is a Pearl Microfinance lending group, led by Joab T..

Joab is a 31-year-old married man with two children, age four and nine. Both are in primary school. For six years, Joab has run a brewing business in Rwenyina Cell Kitagata Kyeiziiba. Since he did not have the necessary materials and equipment to do the job himself, Joab started by helping his fellow colleagues in the same business. This allowed him to set aside savings, which enabled him to start a business of his own. He ensures that the hygiene conditions at his workplace are good, and this attracts more and more customers.

He is able to make weekly profits of 80,000 from bulk sales as well as from customers who drink his beer products on site: this is currently at his home, but as soon as he has enough money saved to allow for it, he hopes to open up a dedicated location in the town of Bagenyi, where he can also stock more of his increased product output. He wishes to continue growing his savings, which he hopes will allow his children to complete university.

At the moment, Joab needs to buy more bananas for beer-making so as to increase output.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for making beer for sale.

loans.name: Retamas Group

texts.es: La asociación “Retamas”  pertenece al centro focal Villa Adela, a la fecha esta formado por doce miembros, su presidenta y fundadora es Viviana I., formo el grupo entre familiares y amigas. Existen diferentes actividades dentro el grupo como ser;  venta de fruta, cosméticos, comida rápida (salchipapas y hamburguesas), otras de ellas son panaderas y también confeccionan colchones y almohadas de lana. Este grupo necesita comprar materia prima y mercadería para iniciar sus negocios ya que es una asociación nueva en la institución de Pro-Mujer.
texts.en:
The association “Retamas” belongs to the center Villa Adela; to date the association is composed of twelve members. The president and founder Viviana I. formed the group with family members and friends. The members run different businesses within their group, such as: the sale of fruit, cosmetics, and fast food (Salchipapas- a dish that usually consists of hot dogs or sausages served with French fries, and hamburgers), some are bakers, while others make wool mattresses and pillows. This group needs to purchase basic materials and merchandise to start their businesses given that they are a new association within the Pro-Mujer institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials or merchandise.

loans.name: Jenny Katherine

texts.es:
"La Sra. Jenny K. C. R., tiene como actividad  la venta de Cds los cuales comercializa en el puesto de su suegra en la populosa Av. Buenos Aires . La unidad económica familiar esta compuesta por su esposo y ella, ya que es una pareja joven.
La cliente fue recomendada por su suegra ya que la misma es cliente de nuestra institución."
texts.en:
Mrs. Jenny K. C. R. sells CD’s in her mother-in-law’s stand, which is located on bustling Buenos Aires Avenue. Her family is comprised of two people—Jenny and her husband—because they are still a young couple.

The client was recommended to us by her mother-in-law, who is also a member of our institute.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a television set

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.en:
Reyna is 61 years old and is married with eight children.  Three still live with her and her husband in the city of Pucallpa.  Reyna's husband works in agriculture and also helps Reyna with her business of selling clothes.  

Reyna has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Los Manguitos" (The Little Mangoes).  Reyna used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to buy staple food items.  She plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase dresses, shirts, blouses, pants and other clothes for sale.  Reyna sells her clothing in the small communities located along the Ucayali, the wide brown river that flows past the city of Pucallpa and joins the Amazon to the north.     

Reyna is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the financial assistance the organization has provided her.  Reyna's goal is to help her children through their studies so that they can have professional careers.

loans.use: Dresses, shirts, blouses, pants and other clothes for sale

loans.name: Noly Raquel

texts.en:
Noly is 40 years old and is married with three children. She has a business selling clothing and shoes. She and her husband also own two motorcycle taxis. Her husband works as a driver of one of their taxis. Noly and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.

Noly has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Nuevas Amigas" (“New Friends”). She used her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) to purchase soft drinks for sale. She gradually expanded her business ventures and began to sell more expensive items. She now travels regularly to the capital, Lima, to bring clothing and shoes back to Pucallpa for sale. She plans to use this loan of 1,000 soles to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle taxis.

Noly's goal is to eventually turn part of her home into a small shop where she can display the clothing and shoes that she sells.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance for her two motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El Banco LAS EMPRENDEDORAS, trabaja en nuestra Institución desD. el 2008, la mayoria D. las participantes a trabajado desD. sus inicios, el banco se caracteriza por trabajar en el comercio y servicios.Es un grupo solidario y participativo. 
                                                                   MARIA CARMEN C., es la presidenta, se dedica a la venta D. pan en la Ceja D. El Alto, con el prestamo a logrado apoyar la actividad D. su esposo, quien es conductor asalariado, con el tiempo tienen planes D. ahorrar y poder comprarse una movilidad propia y así poder mejorar su calidad D. vida.                                                                                                                     VICENTE C.,ocupa el cargo D. secretario, es uno D. los fundadores del banco,  tiene un negocio D. amplificación y con el prestamo a podido implementar un negocio más, una tienda D. barrio que le permite mantener a su familia que esta compuesta por 6 miembros, con estas dos actividades a logrado mejorar sus ingresos y tener estabilidad económica. 
                                    CINDA G. B.,se dedica al comercio D. viveres en la zona D. Villa Victoria, con el prestamo a logrado tener un pequeño capital, el que es utilizado para la venta D. comida los fines D. semana, ella tambien es una D. las fundadoras del Banco, tiene una familia numerosa y piensa ahorrar más para los estudios D. sus nietos.
texts.en:
The Las Emprendedoras group has been working in our microfinance institute since 2008. The majority of its members have been with us since the beginning. This is a very active and unified group that provides goods and services.

MARIA CARMEN C., the group president, sells bread in La Ceja D. El Alto. With these loans, she has been able to help out her husband, who works as a wage-earning driver. In time, they plan to save enough money to be able to purchase their own vehicle so that the can improve their quality of life.

VICENTE C., the group secretary, is one of the group’s founders. He owns a sound equipment rental business. With these loans, he has been able to launch yet another business—a corner market—which helps him to support all 6 members of his family. With both of his businesses, he can increase his earnings and have financial stability.

CINDA G. B. sells provisions in the Villa Victoria zone. With these loans, she has managed to amass some working capital, which she uses for weekend food sales. She is also one of the founding group members. She has a sizable family, and she hopes to save more money for her grandchildren’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and spare parts

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch S. is a 27-year-old married woman and mother. She currently owns a small hairdressing shop next to her house, and earns some additional money selling a few soft drinks in the shop. She married years ago and is devoted to her two school-aged children.  Her husband works as a civil servant in the department of ministry. Ouch said that her business runs smoothly because it is in a good location crowded with passersby. She has found that the home decorating business for wedding parties is a profitable one and would like to to invest in it to earn extra income, but she lacks money to do so. She would therefore like a loan through Kiva to purchase wedding supplies to begin a decoration service.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to begin a decorating service.

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Chhun V. is a young married man age 29, and he and his wife have one lovely young child.  Chhun V. uses his own motorcycle to run a taxi service, picking up tourists who want to visit Angkor Wat Temple, or anywhere else in town.  Besides the taxi business, he also helps his wife with a home business selling and renting CDs, VCDs, and media players. Almost all of their customers are people who live near their house. Chhun V. would like to operate his taxi service at the airport but he is required to pay a service fee. Therefore he would like a loan to help pay the airport service fee so he can find customers at the airport which will help him attract more tourists and earn extra income.

loans.use: To pay the airport service fee for his taxi service.

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.en:
Jennyfer is a 29-year-old married mother of three. To earn income, she sells a lunch menu daily from her home. Jennyfer's husband works for a local company.  

Jennyfer has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank "Las Doncellas."  She invested her very first loan of 300 soles (about $100) in baking and selling bread, rolls, and cakes. Now that she has begun to receive larger loans from Manuela Ramos, Jennyfer has been able to expand her business into more profitable enterprises such as her home cafe. Jennyfer plans to use this loan of 1500 soles to purchase food as well as tablecloths and utensils for her cafe.  

Jennyfer's goal is to eventually have a full-scale, nicely-furnished restaurant where she can offer her meals to tourists.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her home cafe business.

loans.name: Clarivel

texts.en:
Clarivel is a 40-year-old married mother of two children.  Together with her siblings, Clarivel owns and runs a "polleria" which is a restaurant that specializes in roasted chicken.  This is a very popular dish in the city of Pucallpa where Clarivel and her family live. Clarivel herself raises the chickens for serving at the restaurant.    

Clarivel has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for two years and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  Clarivel plans to invest this loan of 3000 soles in fixing up her chicken coops.  Clarivel's goal is to eventually open another polleria.

loans.use: To repair her chicken coops.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly P. is a 54-year-old widow and mother of five children who is a resident of Siem Reap Province. She was married, but her husband died of senility. Her five children are now married and some of them have already started new homes. Ly P. currently earns a living growing crops on a piece of land. One of her married sons is still living with her, and he works on the farm using his own farming machine. He also sells pork that he slaughters. Ly P. requests a loan to buy rice in bulk from other farmers during the coming harvesting season so she can resell it at a profit. Also some of the loan will be used to repair her son's broken farming machine. Both Ly P. and her son are pictured here.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk for resale.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en:
Vann N. is a 55-year-old married man and older father. He has a lot of skills to earn a living. He plants vegetables and rice on his own farmland and is also hired by neighbors to help on their farms. He owns an old cultivating machine. Normally, he can make a daily profit of around $3.50 per day to meet his entire family’s living expenses, while his wife assists him in growing crops.

This older couple is devoted to their six children who are single and live in the family home. Two of their children are employed in farming. Vann N. says that he works hard every day to supply the money for his family's demands. He will be using his loan to purchase a new farming machine for a plowing service and to repair his old machine that has broken.

loans.use: To purchase a new farming machine for a plowing service

loans.name: Sat

texts.en:
Sat M., 42, has been selling beef. She sells beef that she buys in bulk, on credit, from butchers and runs her business in the busy local market. She always pays her suppliers after she finishes selling her items. She starts selling in the morning and is finished in the late afternoon, with much income.

Sat M. wants to generate extra revenue by investing in a new business as a silk clothes seller in the market. Her capital is not sufficient to open. Therefore, she would like a loan of $1000 for capital to use to rent a market kiosk and buy silk clothes to begin selling.

Sat M. was married, but divorced her husband years ago, and she has a daughter who is married. Her daughter and her son-in-law live with her in the family home. She and her grandchild are in the photo.

loans.use: To rent a market kiosk and buy silk clothes to sell

loans.name: Leda Group

texts.en: Leda N. M. is the group leader of Leda group. There are four members in this group. Each of them would like a loan to expand their business. Leda will use the loan for her husband’s new business of leather sewing. Rabeya wants to take out a loan to grow her tailoring business. Meir Aqa wants a loan to improve his bakery, and Gull Aqa wants to buy necessary materials for his general store. They are very happy that this small loan system is available in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seeds and some necessary things for his farm

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn F. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Arlyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arlyn owns & operates a pedicab transport business. Arlyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase an additional vehicle for the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase an additional vehicle

loans.name: Сафарали

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Эрматов Сафарали мужчина , который получает повторный кредит на расширение бизнеса скотоводства. У него сейчас несколько голов баранов и коз. Каждый день Сафарали выпроваживает свой скот на пастбище, где он питается травой. Сафарали с детства инвалид , у него одна рука плохо развита, поэтому  ему по бизнесу помогает его сыновья.
Сафарали покупает скот на рынках сам . т.к.он хорошо разбирается  в породистых мелкорогатых скотах. На полученный кредит Сафарали планирует закупить пять голов молодых овец и корма для них.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Нурали

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan

Эрматов Нурали 39 летний молодой человек, отец четырёх детей. Он работает в колхозе трактористом, его заработная плата  очень низкая и не хватает на полноценное проживание. Поэтому  Нурали  с молодости занимается откормом и продажей скота. С данного бизнеса он имеет хороший доход , на осуществление домашних крупных расходов. Нурали хочет купить на полученный кредит корм и два молодых барана.
Он доволен всеми условиями организации и хочет продолжать сотрудничать с нами.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Субон

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan


Субон мужчина, который занимается полностью откормом и продажей скота. У него крупнорогатый скот. С периода первого кредитования у него заметно увеличился оборотный капитал животноводства, а также увеличилась прибыль с данного бизнеса.
На следующий кредит Субон хочет купить корм для коров и купить ещё одного молодого быка.

loans.use: откорм и продажа скота

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy necessary materials for agriculture

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 32 years old. Rosalie is married and has three infant children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a pedicab transport service. Rosalie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Норкулбой

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Норкулбой – мужчина , который занимается откормом и продажей скота. Он сам работает в колхозе на поле по поливу урожайной земли. Вместо денег колхоз платит ему продуктами питания, поэтому он имеет доход с животноводства. На полученный кредит Норкулбой планирует купить ещё пять молодых баранов и откормив их продать с прибылью.

loans.use: отком и продажа скота

loans.name: San

texts.en: San S. O. is a 48-year-old woman, married to Ou Choeun, age 51, and they both appear in the picture here. This old couple lives with four school-aged children and earns a living by planting various crops O. their own farmland. San S. O. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest and collect her productivity when they are mature. Recently, her crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insect and lawn. Because of that obstacle, San S. O. has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which she will use to protect her crop.

loans.use: To buy insecticide

loans.name: John

texts.en: M. John is an individual client of Pearl Microfinance in Jinja. He is 54 years old and married with nine children of which four are in school. He cares for six orphaned children of his late brother. John has been involved in the business of casting and melting metals for 10 years and before then he started by working in factories where he got the experience and started working alone. He makes spare parts like gears for factories in Jinja and Kampala and he is able to make a monthly profit of 2 million shillings. His quality products make his customers come to him as well as being trust worthy. His business goal is to expand further so that he can have access to more scrap and chemicals so that he can earn more and open up another branch. He has benefited by building his own home and now works from his home, hence not renting anymore. He employs two (2) workers and two of his elder children are employed by other factories so they will follow in his footsteps. John needs a loan to be able to buy more scrap and chemicals for his business.

loans.use: To buy more scrap and chemicals

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita G. is from the village of Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Rosalita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns & operates a business selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Rosalita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rosalita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of her children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Sekina D. M., age 46, is a divorcee with four children ages 26, 23, 18 and 14 years.  She has had a bar business for six years now.  She works daily from 8.30am until after midnight.  She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $752.

This will be Sakina’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes to use this loan to buy more drinks.
\t
Sekina will share this loan with her loan group, Nadia, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Sakina  is at the back in a black and white dress.

loans.use: To buy more drinks.

loans.name: Muon

texts.en: The old medium-size wooden house along the village road in the rural area of Kompong Cham Province belongs to Mrs. Muon S., 46, a single mother. She was married, but divorced her husband when her children were very young, and she has now two married and five single children. Two of her daughters help with family responsibilities by working as garment workers in Phnom Penh Capital. Muon S. currently sells a few products in the market, like vegetables, fruits, and some groceries. She said that she faces a bigger problem with transportation since her money is not adequate to buy her own vehicle. Hence, she is looking for a loan to add to her personal savings to buy a used motor for her and her family’s riding needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcar

loans.name: Charbel

texts.en: Charbel is a 35-year-old married man and father of 3 children. Ha has owned a barber shop since 1999, where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Charbel is requesting to borrow $300 to buy merchandise for his shop to satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for barber shop

loans.name: Aidah's Group

texts.en: Aidah K. is the leader of Kikoni 11 Twimukye group in Ibanda. Aidah is 36 years old and a determined and hard working lady who has had a farming business for over 10 years. She is a married mother of 4 children aged 19 – 12 years all in school and she cares for 2 dependents.  She is quick to say that her good customer care and quality products have kept her in business together with having so many reliable customers. She grows matooke, sweet potatoes and irish potatoes which enable her to make profits worth 200,000/ month. She hopes to have a big farm, as well as have all her children educated up to the University level. Aidah needs a loan to help buy farm inputs to ensure quality production. This is her 4th loan and she hopes it will help her just like the previous ones.

loans.use: Buying farm inputs for increased production.

loans.name: Madjiar

texts.en:
Madjiar P. is from the village of Panduma Sr., Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 20 years old. Madjiar is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Madjiar owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating in a food market. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of products like vegetables, spices, etc., in the local community. Madjiar has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Madjiar joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madjiar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to  purchase new items to expand product offering. Madjiar is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Madjiar from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yassine

texts.en: Yassine is a 38-year-old single man. He has been working as a home painter since 1995 and has 20 years of previous experience in this field. Today, Yassine is requesting to borrow money to buy an air compressor to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: buy an air compressor

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 26-year-old married man with one child. He has been working in the sanitary sector for the past 8 years. In 2006, he decided to open his own business to improve life conditions for his family. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow money to buy merchandise to increase his work income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: S. is a low-income woman who earns a living as a local farmer. She is married with three young children who are of school age. She and her husband inherited a plot of their grandparent’s farmland where they cultivate different kinds of natural crops. Since S.’s husband is completely growing their crop, he wants to attain other work in order to supply additional money for his family’s demands but he has no capital. He has discussed with his wife to look for a loan as capital to purchase a villager’s horse, which S.’s husband will use for a taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a horse

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 29-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working as a van driver since 2007 and he services the surrounding areas. Today, Tony is requesting to borrow $1,200 to perform maintenance on his van after some bad circumstances he went through to be able to keep up his work.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his van

loans.name: Масрур

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
Масрур парень в возрасте 22 лет, имеет незаконченное высшее образование.Ему помог открыть маленькое кафе его отец. На сегодняшний день у него маленький оборотный капитал в кафетерии. Масрур готовит на завтраки прохожим клиентам яичницу, жареную колбасу, блинчики с мясом , гамбургеры и другие быстро приготавливаемые блюда. Масрур хочет в кредит купить холодильную камеру для хранения быстро портящихся продуктов. На снимке Масрур в день выдачи.

loans.use: услуги кафе

loans.name: Mrs. Yeim Muth Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yeim M., the village bank president, has been selected by the eleven members who all live I. Tuol Trea village I. Takeo province. Mrs. Yeim M. is farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Seang Sary, is a fisherman and he also helps his wife with the rice farming. Since these businesses have obstacles, Mrs. Yeim M. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field and buy a boat and fishnets for her husband's business.  Mrs. Yeim M. is 44 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. 

Nine members I. this group have loans that are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, a boat and fishnets

loans.name: Paul's Group

texts.en: S. Paul is the leader of Munaku Khama group in Jinja. He is a hard working, dedicated and friendly man with no children but helps to care for so many relatives, including orphans. Paul has been a boda boda cyclist for 2 years yet this is his 6th loan with the group. In this business, Paul says they face a lot of challenges like the high robbery rate of the motorcycles, plus the high fuel prices. Due to his hard work and good customer care, he is able to make weekly profits of 80,000. He is saving so much so that he will be able to buy a pickup truck for business, as well as improve the living standards of those he cares for. He hopes to use his loan to repair his motorcycle and after that he will be able to buy a new one.  (In the Photo is Grace, the Kiva Coordinator in an orange top, and Robert also working with Pearl Microfinance)

loans.use: Repairing his motorcycle for better services.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en: Sanaa is a 43-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has owned a clothing shop since 2008. Thanks to her business income, she has been able to meet her children's needs in collaboration with her husband. Today, Sanaa is requesting to borrow to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: buy more merchandise

loans.name: Rukiah

texts.en: Rukiah is widowed and has seven children. Four of her children are in primary school, two are in high school and one is about to go to college. She comes from a rural community which is highly dependent on sugar plantation. The main source of energy in this community is charcoal and firewood. After her husband passed away, she started selling charcoal and firewood in order to sustain her family. She has been in this business for the last six years and wants to borrow to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: Increase stock of Charcoal and Firewood

loans.name: Mrs. Sarann Yin Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarann Y. is the village bank president of 16 people who all live in Tuol Trea village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to earn a living. On her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her rice field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. With the rest of the loan, she will hire laborers to work on the field. Her husband, Mr. Chut Sarorn, is a construction worker and he also helps his wife in the rice field. Mrs. Sarann Y. is 35 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school. All of them are presented in the picture but one is blocked by the members. 
Fourteen members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a business trading chickens. Chicken is a delicacy in the Luhya community where she operates her business. Because she lacks capital, Eunice put a small shed just behind her house inside the Mumias sugar complex. Her dream is to expand to a bigger area.
She is married and has two children. Her chicken business has enabled her to transfer her children from a public school to private school. She now wants to borrow Kshs. 10,000 in order to increase her stock of chickens, as there is a ready market.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Nehme

texts.en: Nehme is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to open a small restaurant as his own business to provide, along with his family, for their living conditions. Today, Nehme is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools to better satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is married with a very young family of three. His family has relied on his tailoring business for the last three years. Having trained as a tailor, his uncle bought him a sewing machine. Sammy then opened a stall in Mumias grocery market where he makes all types of clothes. He has also partnered with neighboring institutions where he has been given an order to make uniforms. The business has been growing as a result of increased demand for school uniforms and he now wants to borrow KES 20,000 in order to purchase more materials.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old single man living with his brothers. Since 2006, he has owned a phone repair shop in order to earn income to help satisfy the needs of the family. Today, Ali is requesting to borrow $600 to buy more merchandise so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 46-year-old married man and father of three children.  Since 2000, He has been working in construction and architecture.  Today, Mahdi is applying for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional tools for his work so he can satisfy the heavy demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: To buy additional tools

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en: Chheang H. is a modest married woman of twenty-nine and is a good mother of two children who are enrolled in school. She cultivates a rice crop and raises livestock to earn a living. In her business operations, her husband helps manage her work. Presently, the family specializes and depends on raising pigs because it has provided them with much income. Because pig raising is the main source of family income, Chheang H. would like a loan to buy more piglets to raise. She would like to use the remainder of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for the rice crop during the farming season. Note: Mrs. Chheang H. was not available for a photograph so her husband appears at their pigpen.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Igor

texts.en:
Igor is married with a 13-year-old daughter. He is a businessman from Ivano-Frankivsk where he resells and installs wooden and armored doors as well as reinforced plastic structures (windows and doors). Igor has been in this business for 10 years. His monthly income is about 8,000 Grivnyas.

Igor’s business is well known in his region for quality installation services without any delays. He owns two locations where he offers a selection of products for sale. This time Igor is requesting a loan of 13,500 Grivnyas to purchase 15 armored doors for further resale. He is hoping to use the resulting extra income to do reconstruction work on his home.

loans.use: To purchase 15 armored doors.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya V. is divorced with 4 kids. Her family is bigger than the average Ukrainian family which has made it hard for her to provide for her family. Mariya started her business only two years ago when she saw an opportunity and decided to fill the niche. Today she runs her small sweets and pastry sales business in one of the local markets in Drogobych. She has about 30,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income is about 10,000 Grivnyas a month.  

Mariya is seeking a loan of 13,500 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for further retail sale. She has proved to be a hard-working and friendly entrepreneur who knows how to best serve her customers and keep her business running effectively. Mariya has a good credit history.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise.

loans.name: Mrs. Sinuon Uk Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Sinuon U. Village Bank Loan Group is made up of 20 people located in the Tuol Trea village in TaK. Province. All of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sinuon U. is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Suong Veasna, is a fisherman. In these two businesses, Mrs. Sinuon U. faces problems because her rice field is infertile soil so it has affected her crop. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. She will use the rest of her loan to buy a boat for her husband's business. Mrs. Sinuon U. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other is only 3 years old so is still too young to work or study. All the group loan members are presented in the picture but most of them are blocked.

Seventeen members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Thaong

texts.en: S., 46, is living on a low income in Pursat Province. For the coming farming season, S. has planted a vegetable crop which she will harvest when they are matured. She and her husband have been working in this business for more than twenty-six years, and it is a skill they learned from their grandparents. After planting, S. faces a problem because she is lacking fertilizer to sustain her crop growth. That is why she has decided to seek a loan of $200 which she will use to buy more fertilizer to improve her vegetable crop yield. S. is married and blessed with eight children, four who are already married and the other who still attend school and help on the farm.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer to improve her vegetable crop yield.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella has two children, one of whom is adopted. She is separated from her husband and bringing up the two children is quite challenging.

With such a huge financial obligation, Isabella started selling clothes from her house and hawking them (going door-to-door) on the weekends. She moves from one door to another in the expansive Mumias sugar complex. She sources her merchandise from the neighboring country, Uganda. Recently she also added shoes as part of her stock.

In order to boost her income, Isabella also prepares chapatis (flat bread) in her house and sells them to the factory workers. Isabella is requesting a loan of Kshs 10,000 to purchase more clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Chap

texts.en:
Seventy-five per cent of Cambodian people have a farming business and Mrs. S. is one of them. She is a married woman with nine children, two of whom are married and the other seven are single and work in different jobs. Her husband is a mobile building worker.

S. is taking out a loan to purchase fertilizer to enrich her rice crop and to pay for plowing fees. She and her husband appear in the photo at their farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Domenciana

texts.en:
Domenciana M. is a member of the Rizal South Branch in Talim Island of ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. She is married and is the mother to two: a boy and a girl. Both of her children are still dependent on her to survive. Her husband, Francisco, is 37 years old and is a fisherman. they lives in the island village in the town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines.

With her dream to lift up her family from poverty, Domenciana joined ASHI in 2008 with hopes to have access to capital for her business. During her early loans, she invested them all in purchasing fishing nets and other fishing gear. She was been running her fishing business for almost fifteen years and it brings her a good income for the sustainability of the needs of her family.

Now on her third loan, Domenciana requests 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. The loan will be used to pay for twenty bundles of assorted types of fishing nets, ropes, and other materials for fishing. She is hopeful that, with the trust and support from ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her dream little by little, send her children to school up to college level and repair her house to make it spacious and more durable.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets, ropes, and other materials for fishing

loans.name: Addah

texts.en:
Addah is strong businesswoman with a desire to excel in any area where she sets her foot. She started her retail business with a loan of Ksh 20,000 from SMEP and repaid it successfully. She then took another loan of Ksh 50,000 to increase her stock of cereals and repaid it, too.

Addah is married and has two young children. She operates her retail business in the rural area of Kakamega-Shinyalu trading centre. With a strong zeal to expand, she has now requested her third loan for Ksh 90,000 to enable her buy a motorbike and to increase her stock of cereals.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and to increase her stock of cereals

loans.name: Bo

texts.en:
The smiling-faced woman shown in the photo is Bo R., a married mother. She grows rice as well as raises a few pigs in a stall next to her house for income. She is married to Choun Toeun, an ox-trader. This couple has five teenage children who are going to school and help on the farm when they are not studying.

Bo R. will be using some of her loan to buy more fertilizer to fatten her crop that is not growing well and the rest to buy a cow which she will use to help plow her farmland and, in future, to raise its offspring.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop and to buy a cow

loans.name: Гузалай

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
      Гузалай - 39 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Гузалай вместе со своим мужем занимаются бизнесом продуктов питания. У них есть магазин "Азиз" в своем микрорайоне. Муж Гузалай поставляет товар в магазин, а Гузалай сидит в магазине и продает. Муж почти через день приезжает в город Худжанд, на рынок Панчшанбе за продуктами, потому, что продукты питания быстро портящиеся. Муж Гузалой покупает только свежие продукты. В летние каникулы  Гузалай и мужу помогают дети. За новый запрашиваемый займ они хотят расширить ассортимент товара, завезти арбузы и дыню.

loans.use: Продукты питания

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is a 39-year-old mother of five children whose ages range from 1- 17 years old. Her husband is a motorcycle driver while she runs various businesses. It was in 2005 when she first had the opportunity of putting up her own business because of her membership in ASHI.

Four years later, Beverly has made her business grow and has a lot of variety in the goods she retails in her store. The amount of loan she is qualified to make has increased for she has maintained a very good repayment rate, attendance rate, and business rating in ASHI.

Beverly's businesses, such as her variety store that retails rice, charcoal and other basic needs of people, as well as her food-vending business, have brought convenience to people in her community and have brought joy to Beverly since she has at least contributed something to other people.

Beverly's dream of sending all her children to college goes with her dream of making her business sustainable. The opportunity of taking loans is a great source of capital to make these dreams come true, in addition to the income her husband makes being a motorcycle driver.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice and other grocery items for her variety store and to finance her food-vending business

loans.name: Tumuobe Mungu Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a member of Tumuobe mungu borrower group, in Mwera, Zanzibar. She is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are aged 16, 13, 5, and 1 years.

 Zuhura stated her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago. She works 4 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000.

 This is Zuhura`s second loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale.
With the profit she makes from the use of this loan, Zuhura hopes to save money and expand her business.

Asha is the other member of the same group. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to to expand her own business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is married and has eight children who are all in school. He operates his business in the rural areas of Mumias. This is a rich, agricultural region commonly referred to as the sugar-belt area. The main cash crops are maize and sugar cane. Most of the people in this community rely on their vast sugar plantations, as the biggest sugar factory is within the vicinity.

Issa operates a small restaurant in this area, a business he has done for the last five years. Due to his increased financial obligations as a result of school fees, he wants to open a cereal business. He wants to buy maize from the farmers, as this is the harvest season and supply has exceeded demand. He has already constructed granaries to store the maize and will resell it at a later date when prices have increased. He now wants a loan of Kshs 50,000.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk to sell later

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has three children who are still in school. Her husband is a temporary laborer in a tea factory. Florence comes from a rural area called Shinyalu which is a rich, agricultural area dominated by tea and maize plantations.

Because of the need to provide the best education to her children, Florence started a chemist (pharmacy) business. In the past, the lack of capital has stagnated her business. She heard about SMEP and is now requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to enable her buy malaria and common cold drugs as this is the season for such diseases.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines for her pharmacy

loans.name: Фарходчон

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan
       Фарходчон молодой мужчина 1982 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него среднее образование. Фарходчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Фарходчон пришел брать кредит в первый раз. У него пока малое количество скота. Фарходчон надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Фарходчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S., 29, owns and operates a plot of farmland on which she grows a variety of crops. On the other hand, she is also hired by neighbors to sew their clothes. She is a single lady who tries to generate income to meet her financial crises and to feed her family.

Since 1995, Mao S. has been operating both her above businesses. She now requests a loan of $700 to upgrade and enlarge her farm supplies. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing and irrigation expenses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing and irrigation expenses

loans.name: Shuhratchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
       Шухратчон молодой человек 23 лет. Женат, детей пока нету. Его жена готовится стать матерью их первого ребенка. Шухратчон очень рад и готовится такому событию. У него будет пополнение семьи и он теперь должен  побольше зарабатывать. Он живет отдельно от родителей. Жена Шухратчона помогает мужу как только может. Шухратчон хочет взять кредит для увеличения количества своего скота.
texts.en:
Shuhratchon is a young 23 year old man. He is married and does not have children for now. His wife is getting ready to become a mother to their first child. Shuhratchon is very happy and is preparing for the occasion. He will have an addition to his family and he needs to earn more. He lives separately from his parents. Shuhratchon’s wife helps her husband in any way that she can. Shuhratchon would like to take out a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina, a mother of seven children, comes from Mumias, a rural area in Kenya. She operates a second-hand clothing business in a small trading center called Harambee. Her business involves buying second-hand clothes from the border town and selling them in an open-air market on Tuesdays and Saturdays. On Saturdays, Amina also travels to Mumias open-air market to sell her merchandise (a distance of about 20 kms).

Amina is a widow and depends on this business to support herself and her children. She is requesting a loan of Ksh 20,000 to enable her to increase her stock in anticipation of the increased demand during the holy month of Ramadhan.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes

loans.name: Tuwesawa Group

texts.en:
Mgeni is a member of Tuwesawa borrower group. She is 30 years old, married, and a mother of 3 children. Her children are aged 15, 12, and 5 years.

Mgeni started her own clothing business selling clothes 2 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 100,000.

This is Mgeni's second loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the profit she makes from the use of this loan, Mgeni hopes to save money and expand her business. Yetu is the other member of the same borrower group. She also requested a loan from BRAC in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Ean

texts.en:
Ean S. E. is 26 years old and is a resident of Pursat Province, where she owns farmland near her home on which she cultivates rice. Another source of family income comes from her husband who works in construction. This couple lives with three young children who are dependent on their income.

Ean S. E.’s rice crop is not so growing well due to the lack of fertilizer. To solve this problE., she is applying for a loan from Kiva to purchase three sacks of fertilizer in order to fatten her rice crop yield. She is hopeful that, with this loan, her productivity will increase.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of fertilizer in order to fatten her rice crop yield

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
     Гулчехра – женщина 38 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей декоративной косметики. Имеет свой магазин "Азиза" в городе Табошаре. У Гулчехра очень большой ассортимент косметики и соответственно у нее много клиентов. Гулчехра закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков и индивидуальных дистрибьюторов. Сейчас современная молодёжь предпочитает дорогую косметику известных компаний. Поэтому Гулчехра просит займ для закупки партию декоративной косметики от Джордани Голд компании Орифлейм.
texts.en:
Gulchehra is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and is a mother of 3 children. She sells decorative cosmetics and owns a store, called Aziza, in the city of Taboshar. Gulchehra has a wide selection of cosmetics and, thus, many customers. Gulchehra buys her merchandise from supplier firms and individual distributors. Currently, contemporary young people prefer expensive cosmetics from well-known manufacturers. This why Gulchehra is requesting a loan for the purchase of a stock of decorative cosmetics from Djordani Gold by Oriflame.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of decorative cosmetics

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is a member of the Tuwepamoja borrower group. She is 31 years old, married, and a mother of 7 children. Her children are aged 15, 13, 10, 8, 6, 4, and 1 years.

Fatma started her own business selling charcoal 2 years ago. She works 8 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 120,000.

This is Fatma's first loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 300,000 in order to buy more charcoal for sale. With the profit she makes from the use of this loan, Fatma hopes to save money and expand her business

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a member of the Bega kwa Bega borrower group. She is 49 years old; she is married and a mother of 9 children. Some of her children are aged 27, 20, 19, 18, and 16 years.

Riziki started her own charcoal business 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000.

This is Riziki`s second loan from BRAC. She requested the amount of 500,000 in order to buy more charcoal. With the profit she makes from the use of this loan, Riziki hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem S. is local farmer, 41 years old, living in a rural area of Pursat Province. She and her husband have always cultivated rice. Besides their current farming work, Yem S.’s husband is also hired by neighbors to cook meals for their wedding parties. The family has seven school-aged children under their care.

Yem S. still needs more fertilizers in order to grow her crop but she does not have the money to buy it yet. She is therefore looking for a loan from Kiva to purchase additional fertilizer to serve her farm.

loans.use: To purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Baku city. He was born in 1980. He is married, and has one child.

Ten years ago, Seymur started a shoe-sales business. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more shoes for improving his shoe-sales business.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for his business

loans.name: Ragub

texts.en:
Ragub was born in 1979. He is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Baku city.

This young man has been in his clothing sales business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy more clothes to improve his clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Orif

texts.en:
E. Orif is a very hard-working and responsible entrepreneur. Married with four children, he and his family live in Isfara, Tajikistan where he works in the central city market selling men’s clothing and shoes. Orif has been working in the market for four years, and his business enjoys stability and consistent growth, providing the main income for his family. He enjoys working for himself. Today Orif would like to ask for a loan of $1000 to purchase new inventory.

We believe Orif‘s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur succeed and thrive in business. You can be an important part of the growth of Orif’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for selling.

loans.name: Abdumanof

texts.en: I. Abdumanof is married and has a little son. With the faith that his son would go to school, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots to be able to make enough money to pay for his son’s schooling. This is why he started this business eight years ago. He is experienced in this kind of business and that allows him to expand his clientele day by day. Right now, Abdumanof needs a loan of $1,200 USD. He is going to spend the loan on purchasing apricots to further process them for sale. With your help, Abdumanof will be able to feel proud that, through much effort, his son went to school and became an honorable person. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy more apricots to expand his business

loans.name: Rauf

texts.en:
M. Rauf, 44, is married with two children and lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the past 15 years, Rauf has been earning money by processing apricots and selling them at the market. Because he wishes to buy more dried apricots so he can earn more and improve his living, Rauf is requesting a loan of $1200 to expand his operation. He says that this is the perfect time for him to take out a loan. By offering a better selection, he will be able to capitalize on this opportunity. His goal is to continue expanding and improving his business every day, and more importantly, to ensure that his children will always be able to attend a good school. Rauf is very grateful to everyone who is helping him to achieve his dreams with this loan.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes: its role as a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous, and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing apricots in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina is fifty years old, is widowed, and has given birth to eight children: three sons and five daughters. Some of her children are still in school. As a single parent, Augustina says she works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Augustina is a trader and trades in cereals such as maize, beans, etc. She also deals in tubers of yam. She buys her goods all the way from Northern Ghana and supplies to food vendors and other retailers in her community. She has been in business for over twenty-two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is forty-one years old. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter, both of whom are still in school. He works very hard to be able to provide for his family. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Dunkwa in the Central region of Ghana.

Paul is a tailor by profession. He sews both men’s and women’s designs for clients and also for sale. He buys fabrics and other sewing accessories from Kumasi. He has a number of apprentices who are currently under training.

Paul has been in business for over eighteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics in bulk

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr: Gora G. est un vendeur de friperie à la marche centrale de Mbour ville située à 80 km de la capital Sénégalaise.
