A  trente ans, il a quitté son village pour venir s’installer en ville pour travailler. Il exerce ce métier depuis 5 ans. Les revenus tirés de son activité lui permettent d’aider ses parents restés au village. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il compte renforcer ses activités en achetant des marchandises diversifiées.
texts.en:
Gora G. is a second-hand clothes salesman in the central market of Mbour, a town that is approximately 80km away from Senegal's Capital. At the age of the 30 he left his village in order to settle and work in the city. He has been working as a second-hand clothes salesman for the past five years. The profits from his business allow him to help his parents who remain in his native village. With this loan, which he is asking for, he hopes to strengthen his business by buying varied merchandise.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bahlul

texts.en:
Bahlul is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Ahmadbayly village. He was born in 1972, is married, and has three children.

Bahlul makes doors and has been in this business for ten years. Now he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for making more doors.

loans.use: To buy materials for making doors

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is divorced with a grown son and a daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk where she sells spices, dried mushrooms, seasonings and culinary items in the central food market. She offers a nice selection of these products at affordable and competitive prices. She has been in this trade for twelve years. She owns three vending locations at the same marketplace and, currently, her monthly income is 10,000 Grivnyas.

Nadiya is seeking a loan of 5,500 Grivnyas to purchase assorted spices, sugar powder, instant puddings, etc. She knows market trends really well as she used to work as a market inspector at the same marketplace and gained many useful skills. She is hoping to generate additional funds and make savings to be able to buy her son a separate apartment in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of spices, box mixes and instant puddings

loans.name: Colke Chuyma Group

texts.es: Ceferina L. es la presidenta del grupo “Colque Chuyma” que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal “Collpani”, ella tiene 39 años y vende comida hace 5 años. Ceferina necesita del préstamo para la compra de insumos como papa, arroz y fideo. Las demás integrantes del grupo también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de dulces, verduras, helados, mantas y cosméticos. Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando insumos o mercadería.
texts.en:
Ceferina L. is the president of the group called "Colque Chuyma". She is 39 years old and has been selling food for 5 years. Ceferina will use her portion of the loan to purchase ingredients such as potatoes, rice and noodles. The other members of the group also run their own businesses selling sweets, vegetables, ice cream, cosmetics and linen. They will all share in this loan to invest in their respective businesses, purchasing the necessary ingredients and merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients and merchandise to help grow their respective businesses

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La señora Delfina C. V. tiene 49 años y estuvo casada por más de 20 años pero su esposo la abandono y ahora vive sola. Tiene 2 hijos para los cuales saco un préstamo para poder comprarles un equipo de soldadura y así puedan trabajar. La señora Delfina vive en la comunidad de Maica Sud en Cochabamba, donde tiene 3 vacas, cuya leche utiliza para elaborar queso y venderlo en los diferentes mercados de la ciudad de Cochabamba y a las vendedoras de Charque (un plato tradicional de Cochabamba que se come acompañado con queso). La señora Delfina se dedica a elaborar queso hace más de 32 años.

El préstamo será destinado a la compra de Alimento para su ganado (Challa) que por problemas de sequia el costo de la misma subió mucho y no le alcanza para comprar todo el alimento que sus vacas necesitan. De este modo no tendría problemas de seguir produciendo la misma cantidad de leche que ya produce y la cantidad de queso ni la calidad bajarían. La señora Delfina espera poder obtener otro préstamo una vez finalizado este para poder comprar más vacas y aumentar su producción de leche y así sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Delfina Chamba V. is 49. She was married for over 20 years, but her husband abandoned her. She now lives alone. Her two children got a loan to be able to buy soldering equipment and be able to work. Delfina lives in the Maica Sud community in Cochabamba. She has three cows. She uses their milk to make cheese and sell it at different markets in the city of Cochabamba and to people who sell “Charque” (a traditional dish eaten with cheese in Cochabamba). Delfina has been making cheese for over 32 years. The loan is to buy food for her livestock (corn husks). Due to drought problems, the cost has increased a great deal. She does not have enough to buy all of the food that the cows need. This way they will not have trouble producing the same quantity of milk that they now produce. Also, the quantity and quality of cheese will not be reduced. Delfina hopes to be able to get another loan once this one is finalized to be able to buy more cows and increase her milk production and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy food for her milking cows (corn husks)

loans.name: God Thank You Group

texts.en: Finda is a mother of five children and has never been to school. She is involved in the sale of food staples (salt, rice, oil, etc.) in the Foya town community in Lofa County, north of Liberia. For the past 8 years, Finda attracts customers to her business by means of good presentation, conversation, and reasonable prices for the goods. Her goal is to generate more money to pay for her children’s educations and provide a good home for them.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Tanriverdy

texts.en:
Tanriverdy is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Bala Bahmanly village.

He is 48, married, and has 3 children. He has been in the sheep breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat to buy 20 sheep for improving his sheep breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep for breeding

loans.name: Saa Gbein Group

texts.en:
Kumba has 3 children, all in 10th grade. Kumba sells food from her little market from whence she has been able to support all of her children. She has been able to keep them in school up to this level, and plans to continue until they have all finished.  She herself has never been to school.

She wants to expand her business to provide for her children's education and medical care. She encourages her customers by means of good conversation and has been doing so for the past 15 years.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Simkol Group

texts.en:
Famata is 40 years of age and completely illiterate. She’s married with 3 children and is engaged in the buying and selling of goods across borders. She has been conducting this business for the past 25 years (she started at age 15). 

She purchases and sells any kind of commodity that comes her way and especially sells at retail prices. Being wholly associating with business friends, she has been very successful and is currently dreaming of building a good house for her and her children, as well as being able to send them to school to complete their educational process.

loans.use: To buy food staples for resale

loans.name: Diompilor Group

texts.en:
Hawa is the mother of three children and has never been to school. She has been involved in the sale of dry goods (slippers, cosmetics, clothes, rice, oil, onions, etc.) for about four years now.

Hawa’s challenges could be illnesses during the rainy season and sometimes the shortage of finances. She’s successful due to close friendship with and good manners to her customers. Her goal now is education and healthcare for her children and herself.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, onions, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Peace Group (2)

texts.en: Ruth stopped her schooling at 3rd grade due to her parents' inability to help her through. She’s now 33 years old, married and has 4 children. She sells foodstuffs and has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her biggest challenge is financial shortfall. She’s dreaming of helping her children complete their education as well as giving them good medical attention.

loans.use: buying a bag of sugar, rice, etc

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo  trabaja en una empresa de refrescos llamada Mendocina S.R.L. ahí desempeña el cargo de supervisor de área, su esposa se dedica a la compra venta de refrescos, esas son la fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeña hija, vive en de sus padres, esta  ubicado en la Las Lomas de la ciudad de La paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará para la compra de refrescos así la esposa tendrá mas mercadería para poder comercializar.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Reynaldo.
texts.en:
Reynaldo works in a refreshments business of called Mendocina S. R. L. He works there as an area supervisor. His wife is dedicated to the purchase and sale of refreshments. They are the source of income with which they pay for the maintenance of their small daughter. He lives in his parents home, which is located in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to purchase refreshments so his wife will have more merchandise to be able to market. This is his third loan with Impro. His good payment history allows Impro to approve another loan requested by Reynaldo.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy refreshements for resale

loans.name: Teodocio

texts.es:
Teodocio trabaja en una empresa de mecánica; debido al mal trato y  explotación laboral decidió independizarse. Cuenta con las herramientas y con  las maquinas de trabajo, su esposa se dedica  a la venta de comida en la parada de minibuses, es su fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo, vive en la casa de su hermana ubicado en la Zona Franz Tamayo de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la instalación de medidor trifásico, que es el tipo de electricidad que necesita y así podrá usar las maquinas y hacer trabajos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Teodocio.
texts.en:
Teodocio works as a mechanic. Due to poor treatment and labor exploitation he decided to become independent. He relies on the tools and machines of his trade. His wife is dedicated to the sale of food at a mini-bus stop. These are the sources of income that pay for the maintenance of their small son. He lives in the house of his sister located in the Franz Tamayo zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used for the installation of a three-phase meter, as that is the type of electricity that he needs. In this way he will be able to run his machinery and take in jobs. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by Teodocio.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install 3-phase power for his mechanic shop

loans.name: God's Blessing Group

texts.en: Robin is a 30-year-old single parent with one daughter. He’s been involved in the business of hairdressing for about 9 years. He stopped schooling upon completing the 12th grade and went into business. He dreams of improving his business to enable him to complete his education.

loans.use: additional products, hair extensions, cremes, etc.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta tiene seis vacas lecheras  y es productora de leche la cual vende a PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche) es soltera y es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre sus gastos, vive en  casa propia en el área rural ubicado en la comunidad de Arasaya Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, mismo que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
Es el primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito solicitado por Asunta.
texts.en:
Asunta has six dairy cows and is a producer of milk which she sells to PIL (Industrial Milk Plant). She is a single woman and this is her main source of income with which she covers her expenses. She lives in her own home in the rural area located in the community of Arasaya Achacachi, Province Omasuyos of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for the greater part of her milk production. This is her first loan with IMPRO. The evaluation carried out qualifies Impro to offer her the loan requested by Asunta.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy another dairy cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Bewondo Ii Group

texts.en: Kumba is a 33-year-old mother, married with 3 children. She has been involved in the sale of fish for the past six years. Kumba attracts her customers by always selling good, fresh fish and encourages customers with reasonable prices. She hopes for better education for her children as well as medical care.

loans.use: wholesale fish, barriers, drums, baskets, etc.

loans.name: Bernice

texts.en:
Bernice is twenty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in primary school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in their town.

Bernice is a petty trader. She sells costume jewelry and lingerie. She hawks (walks around) to sell in her community. She buys the jewelry and lingerie from wholesalers in the central market of the capital city and retails the goods to her customers. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy different assorted jewelry and lingerie in bulk to expand her business. She desires to bring in more income to provide better life opportunities for her child and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and lingerie in bulk

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe y su esposa son propietarios de cuatro vacas lecheras, son productores de leche, la cual venden a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres  hijos;  vive en la comunidad Caluyo Batallas Provincia Los Andes  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Felipe
texts.en:
Felipe and his wife are owners of four dairy cows. They are producers of milk, which they sell to the PIL (Industrial Milk Plant). This is their main source of income with which they cover the maintenance of their three children. They live in the Caluyo Batallas community, Los Andes Province, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for greater portion of his milk production. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by Felipe.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Laure

texts.fr: A. Laure est née le 23/02/1986 à Lokossa, chef lieu du Département du Mono d'où elle est originaire. Laure est célibataire sans enfant et vit auprès de sa mère à GBEDAGBA un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Laure a démarré son petit commerce, il y a juste un an. Au départ, Laure s'est lancée dans la vente de téléphones mobiles à des employés d'une société de gardiennage : vente à crédit qu'elle récupère à petit coup à la fin de chaque mois.  Aujourd'hui, Laure a associé à la vente de téléphones portables, la vente de tissus. C'est pour renforcer cette dernière activité que Laure sollicite ce premier prêt d’ALIDé dans le but de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s’accroître. Dans un avenir proche, Laure aimerait ouvrir une boutique pour y  exposer ses différents produits (téléphones portables et tissus).
texts.en:
Laure A. was born February 23rd, 1986 in Lokossa, capital of the Mono region. Laure is single and has no children. She lives with her mother in Gbedagba a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Benin Republic. Laure only began her business a year ago. Initially, she sold mobile telephones on credit to a security guard company, and at the end of each month she would collect part of the telephone sale profits.Today, Laure has added the sale of fabrics to her business. She is seeking her first loan from ALIDe so that she might increase her business and meet the growing demand of her clients. In the near future, Laure would like to open a boutique to display her different mobile phones and fabrics.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of six pieces of twelve meter fabric from HITARGET and ten mobile phones.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es:
Zenon es propietario de dos  vacas lecheras, y es productor de leche, la cual vende a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), además esta cursando el tercer año de la carrera de electrónica en el instituto de su comunidad, esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre su manutención; es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres en la comunidad Chahuirapampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Zenon.
texts.en:
Zenon is the owner of two dairy cows. He is a producer of milk, which he sells to the PIL (Industrial Milk Plant), Besides this he is a student in the third year of an electronics program at his community institute. This is his main source of income with which he covers his maintenance. He is single and lives at the home of his parents in the Chahuirapampa Achacachi community, Omasuyos Province, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for the greater part of his milk production. This is his first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by Zenon.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase his milk production.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es casada y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar, vive en anticrético en la zona Mercurio de la ciudad de El Alto, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa de niños y de mujeres la cual la reparte en distintas zonas de la misma ciudad, esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre la manutención de sus tres  hijos.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y poder acceder a un puesto de venta propio.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Vilma is married and has 3 children of school age. She lives in a rent-free home in the Mercurio zone of the city of El Alto. She is dedicated to the purchase and resale of clothes for women and children, which she markets in the various zones of his city. This is her main source of income, which which she pays for the maintenance of her three children. The loan will be used to increase her merchandise of clothes and to be able to rent a stall of her own. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies her for the approval of the loan requested by the client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more women and childrens clothing for resale

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo y su esposa son propietarios de siete vacas lecheras, son productores de leche, la cual venden a la PIL (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), esta  es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus cuatro hijos. Vive en la comunidad Tipampa Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos  de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para incrementar en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, misma que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
 
Es tercer crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Mateo.
texts.en:
Mateo and his wife own seven dairy cows. They are producers of milk, which they sell to PIL (Industrial Milk Plant). This is their main source of income, with which they cover the maintenance of their four children. They live in the Tipampa Achacachi community, Omasuyos Provience, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that provides for the greater part of their milk production. This is their third loan with Impro. Their good payment history allows Impro to approve another loan requested by Mateo.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase their milk production.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica tiene dos vacas lecheras y es productora de leche; su esposo trabaja como albañil, de esta manera obtienen su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubren los gastos familiares; tiene un hijo, vive en  casa propia en el área rural ubicado en la comunidad de Akerana Achacachi Provincia Omasuyos de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito lo destinara para incrementar en la compra de una vaca lechera de mediana  calidad, mismo que le ayudara para mayor producción de leche.
Es segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobarle otro préstamo solicitado por Veronica.
texts.en:
Verónica has two dairy cows and is a producer of milk. Her husband works as a bricklayer. In this manner they obtain their main source of income with which they cover the family expenses. She has a son and lives in her own home in the rural area located in the community of Akerana Achacachi , Province Omasuyos, of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow of medium quality, the same kind that accounts for the greater part of her milk production. This is her second loan with IMPRO. Her good payment history allows Impro to approve another loan requested by Veronica.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her milk production

loans.name: Help The Poor (Malana) Group

texts.en: Upon completing high school, G. got involved in the sale of dry goods (rice, oil, onions, etc.) and has been in the business for the past 3 years. His greatest challenge was at the beginning of the business when there was no financal help at all.  He’s currently dreaming of extending the size of his table in the market and purchase more goods and also wants to continue his schooling.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, onions, etc. for resale

loans.name: Willy

texts.es:
Willy vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Alemania de la Ciudad de El Alto; es soltero, tiene dos hermanos menores que dependen de él ya que sus padres no se encuentran con ellos, trabaja como electricista y es chofer propietario. Estas son sus principales fuentes de ingreso.

El crédito lo destinará para compra de material eléctrico para su negocio de electricista  y también para el costo de  cambio a gas natural de su movilidad la cual le ayudara con sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por el cliente.
texts.en:
Willy lives in his own home in the Villa Alemania zone of the City of El Alto. He is single and has two small brothers that depend on him, since his parents are no longer with them. He works as a electrician and as a private chauffeur. These are his main sources of income. The loan will be used to purchase of electric components for his electrician business and also for to cover the cost of changing his vehicle to natural gas, which helps him with his income. This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies him for the approval of the loan requested by the client.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electrical components for his electrican business and also cover the cost of converting his vehicle to natural gas

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery vende galletas y dulces los días lunes, miércoles y viernes; el resto de los días vende chicharrón (cerdo frito en pedazos acompañado con maiz y chuño) en la tranca de la misma zona; su esposo es contratista de obras de albañilería, a la vez Rosmery cría gallinas chanchos y los comercializa en la ferias, es de donde proviene los ingresos económicos para la manutención de sus dos hijos, vive en casa propia su domicilio esta ubicada en la Zona San Roque de la  Ciudad de el Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción, para terminar la obra fina  de su departamento.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Rosmery.
texts.en:
Rosmery sells crackers and sweets on Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays. The remainder of the days she sells chicharrón (fried pork rind accompanied with maiz and potato starch) in the bar of the same zone. Her husband is a bricklaying works contractor. At the same time, Rosmery raises young chickens and markets them at the fairs. This is how she earns the income for the maintenance of her two children. She lives in her own home located in the San Roque zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to purchase building material, to finish the detail work on her home. This is her first loan with Impro. The evaluation carried out qualifies her for the approval of the loan requested by Rosmery.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stucco, paint, electrical sockets, etc. to finish the detail work on her house.

loans.name: Houenafa

texts.fr: Houenafa est née vers 1974 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin où elle réside actuellement. Houenafa est mariée au chef du quartier ZOGBO de Cotonou, Monsieur ZOUNGNI Félix. Houenafa est mère de six enfants dont deux sont décédés et seulement deux sont scolarisés. Houenafa a débuté il y a trois ans la vente de nourriture. Houenafa vend du riz au gras aux écoliers d'un établissement privé non loin de chez elle au quartier ZOGBO. Houenafa a ajouté à cette activité, la vente de beignets faits à base de farine de blé. A ces deux activité, Houenafa a ajouté la vente de pâtes de maïs appelée localement akassa accompagnées de poissons frits. Houenafa a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a développé ses activités. Pour renforcer ses trois activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Houenafa sollicite son cinquième crédit.
texts.en:
Houenafa was born around 1974 at Cotonou, the economic capital of the Benin Republic, where she continues to live today. Houenafa is married to Felix Zoungni, the head of the Zogbo district in Cotonou. She is the mother of six children of whom two are deceased and only two are currently enrolled in school. Three years ago Houenafa began selling food. She sold fried rice to private school children not far from the Zogbo district. To this business she added the sale of donuts made of wheat flour. She has also added the sale of corn noodles, locally known as akassa, accompanied with fried fish to her business. Houenafa has already benefited from four loans from ALIDe; these loans have been fully repaid and were used to help her develop the business described above. Houenafa is asking for her fifth loan in an effort to grow this business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of four 50Kg bags of rice, four 25 liter drums of vegetable oil, and three 100Kg bags of corn.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Faithful Business Partners Group

texts.en: O. is a 22-year-old Liberian man, who has been involved in the sale of dry goods (oil, bonnie, onions, etc) for about 2 years. He goes across borders to purchase his goods and sells at retail prices. He dreams of building a house if more money is generated from his business as it improves and also thinking of going further with his schooling since he has completed high school. He has no kids.

loans.use: buying Bonnie, oil, rice, onions, etc. for resale

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El señor Luís L. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Juana Chura y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Luís elabora balones de fútbol que su esposa vende en un puesto de venta ambulante, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de una cocina, requisito para acceder al servicio de gas domiciliario.
Esta es la octava vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Luís L. lives in his own home in the zone of Pasankeri on the western slope of the city of La Paz, with his wife, Señora Juana Chura and their four children. Luís creates soccer balls that his wife sells on foot. This provides the income with which they maintain their family. The requested loan is for the construction of a kitchen, which is required to arrange for home gas service. This is the eighth time that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies them favorably so that we agree to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen so they can get gas service in their home.

loans.name: God's Gift Group

texts.en: Jenefer is a 54-year-old mother of five children who has been involved in the retail sale of dry goods (rice, oil, onions, various seasonings, etc.) for the past 25 years now. Her greatest challenge has been financial. She’s progressing gradually in the business and dreams of buying more goods to be added to her business inventory to enable her to educate all of her children.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, etc. for resale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has owned and run a shoe vending business for the past seven years. A 29-year-old man, Joseph has requested his second loan of Ksh. 50,000 after successfully repaying a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a varied stock of shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to start importing shoes directly. One day, Joseph wants to buy a plot of land and build rental houses as well as a home in Nairobi. Joseph describes himself as hard-working and determined.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add  to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael L.  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hija.
El señor Rafael trabaja como mensajero y auxiliar de oficina en una empresa privada de La Paz, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de un muro de contención, ya que la pendiente en la que se encuentra su vivienda exige que se estabilice el suelo.
Esta es la cuarta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Rafael L. lives in his own house, in the area of Pasankeri, Iadera, which is west of the city of La Paz, with his daughter. Mr. Rafael works as a messenger and assistant in the office of a private company in La Paz. The income from this job is used to take care of his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a retaining wall, since his house is located on a slope, so he needs to stabilize the floor. This is the fourth time that he has requested a loan. Because of this and his socio-economic level, he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a retaining wall for his house

loans.name: United Business Group

texts.en: Emmanuel stopped at the 9th grade, married and has 2 children. He is also involved in the sale of dry goods (rice, beans, peas, oil, etc.) and has been in this business for the past 5 years. His greatest challenge is finance but he hopes to improve his business and generate more money to build a house for himself and his 2 children as well as catering for their education since he didn’t make it through high school.

loans.use: buying more rice, oil, fish, etc for resale

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio R. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Marcia Illanes y sus tres hijos.
El señor Julio atiende un negocio de comida en su domicilio junto a su esposa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de MESAS Y SILLAS para la atención de mas personas en su negocio y así mejorar su nivel de ingresos para la familia.
Esta es la primera vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio R. lives in his own house, in the area of San Pedro, Iadero, which is west of the city of La Paz, with Mrs. Marcia Illanes and their three children. Mr. Julio takes care of his food business in his home with his wife. The income from this allows him to take care of his family. The loan requested will be used to buy tables and chairs so that he can serve more people in his business. In this way, he will be able to improve the level of income for his family. This is his first that he has requested a loan. His socio-economic level qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and dishes so he can serve more clients

loans.name: Trésor Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Trésor Plus » est un groupe constitué de 26 membres des membres solidairement unis pour recevoir des prêts de Kiva à travers Hope RDC. Michel D. O. est dirigeant cette Banque Communautaire. 
Son activité consiste à vendre des habits et des sachets dans son quartier périphérique et le plus peuplé de la ville situé au nord de Kinshasa. Il a acquit une expérience solide en exerçant cette activité pendant plusieurs années. Son ambition est d’ouvrir un deuxième point de vente en vue d’accroitre le revenu. Michel a reçu 4 fois les crédits de Hope qu’il a remboursé correctement. Le prochain prêt lui permettra de diversifier son affaire en y ajoutant des épices dans le souci d’augmenter le bénéfice. Actuellement, son activité lui génère $90 par semaine. Il est âgé de 48 ans, marié et père de 6 enfants dont trois d’entre eux vont à l’école.
texts.en:
“Trésor Plus” is a group composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans through Hope RDC. Michel D. O. is the leader of this Banque Communautaire. His business involves selling clothing and sachets in his outlying district, the mostly highly populated in the city and located north of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience operating this business over several years. His ambition is to open a second outlet with the aim of growing his revenues. Michel has received four loans with Hope and has repaid them correctly. The next loan will enable him to diversify his business by including spices, for increasing his profit. Currently, his business generates $90 a week for him. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of six children. Three of them go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify his business by adding spices for sale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Santa Isabel De Acosvinchos Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Santa Isabel D. Acosvinchos inicia su ciclo 7 con 12 socias. Las socia son del Distrito D. Acosvinchos que se ubica a 1 hora D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, golosinas, calzados, frutas, abarrotes en general, carne, comida, crianza D. animales, fabricación D. tejas y transporte D. pasajeros.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,200 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, cebada, golosinas, zapatos, frutas, animales, arroz y azúcar.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener una tienda granD., sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel D. Acosvinchos Community Bank begins its 7th cycle with 12 members. The members are from the district of Acosvinchos, which is located one hour from the city of Ayacucho. The members pursue different business, like selling cereals, sweets, footwear, fruit, groceries, meat and food, taking care of animals, making tiles, and public transport. The members need different amounts of loans, like for 300 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, for a total loan of 9200 soles for the community bank. Their loans will be invested to buy wheat, barley, sweets, shoes, fruit, animals, rice and sugar. The members’ dreams are to have a large store, have their children become professionals, and to improve their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley, sweets, shoes, fruit, animals, rice and sugar

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris has owned and run a small curtain stand for the past five years. A 31-year-old single mother of two, Damaris has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a stock of curtains. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her children. One day, Damaris wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home as well as business premises. Damaris describes herself as determined and diligent.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to her stock of curtains

loans.name: Good Days Group

texts.en: Siah has never been to school. She’s married and the mother of five children with an additional three children of extended family members. She’s been engaged in selling dry goods (rice, oil, table salt, peas, etc.) for almost 10 years now. She dreams of getting additional goods for the business and generating more funds to sustain her children and herself. Her greatest challenge has been “finance.”

loans.use: Oil, rice, table salt, etc.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel has owned and run a small shoe vending business for the past year. A 33-year-old father of two, Samwel has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a stock of shoes. He hopes that this loan will help to raise his income and allow him to pay school fees for his children and have a good life. One day, Samwel wants to grow his business and buy a house to operate his business from as well as to use as a home. Samwel describes himself as polite, committed, and self-dependent.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock of shoes

loans.name: Needs Help Group

texts.en: Georgia is a 7th grade drop-out, married with 6 children. For the period of 10 years, Georgia has been involved in a tabletop marketing business which allowed her to send her children to school until the completion of high school. Georgia is dreaming of educating all of her children and providing good medical attention for all of them.

loans.use: buying bags of rice, gallons of oil, etc. for retail sale

loans.name: Color Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Color Esperanza inicia su primer ciclo con 15 socias, todas ellas fueron invitadas por la promotora. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta de ropa, cereales, lana, abarrotes en general, refrescos, quesos y brindan el servicio de transporte.
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles  haciendo un total de 7,250 soles de prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra de polos, chompas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, cereales, quesos.

Los sueños de las socias son tener casa propia, sus hijos sean profesionales, ampliar sus negocios y tener un local estable.
texts.en:
The Color Esperanza Community Bank starts it first cycle with 15 members. All of them were invited by the leader. The members have different businesses like selling clothes, grains, wool, general groceries, soft drinks, cheese, and offering transportation services. The members need different amounts of loans like 300 PEN, 450 PEN, and 600 PEN. The total loan for the Community Bank is for 7,250 PEN. The loans will be used to buy polo shirts, sweaters, rice, sugar, oil, grains, and cheese. The members’ dreams are to have their own houses, that their children become professionals, to expand their businesses, and to have stable locations.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy polo shirts, sweaters, rice, sugar, oil, grains, and cheese

loans.name: Be Ready I Group

texts.en: Princess is a 40-year-old Liberian mother of 4 children. She’s married but has never been to school. She’s been involved in a tabletop marketing business for the past 2 years now. Her challenge has been finance. With LEAP on her side, she dreams of getting fully involved in business, generating more money, educating her children, building a home for her children and herself, as well as sending all of her 4 children to good schools and medically speaking, taking care of them also.

loans.use: buying rice, oil, pepper, salt, etc. for resale

loans.name: Benedict

texts.en:
Benedict is a 28-year-old, newly married man who operates his business selling bags in Muthurwa market in Nairobi. He is requesting a third loan of Ksh. 80,000 after successfully repaying two other loans of Ksh. 20,000 and 40,000 to add to his stock of bags. He hopes that one day he will buy both a place to use as business premises and also a home in Nairobi. He describes himself as hard-working, patient, polite, and GOD fearing.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of bags

loans.name: Cosmas

texts.en:
Cosmas is a 29-year-old father of one who runs his shoe vending business in Gikomba market in Nairobi. After employment at Kenya Power and Lighting Company, Cosmas decided to venture into business and he began his business five years ago. He is requesting a third loan of Ksh. 80,000 after successfully repaying two loans of Ksh. 20,000 and 40,000, used to buy more shoes. He hopes that one day he will be importing shoes directly and also will be able to educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and patient.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to his stock of shoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 42 años, vive con su madre y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Su profesión es la docencia; pero adicionalmente, desde hace 20 años, se dedica a las actividades agrícolas, siembra los productos nativos de su zona, los cuales vende en el principal mercado de su localidad, y también separa una parte para su consumo propio. El trabajo que realiza se intensifica de acuerdo a la época del año: en la siembra debe preparar y abonar la tierra; en la cosecha almacena, este caso, el maíz, seleccionando aquellos granos que servirán de semilla y aquellos productos que se han de vender y consumir. Para el futuro, Carmen planea comprar más terrenos agrícolas para extender sus cultivos. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una integrante muy comprometida con el banco comunal al que pertenece y su deseo es continuar trabajando en equipo. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de sacos de abono, en grandes cantidades, para continuar con sus tareas agrícolas.
texts.en:
Carmen, 42, lives with her mother and her two children in her own house. She is a teacher. For 20 years she has also worked in agriculture. She plants products that are native to her region. She then sells them in the primary market in her area. She also separates part for her own consumption. The work she does intensifies according to the season. In planting season she needs to prepare and fertilize the land. In the harvest she stocks up on, in this case, corn. She selects those grains that will serve as seeds and their products that will be sold and consumed. In the future, Carmen plans to buy more land to extend her crops. This is the fifth time that she has had a loan with MFP. She is very committed member of her Community Bank. Her wish is to continue working with the team. The money will be used to buy large quantities of sacks of fertilizer to keep up with her agricultural work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Marcelline est née le 25/04/1981 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Marcelline est mariée à HOUNWEDO Richard, un menuisier. Marcelline n'a pas encore eu d'enfant. Il y a trois ans que Marcelline a ouvert son salon de coiffure au domicile conjugal à ZOGBO, un quartier de Cotonou. Mais avant, alors qu'elle était en congé de fin d'apprentissage, Marcelline a, pour quelques mois, vendu la pâte de maïs localement appelée l'akassa avec du poisson frit. Depuis qu'elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure, Marcelline se consacre uniquement à coiffure. En plus de la coiffure, Marcelline vend également les produits et articles de coiffure(mèche, défrisant, shampoing, etc.). Pour mieux servir sa clientèle, Marcelline sollicite son premier crédit de ALIDé pour équiper encore plus son salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Marcelline was born on April 25, 1981 in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. She is married to HOUNWEDO Richard, a furniture maker. Marcelline has not yet had children. It’s been three years since she opened her hair salon in her conjugal home in ZOGBO, a district of Cotonou. But in the past, while she was on leave finishing her apprenticeship, she sold for a few months cornmeal mash, locally called “akassa”, with fried fish. Since she opened her hair salon, she has been devoting herself to hairdressing only. In addition to hairdressing, she also sells hair products and goods (hair extensions, straighteners, shampoos, etc.) To server her customers better, she is requesting her first loan from ALIDé to equip her hair salon even further.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 dozen hair extensions and 9 boxes of cosmetic products

loans.name: Ccatun Sacha Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Ccatun Sacha Que significa Arbol GranD. en quechua, inicia su ciclo 12 con 25 socias.
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta D. ropa, frutas, condimentos, carne, cereales, comida, cosméticos, abarrotes en general, verduras, jugos, panes, artesanías. 
	 
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 400 soles, 700 soles  haciendo un total D. 14,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. arroz, azúcar, carne, trigo, cebada, verduras, cosméticos y artesanías. 

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, construir su casa, tener local propio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Banco Comunal (Community Bank) Ccatun Sacha Que, meaning “Large Tree” in quechua, began its cycle 12 with 25 members. The members carry out different businesses such as the sale of clothing, fruits, condiments, meat, cereals, meals, cosmetics, general groceries, vegetables, juices, breads, and handicrafts.

The members need different amounts of loans such as 300 soles, 400 soles, 700 soles, making a total of 14,600 soles of loans with the Banco Comunal. Their loans will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar, meat, wheat, barley, vegetables, cosmetics, and handicrafts. The dreams of the members are to enlarge their businesses, construct houses, have their own places of business and offer a good education to their children

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, meat, wheat, barley, vegetables, cosmetics, and handicrafts.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. DesD. hace 6 meses se dedica a atender su negocio D. video juegos, venta D. DVD’s musicales, D. películas, y otros artículos variados. ElL. tiene un puesto en el mercado D. su localidad donD. permanece por las tardes y parte D. L. noche; ya que durante el día, junto a su esposo, cuidan D. los animales que poseen. Cada mes, Elsa se abastece D. mercadería, ya que L. demanda le permite que tenga las ganancias necesarias para su familia, por lo que se proyecta al futuro con una mayor cantidad D. mercadería y nuevos equipos para video juegos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, elL. está muy contenta D. ser parte D. su banco comunal, en el cual ha perseverado a pesar D. diversas circunstancias difíciles, por lo que se compromete, una vez más, a seguir trabajando por el bienestar común. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará un televisor y DVD’s D. películas y video clips D. cantantes folcloristas regionales.
texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old, she lives with her husband and 2 kids in their own home. For 6 months she has worked at her business, offering video games and selling music and movie DVDs, and other items. She has a space at a market in her neighborhood, where she works in the afternoons and evenings. During the day, she and her husband work to care for their animals. Every month, Elsa stocks her business. The demand for her items allows her to earn the money necessary to support her family, and she hopes in the future to have more merchandise and new video game equipment. This is Elsa's fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her communal bank, which she has remained a member of despite a variety of difficult circumstances. For this reason she is committing herself once again to continue working for the common good. With the funds she is requesting she will purchase a television, and DVDs of movies and video clips of regional folkloric singers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock merchandise and buy a television

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa tiene 50 años, es viuda, vive con sus 2 hijas y sus nietos en su casa propia. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de quesos. Todos los días por las mañanas, se instala de manera informal en los alrededores del mercado central de su ciudad, pues no cuenta con un puesto estable. También vende en las ferias comerciales de otras provincias aledañas y tiene clientes fijos que son trabajadores de una institución, a quienes abastece de queso dos veces a la semana. Su principal proveedor es uno de sus paisanos, quien produce quesos, al por mayor, en su tierra natal, de esta manera Felipa logra vender hasta 200 kilos de queso fresco cada semana, siendo las épocas festivas donde sus ganancias son mucho mayores, como en las pasadas fiestas patrias. Para un futuro cercano, a Felipa le gustaría vender otros productos y poder tener un puesto propio en el mercado. Esta es la primera vez que tiene préstamo con MFP, para ella, trabajar con este tipo de créditos es una experiencia nueva, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más quesos, además de otros productos comestibles que empezará a vender.
texts.en:
Felipa is 50 years old. She is a widow, and lives with her daughters and granddaughters in her own home. For 20 years she has worked selling cheese. Every morning, she sets up shop informally on the outskirts of her town's central market, because she does not have a stable space. She also sells in the markets in neighboring towns, and has dedicated customers who work at an institution, and for whom she restocks her cheeses two times a week. Her primary supplier is one of her neighbors, who produces cheese and distributes it wholesale. This way, Felipa can sell as much as 200 kilos of fresh cheese each week, and during holiday times she earns much more, for example, during the recent national celebrations. In the near future, Felipa would like to sell other products, and have her own space in the market. This is her first loan from MFP. For her, working with this type of credit is a new experience, and she has promised to make her payments on time. The funds she is requesting will be invested in purchasing more cheese, as well as other foods she will begin to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Nancy es soltera, tiene 49 años y 2 hijos, Nancy se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos como chapla y wawa, los cuales los comercializa en un puesto del mercado F. Vivanco. Además Nancy vende abarrotes en general en las ferias, actividad que realiza los días domingos.
Nancy necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y abarrotes.
Los sueños de Nancy son construir el segundo piso de su casa.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Kusikuy communal bank, which means "Cheer up" in quechua. Nancy is single. She is 49 years old and has two children. Nancy works making traditional breads (such as "chapla" and "wawa"), which she sells at her space in the F. Vivanco market. In addition, Nancy sells other groceries at the markets on Sundays. Nancy needs a loan of 1500 soles, which will be used to purchase flour and groceries. Nancy's dream is to add a second floor to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and groceries

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Delfina es casada, tiene 60 años y 3 hijos, Delfina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, además el esposo D. Delfina realiza trabajos en plata y Delfina se encarga D. las ventas.
Delfina necesita un préstamo D. 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y aceite.
Los sueños D. Delfina son tener una tienda por mayor y mejorar su salud.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Kusiky Community Bank. “Kusiky” means “be happy” in quechua. Delifina is married and 60 years old with three children. She has a shop in her house where she sells general groceries, vegetables and fruits. Delfina’s husband carries out short term jobs, and Delfina is in charge of sales.

Delfina needs a loan of 1800 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil. Delfina’s dreams are to have a wholesale shop and to improve her welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Gayceli

texts.es: Gayceli tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y su bebe de 7 meses en su casa propia. Desde los 19 años implementó, en un espacio de su casa, una tienda donde vende diversos productos comestibles y otros artículos para el uso en el hogar. De esta manera trabaja atendiendo esmeradamente a su clientela, la que cada día le asegura los ingresos económicos que necesita para mejorar su calidad de vida. Gayceli se abastece de mercadería cada semana, pues así logra satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Debido a las ganancias obtenidas durante todos estos años, Gayceli se proyecta al futuro con una tienda más grande y con mayor variedad y cantidad de productos que ofrecer. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy animada de continuar el trabajo en equipo con su banco comunal, así como de seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería en productos comestibles de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Gayceli is 30 years old, and lives with her husband and seven-month-old baby in her own home. Since she was 19 years old, she has run, in a space in her house, a store where she sells various foods and household items. She works carefully with her customers, so she has a secure income she can use to improve her quality of life. Gayceli stocks up on merchandise every week, so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

Due to the income she has earned in these years, Gayceli sees herself in the future with a larger store and with a greater variety and quantity of products to sell. This is the fifth time she has taken out a loan with MFP; she is excited to continue working with the team at her communal bank, and will continue making punctual payments. The money that she requests will be used to buy merchandise and basic goods.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in merchandise

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Luzmila es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Luzmila compra cereales que luego procesa en el molino de su hermano, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad. Además Luzmila tiene 2 carros que alquila.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo de 1350 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo.
Los sueños de Luzmila son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the community bank Kusikuy, which means "rejoice" in Quechua. She lives with a partner, is 39 years old and has two children.

Luzmila buys grain that she processes in her brother's mill, and then sells in her city's markets. Luzmila also has two carts that she rents.

Luzmila needs a loan of 1350 PEN that she will invest in buying wheat. Her dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat

loans.name: Leocrecia

texts.es:
Leocrecia es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Leocrecia es casada, tiene 57 años y 9 hijos, Leocrecia tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, verduras, helados, gas actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija.
Leocrecia necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gas y bebidas.
Los sueños D. Leocrecia son tener una tienda mayorista y vender por mayor gas.
texts.en:
Leocrecia is a member of the community bank Kusikuy, which means "rejoice" in Quechua. Leocrecia is married, 59 years old, and has 9 children. She has a small store in her house where she sells general groceries, drinks, vegetables, ice cream, and gas. She works there with the help of her daughter.

Leocrecia needs a loan of 1500 PEN which will be invested in drinks and gas. Her dream is to have a wholesale store where she sells gas.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gas and drinks

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Felipa es casada, tiene 39 años, Felipa viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y de las ferias compra quesos, animales menores que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Felipa teje chompas que vende en las ferias.
Felipa necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de verduras y lana.
Los sueños de Felipa son mejorar su negocio y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felipa is a member of the Communal Bank Kusikuy, which means “rejoice” in Quecha. She is 39 years old and married. Felipa travels to different markets in the region to sell vegetables. While at the markets, she buys cheese and small animals so that she can sell them in Ayacucho. She also produces woven sweaters to sell in the markets.

Felipa needs a loan of 900 soles to buy vegetables and wool. She dreams of expanding and improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vegetables & wool

loans.name: Namerta

texts.es:
Namerta es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Namerta es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Namerta viaja a las diferentes ferias en donD. venD. frutas y D. las ferias compra queso, animales menores, productos que venD. en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Namerta tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes en su casa.
Namerta necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite.
Los sueños D. Namerta son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales y comprar un carro para transportar sus productos.
texts.en:
Namerta is a member of Kusikuy Village Bank, which means be happy in quechua.

She is a 36-year-old married mother of four children and makes a living traveling to different markets to sell fruits, where she also buys cheese and young animals to sell in the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Additionally, she has a small grocery store at home.

Namerta requests a loan of 1050 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and oil.

Her dreams are to educate her children so that they can become professionals and also to buy a car for the transport of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Kusikuy que significa alégrate en quechua.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 44 años y 4 hijos, de profesión Enfermera, Felicitas tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo mayor.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de bebidas.
Los sueños de Felicitas son tener una tienda mayorista y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Felicita is a member of the Kusikuy Community Bank. Kusikuy means rejoice in Quechua. Felicita is married, 44 years old and has four children. She is a nurse. She has a store in her house where she sells groceries, fruit and vegetables. She runs the store with the assistance of her oldest son. Felicita needs a loan of 900 soles, money that she will use to buy beverages. Felicita’s dreams are to have a wholesale store and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beverages

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 menores hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la ganadería, diariamente acude a su establo para alimentar a sus animales y en otras ocasiones los lleva a espacios abiertos con pastos frescos. Por las mañanas vende la leche que obtiene de sus vacas y cuando los becerros han crecido, los vende a muy buenos precios en las diferentes ferias ganaderas de su localidad. Su esposo y sus hijos la apoyan en estas tareas, ya que es una actividad familiar y la fuente principal de sus ingresos económicos, por lo que unen esfuerzos para lograr aumentar sus ganancias cada vez más. El deseo de Victoria a futuro es lograr que todo su ganado esté conformado por animales de muy buena raza, pues eso incrementaría su valor. Esta es la quinta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, sus ganas de progreso la han llevado a ser una de las integrantes más activas de su banco comunal y en esta oportunidad continuará  realizando un trabajo responsable. El dinero que solicita será utilizado en la compra de una vaquilla para incrementar la cantidad de animales que tiene.
texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and two minor children in their own house. For over twenty years she has worked with cattle. Daily she goes to the barn to feed the animals. On other occasions she takes them to open spaces with green pastures. In the mornings she sells milk that she gets from her cows. When the calves have grown she sells them for a good price at different cattle auctions near her home. Her husband and her children also work in this business. It is a family business and their main source of income. With a united effort they increase their income. What Victoria desires in the future is that all her stock of cattle is of a good breed. This is how it increases in value. This is the fifth time that she has had a loan with MFP, Her desire to progress has caused her to be one of the most active members in the community bank and with this opportunity she will continue to work responsibly. The money that she asks for will be used to buy a cow in order to increase her number of animals.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a cow.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92658&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.  
Juana sigue  trabajando en  venta productos  de belleza por catalogo, pero ahora vende tres lineas de belleza.   
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para  la compra de productos de belleza  para su stock. 
El préstamo ayuda mucho por que puede cubrir sus pedidos de sus clientas, por que a ella le pagan cada quince días y ahora ella cuenta con un capital. 
El sueño de Juana es que sus ventas  sigan creciendo y tener un puesto de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92658&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Juana is a member of the Triunfaremos Community Bank. Juana continues to work selling beauty products by catalog. But, now she sells three lines of beauty products. Juana needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy beauty products for her stock. The loan helps a lot to be able to cover her customers’ orders. They pay her every 15 days, and now she has the capital. Juana’s dream is that her sales keep growing and that she has a clothing sales stall.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beauty products for her stock

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es  socia  del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Luz es casada tiene 43 años, tiene un hijo de ocho años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Luz  es química farmacéutica estudio en la universidad San Luís Gonsaga de Ica, trabajo para el ministerio de salud por cinco años, después tomo la decisión de independizarse y poner una botica en Villa el Salvador, cuenta con personas especializadas  que le ayudan su negocio, es por eso que  ella por las mañanas trabaja  medio tiempo en una cadena de farmacias.   
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió administrar su negocio y  aprendió a invertir   
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de medicamentos y pañales. 
El sueño de Luz es  tener una cadena de boticas en otros distritos.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank.
Luz is 43 years old, married and has an 8-year-old son who attends the state school.
Luz is a pharmaceutical chemist. She studied at San Luís Gonzaga de Ica University and worked for the Ministry of Health for five years. She then decided to become independent, opening a pharmacy in Villa el Salvador. She has specialists who help her with the business, which is why she works part-time for a pharmacy chain in the mornings.
Since she has been with Finca, she has learned how to run her business and invest.
Luz needs a 2000 PEN loan to purchase medicines and diapers.
Luz dreams of owning a chain of pharmacies in other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase medicines and diapers

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92659&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Inés es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Inés  tiene una pequeña bodega “Diana” ella atiende todo el día, ahora en su negocio vende helados  la empresa  de Donófrio le ha puesto un congelador, y aun que ahora estamos en invierno vende helados.
Los préstamos le han ayudado  a surtir su bodega y tener un capital tiene  un poco más surtida su bodega.   
Inés necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles, para la compra de saco de arroz azúcar  y  aceite, 
El sueño de Inés es que su negocio crezca cada día, tener mas ventas; que su  hijo el menor estudie una carrera que  sea un profesional, por que los demás no quisieron estudiar.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Village Bank Unidas Triunfaremos (United We Triumph).

Inés has a small store "Diana" which she tends to all day. Right now her business sells Donófrio brand ice cream which gave her a freezer. Even in the winter she is able to sell ice cream.

This loan will help her stock her store and give her the capital to keep a better stocked store. Inés needs a loan of 2200 soles in order to buy rice, sugar, and oil.

Inés's dream is that her business grows daily and she has more sales and that her youngest song can study for a career as a professional since her other children did not want to study.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Savina

texts.es:
Savina es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos
Savina es separada tiene 49 años, tiene un hijo de treinta años que trabaja y es independiente. 
Savina se dedicaba a  cuidar a su hijo y a su casa ella no sabia leer ni escribir pero se matriculo en una escuela nocturna a la edad de veinticinco años, para poder ayudar a su hijo con las tareas de la escuela, ella termino toda la primaria completa, la necesidad la obligo a trabajar en la calle con la venta de golosinas y gaseosas, ella vende en una esquina por mas  de veinte años   
Desde que Savina esta en Finca  ella aprendió a invertir, aprendió a trabajar, a ser cumplida y responsable, con los prestamos que recibe.
Savina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra de golosinas, galletas, chocolates, chicles.
El sueño de Savina es  tener en su casa un negocio de bodega.
texts.en:
Savina is a member of the Communal Bank “Unidas Triumfaremos”. She is 49 years old and separated from her spouse. She has a 30 year old son who lives on his own. Savina spent many years taking care of her son and was not able to read or write. At the age of 25, she enrolled in night school and was soon able to help her son with his homework. She completed an elementary school level education, which helped her start a business as a street vendor selling candy and soft drinks. Savina has been selling from her corner vending post for more than 20 years.

Since joining FINCA, Savina has learned how to invest, work responsibly, and complete her obligations on the loans that she has received. She is currently requesting a loan of 800 soles to purchase candy, cookies, chocolates, and chewing gum. Savina hopes to open a grocery store from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, chocolates, and chewing gum

loans.name: Yolanda Orfelinda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92661&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Yolanda tiene su  picantería, ella ha  empezado a vender por las noches salchi-papas y anticuchos los fines de semana  por que la gente le esta pidiendo. 
Los préstamos que Finca da son  un respaldo para el negocio
Yolanda necesita un crédito  de 3000 soles, para invertirlos en cerveza, gaseosa, pescado y mariscos. 
El sueño de Yolanda es seguir trabajando, ella siente que ha logrado todo lo que anhelo en la vida y ahora quiere ver surgir  a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Unidas Triumfaremos Community Bank. Yolanda has her “picanteria” (a restaurant specializing in Ecuadorian soup). She has started to sell “salchipapas” (fast food made from fried sausages and fried potatoes) and kebobs on the weekends because people were asking for them. The loans that Finca gives are a support for the business. Yolanda needs a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and shellfish. Yolanda’s dream is to keep working. She feels that she has achieved all that she has longed to do in life. Now she wants to see her children excel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beer, soft drinks, fish, and shellfish

loans.name: Diana Del Pilar

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92665&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Diana  es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Diana Tiene su Salón de belleza y sigue  enseñando   en un centro educativo por las mañanas, también se ha puesto a vender productos de belleza por catalogo.
Los prestamos son de grana yuda, su negocio esta creciendo.  
Necesita un préstamo de 2200 soles,  para la compra de secadora profesional y materia les para salón de belleza, tintes, líquidos. 
El sueño de Diana es vender productos de salón de belleza al por mayor y abrir una escuela de cosmetología.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos (United We Will Succeed Communal Bank). Diana has a beauty salon and she continues to teach at a learning center during the morning. She also has a stand to sell beauty products from the catalog. The loans are a great help and her business is growing. She needs a loan of 2,200 Sols to buy a professional hair dryer and supplies for the beauty salon, such as liquid hair color. Diana dreams of selling products for beauty salons wholesale and of opening a school of cosmetology. Click Here to see her previous loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a professional hair dryer and supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Maria es  casada tiene cinco hijos de, el menor tiene cinco años que esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Maria  puso una bodega en su casa, la tuvo que Serra por que sus hijas no quisieron ayudarle a tender y ella se puso a estudiar cosmetología  cuando termino puso su peluquería, pero al tiempo le robaron todas las cosas de su peluquería  que quedaba en su casa, pero ella no se dio por vencida en un mercado abrió un apequeña peluquería pero nuevamente la tuvo que serrar por que su empleada se fue de vacaciones, ella se puso a  trabajar  en la tienda de su  hermana en la venta de bisutería. 
Desde que Maria esta en Finca  esta aprendiendo a invertir y tiene  muchas ideas de negocio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de bisutería de plata  cadenas, pulseras, anillos.
El sueño de Maria es abrir su peluquería nuevamente.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank. Maria is married and has five children. They youngest is five, and he attends the state school. Maria set up a grocery store in her house. She had to close it because her daughters did not want to help her with it. She started to study cosmetology. When she finished she set up a hair salon. All of her beauty salon things that were in her house were stolen. But, she did not give up. She opened a small hair salon in a market. Once again, she had to close it because her employee went on vacation. She went to work in her sister’s jewelry store. Since Maria has been with Finca she has been learning to invest, and she has lots of business ideas. Maria needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy silver jewelry like chains, bracelets and rings. Maria’s dream is to once again open her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy silver jewelry like chains, bracelets and rings

loans.name: Ada Luisa

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 92666&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Ada es socia del Bancomunal  Unidas Triunfaremos.
Ada es viuda, tiene 69 años, 9 hijos, él última tiene 35 años, todos son mayores y están casados. 
Ada hace un año puso una  bodeguita en su casa, y ha puesto nuevamente un Internet en el segundo piso de su casa, su hija se encarga de atender.
Los prestamos han ayudado a que ella nuevamente pueda levantarse a pesar de los dificultades que ha tenido.  
Ada necesita un préstamo de 2800 soles, para su bodega  va comprar cerveza, gaseosa, azúcar, y  arroz.
El sueño de Ada es que su negocio crezca nuevamente y que cada uno de sus hijos tenga su negocio.
texts.en:
Previous Loan
Ada is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank.
Ada is a 69-year-old widow with nine grown and married children, the youngest of whom is 35 years old.
Ada opened a small store in her home a year ago. Her daughter attends to the re-installed Internet café on the second floor.
The loans have helped her raise herself up again despite all the difficulties that she has had.
Ada needs a 2800 PEN loan to purchase beer, soft drinks, sugar and rice for her store.
Ada dreams of growing her business again and of her children having their own businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer, soft drinks and sugar

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Lucia es casada tiene 51 años, tiene cinco hijos, el menor esta estudiando en la escuela estatal.
