Lucia trabajaba en el mercado vendiendo verduras y tubérculos con los ahorros se compro un carro y se puso a dar servicio de taxi, por varios años hasta que el año pasado le robaron su carro y asusto mucho pero eso no la detuvo,  con los ahorros que tenia se compro una combi de segunda ahora da servicio de movilidad escolar, se siente mas tranquila.  
Desde que Lucia esta en Finca, se siente contenta de haber encontrado una entidad que apoya al surgimiento de la mujer, económico y emocional a través de charlas.
Lucia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para el mantenimiento de su carro, por que va pasar revisión técnica.
El sueño de Lucia es tener un carro moderno y nuevo.
texts.en:
Lucia is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Community Bank. Lucia is 51, married, and has five children. The youngest child attends the state school. Lucia worked in the market selling vegetables and tubers. She bought a car with her savings. She started a taxi service, which she had for several years. Last year her car was stolen. She was very frightened, but that did not stop her. With the savings that she had, she bought a second hand van. She provides school transportation. She feels more at peace. Since Lucia has been with Finca, she feels happy to have found an entity that supports the economic and emotional blossoming of women through their talks. Lucian needs a loan for 2,000 PEN for maintenance on her car because it needs to pass inspection. Lucia’s dream is to have a new and modern car.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on her car because it needs to pass inspection

loans.name: Claire

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92698&_tpos=1&_tpg=1
Claire es socia del Bancomunal Unidas Triunfaremos.
Claire es casada tiene 5 hijos de 31, 27, 21,13 y 7 años, los dos últimos están en la edad escolar. 
Claire  no trabaja por que sufre de la presión alta y no puede trabajar, ella ayuda a su esposo con los prestamos el  da el servicio de taxi todo el día.  
El préstamo es de gran ayuda para su familia  por que ellos invierten en el arreglo del carro  es el único ingreso que ellos tienen. 
Claire necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, ellos van a invertir en la compra de una combi para dar movilidad. 
El sueño de Claire es que todo le vaya bien con el servició de movilidad.
texts.en:
Claire is a member of the Unidas Triunfaremos Village Bank. She is married with five children ages 31, 27, 21, 13, and 7. The two youngest are school-aged. Clare does not work because she suffers from high blood pressure, instead helping her husband with loans since he provides taxi services all day long. The loan is a great help to her family because they will invest it in car repairs, which serves as their only source of income. Claire requests a loan of 1400 soles which they will invest in the purchase of a van to give them mobility. Claire’s dream is that everything goes well with the transportation service. Her previous loan can be found here: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92698&_tpos=1&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a van

loans.name: Primero De Mayo_Jovenes Group

texts.es: En el Centro Focal “Villa Tejada” se encuentra un grupo de jóvenes que se denominan “Primero de Mayo_Jóvenes”, todos tienen sus propios negocios, por ejemplo Edwin tiene el negocio de tapicería, él necesita el préstamo para  comprar materia prima como el tapiz y seguir trabajando, los demás integrantes también tienen sus propios negocios como la venta de cuadernos, chompas y gasolina. Todos estos jóvenes estudian en diferentes lugares, apoyándose económicamente con los ingresos que generan sus negocios.
texts.en:
In Villa Tejada you will find a group of teenagers who belong to an organization called "Primero de Mayo Jovenes". Each of the members has his or her own business. For example, Edwin has an upholstery business and needs a loan to purchase materials such as fabric. The other members have various businesses, such as selling office supplies and fuel. The members of this group continue with their studying at various schools, using the money they make from their businesses to support their education.


Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for their respective businesses.  The money they earn helps pay for their education.

loans.name: Primero De Mayo Group

texts.es: En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer “Villa Tejada” se encuentra  la Asociación Comunal “Primero de Mayo”,con 13 integrantes, trabajan de manera ordenada junto a su asesora. Su presidenta es  Hilda C. quien indica que se agruparon recientemente para acceder al préstamo y poder invertir en sus negocios. Todas tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de diesel, zapatillas, repuestos de autos, ropa, jugos, api, medias, zapatos, frutas, polleras y libros. Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería y tener productos variados  que ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In one of the main centers of Pro Mujer, called Villa Tejada, you will find a communal organization called Primero de Mayo. The group consists of 13 members, each of whom runs a business with guidance from an advisor. Hilda C., the president of the group, explained that the group came together recently to apply for the loan to invest in their respective businesses. The members work selling fuel, doing auto repairs, selling shoes, clothing, as well as fruits and vegetables. Each member needs a portion of the loan to invest in merchandise and supplies to offer to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and supplies for their respective businesses

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es: Demetrio es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 61 años, y nunca se casó, es por ello que vive solo en su casa propia. Desde hace 2 años y medio se dedica al alquiler de su cochera para guardar carritos sangucheros y salchipaperos (carritos que venden comida). Decidió incursionar en este negocio debido a que su sueldo de jubilado no le alcanza para cubrir todos sus gastos, es por ello que emprendió un negocio que puede realizar desde su propia casa. Actualmente alberga 14 carritos, los cuales le pagan al día dos soles, con lo cual Demetrio genera algunos ingresos extras para su economía. Por otro lado, nos comenta que este trabajo es una forma de mantenerse activo y no sentirse solo. Este es su segundo préstamo individual con MFP, y con el dinero que viene solicitando planea ampliar el espacio de su cochera para poder albergar a más móviles e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Demetrio is a very hard working 61-year-old man. Never married, he lives by himself in his own house. For the past two and a half years he has rented out his garage to house the cars of food vendors. He decided to venture out into this business due to the fact that his retirement pay was not enough to cover his expenses. For this reason he launched a business that he could run from his home. Currently the garage accommodates 14 cars at the rate of 2 soles a day, used as extra income to help his finances. On the other hand, Demetrio’s work also serves as a way for him to stay active and not feel alone. This is the second individual loan that he has requested with MFP, and with the money he plans to increase his garage space in order to accommodate more cars and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase the size of his garage

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania es una mujer trabajadora D. 21 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su familia en el distrito D. Ventanilla, en Lima. Se dedica a la venta D. verduras en un puesto del mercado “12 D. Mayo” D. su localidad. Por ser uno D. los mercados más conocidos, Epifania tiene mucha clientela, debido también al buen trato que ofrece se ha hecho D. clientes regulares, pues los trata como si fueran amigos que conociera desD. hace muchos años; asimismo, ofrece buenos precios y productos D. buena calidad. Su negocio le está resultando rentable, pues está trabajando muy duro para lograr todas sus metas, sabe que su progreso se hará en base a esfuerzo y dedicación. Es su décimo préstamo con su grupo solidario en MFP, ella y sus compañeras siempre han sido muy puntuales y estrictas a la hora D. hacer los pagos, y es así que se compromete para este nuevo crédito. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad D. verduras para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Epifania is a hard working 21-year-old who lives in her own house next to her family in the Ventanilla district in Lima. She sells fruits at a stand in the “12 D. Mayo” market in her village, one of the more well-known markets. As a result Epifania has many customers, but also because of the good treatment that she gives to her regulars, who she treats more like old friends. In addition, she offers good prices and high-quality products. Her business is becoming increasingly profitable because she is working very hard to achieve all of her goals, as she knows that her progress is based on her effort and dedication. This is her tenth loan with her solidarity group from MFP. Her group members have always been very punctual and strict about making their payments on time and they have promised the same with this credit. With her loan she will purchase the best quality vegetables in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha tiene 54 años, vive con su esposo, Daniel, de 54 años y sus hijos: Henry de 34, Jimy de 33, Edwar de 28 y Jean de 25 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos por pedido, ofrece a sus vecinas los bonitos modelos que trae desde la ciudad de Trujillo (departamento al norte de Lima), donde se elabora calzado de muy buena calidad y novedosos diseños. Bertha viaja constantemente para adquirir su mercadería y posteriormente venderla casa por casa, según el pedido realizado. El negocio le resulta muy rentable, ya que cada vez sus ventas van en aumento, es por ello que ahora quiere aumentar su mercadería y así hacer crecer su negocio. Para el futuro, Bertha quisiera tener una tienda en su casa para no tener que caminar tanto, ya que es muy cansado ir de casa en casa a dejar los pedidos y realizar las cobranzas. Este es su primer préstamo individual con MFP, con su trabajo anterior en bancos comunales tiene la experiencia de educarse en la puntualidad de sus pagos, por lo que está comprometida en la puntual devolución de su crédito. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de zapatos para comenzar la expansión de su negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is 54 years old and lives with her husband, Daniel, also 54 years old, and their children, Henry (34), Jimy (33), Edwar (28) and Jean (25). She sells shoes by order for a living, offering her neighbors beautiful models that she brings from the city of Trujillo (a province to the north of Lima) where they make excellent quality footwear in original designs. Bertha travels constantly in order to acquire her merchandise and afterwards to sell it door to door according to the orders placed. The business has become very profitable, and now that her sales are increasing, she would like to increase her merchandize and grow her business. In the future, Bertha would like to have a store in her house so she won’t need to walk so much; it is very tiring going from house to house leaving orders and collecting money. This is her first individual loan with MFP. With her previous work in communal banks she had the opportunity to educate herself in the punctuality of payments, and thus is committed to the prompt return of her loan. With the money she is asking for, she will buy a bigger quantity of shoes in order to begin the expansion of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing merchandise

loans.name: Unidos Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL
UNIDOS TRIUNFAREMOS 

L. Alcancia Comunal “Unidos Triunfaremos” conformado por 10 integrantes, viene trabajando  con EDAPROSPO hace  cuatro años, en L. cual demuestran puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.

Tienen diferentes actividades cotidianas por ejemplo:  Martín, presidente del grupo, compra y venD. artículos usados; L. Sra. Nancy, tesorera del grupo,  se dedica a L. confección y venta D. prendas D. vestir hace muchos años, elL. estudió desD. muy pequeña y poco a poco pudo sobresalir en este campo, ahora tiene sus propias máquinas que le facilitan el trabajo. Esta muy contenta D. pertenecer al grupo.

Jenny se dedica a L. venta D. cosas descartables, tales como platos, vasos, cubiertos, bolsas etc. en el mercado central.
Raúl confecciona todo tipo D. lencería juntamente con su hermano  Yac que además es cantante.

Dina se dedica a L. venta D. dulces tales como pasteles, y mazamorras que son los más pedidos. Las otras socias se dedican a L. venta D. cosméticos por catalogo.

Todos los socios afirman que desean aumentar el capital para sus negocios, y así poder comprar más productos e insumos que le ayudaran a aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
The Unidos Triunfaremos Community Bank is maD. up of ten members who have been working with EDAPROSPO for four years. They demonstrate punctuality and responsibility in their payments. They have different daily activities. For example, Martin, president of the group, buys and sells used things. Nancy, the group treasurer, has been making and selling clothes for many years. She studied since she was very small. Little by little she has been able to exceed in this field. Now she has her own machines that facilitate her work. She is very happy to belong to the group. Jenny sells disposable products like plates, glasses, cutlery, and bags, etc. in the central market. Raúl makes all types of lingerie with his brother, Yac, who is also a singer. Dina sells sweets like cakes and pudding, which are the most requested items. The other members sell cosmetics by catalog. All of the members want to increase the capital for their businesses and be able to buy more products and supplies, which will help to increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Illimani Group

texts.es: Jovita U., cuenta que es parte de la Asociación Comunal “Illimani” hace 3 años, ingresó por la necesidad de incrementar su capital de trabajo, ella tiene un taller de carpintería, trabaja junto a su hijo quien elabora los muebles y su hija vende los mismos, en esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar madera. Al igual que Jovita las demás integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de cosméticos, ropa, dulces, camisas, comida, pasteles y tienda de barrio. Todas necesitan del préstamo para invertir en sus negocios comprando mercadería.
texts.en:
Jovita Ilo states that she has been part of the “Illimani” Community Association for three years. She became a member because of the necessity of increasing her working capital. She has a carpentry workshop. She works with her son, who makes furniture, and her daughter, who sells it.

On this occasion, she needs the loan in order to buy wood. Like Jovita, the rest of the members have different businesses such as the sale of cosmetics, clothing, sweets, shirts, food, cakes, and neighborhood shops. They all need loans for investing in their businesses and buying merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89349&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Maria Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Maria ha incursionado en otro negocio, se ha comprado un carro sanguchero (sandwich) que  su hija lo trabaja en la puerta de la casa de sus suegros en San Juan v ella también se ha puesto a vender productos de belleza por catalogo y trabaja como enfermera particular.
Los préstamos le están ayudando a crecer en otros negocios.
Ella necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, los va invertir en el arreglo de su moto-car le va a dar mantenimiento  por que va pasar revisión técnica.
El sueño de Maria Elena sigue siendo el mismo  es poner en su casa una botica, por que no hay por la zona.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the village bank Mi Buen Pastor ("My good shepherd").

Maria Elena has entered into another business; she bought a sanguchero (sandwich) cart that her daughter works in the doorway of her in-laws' house in San Juan. She also has been selling beauty products from a catalog and works as a personal nurse.

She is asking for a loan to help her expand into other businesses. She needs a loan of 1600 soles to invest in fixing her moto-car (a three-wheeled small car/motorcycle) so that it passes a technical review.

Maria Elena's dream is to start a pharmacy in her home since there isn't one in the area. Earlier Loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89349&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fixing her moto-car

loans.name: Sara Dina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89351&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Sara es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen pastor.
Sara Tiene una fuente de soda “la vallita” distribuye a los mercados y a dulcerías,  también se ha puesto a vender productos de belleza por catalogo      
Los préstamos le están ayudando a crecer en su negocio.
Sara necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para la compra de insumos y quiere comprar una batidora semindustrial.
El sueño de Sara es tener una dulcería y partería fina, fuera de San Juan.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Sara is a member of the Communal Bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She operates a soda shop called La Vallita and distributes baked goods to grocery stores and candy shops. In addition, she sells beauty products by catalog. Her previous loans have helped her expand her business.

At the moment, Sara needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy supplies and a semi-industrial blender. She dreams of opening a candy store and starting a midwifery practice outside of San Juan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & a semi-industrial blender

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal  Mi Buen Pastor.  
Maria es casada tiene 55 años, cinco hijos que son mayores y trabajan.
Maria empezó en los negocios vendiendo pollos hace veinte años, un vecino la animo el tenia un puesto cerrado  en el mercado y  se lo dio en alquiler, le gusto el negocio y  continuo hasta  el día de hoy, por otro lado su cuñado la animo a que entre en la venta al por mayor de agua mineral, su cuñado le consiguió todos los contactos, ella vende en su casa, y también ella se dedica a la venta de productos por catalogo, es directora de un grupo de vendedoras.  
Desde que Maria esta en Finca, ella ha encontrado un gran apoyo, por la facilidades con los créditos  
Maria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles, los invierte en productos de belleza
El sueño de Maria es  tener una avícola grande y tener un local de eventos
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She is 55 years and has 5 adult children who are working.

Maria began selling chickens twenty years ago when a neighbor had a vending post available for rent in the market. She enjoys working every day to keep her business going. Her brother-in-law urged her to start selling mineral water wholesale since he has several contacts. Maria sold her house and is also selling beauty products by catalog. She is a director who supervises a group of saleswomen.

Since joining FINCA, Maria has found a great deal of support by taking advantage of its credit services. She needs a loan of 3000 soles to purchase beauty products. Maria dreams of having a large poultry farm and starting an events business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89353&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Yolanda es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Yolanda   se dedica a la venta D.  productos D. belleza por  catalogo, también hace marcianos y  los venD. en su casa, también ella se esta dedicando a la venta D. ropa por pedidos.  
Los prestamos son D. mucha ayuda  pueD. invertir.
Ella necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para la compra D. ropa.  
El sueño D. Yolanda  tener un puesto  propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor Community Bank. She makes a living selling beauty products via catalog and also makes marcianos (traditional regional popsicles) and sells them out of her home. She also sells clothing by order. The loans she has received have helped her a lot in investing in her businesses. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 1000 soles (approximately $350) to purchase clothing. Yolanda's dream is to have her own sales post in the market. Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89353&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Natalia

texts.es:
Natalia es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Natalia es casada tiene 58 años, tres hijos de 31, 29,27 años, ellos ya son independientes trabajan.
Natalia  es administradora de empresa trabajo en un laboratorio por 20 años se retiro por que se dedico a su casa y a sus hijos, empezó a viajar y a traer cosas para vender por diez años en el transcurso puso una bodega- bazar-librería. También  se esta dedicando a  ser consultora de vélelas de una linia brasileña.  
Desde que Natalia esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar y tiene muchas amigas. 
Natalia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para surtir su librería- bazar-regalos.
El sueño de Natalia poner una empresa familiar con sus hijos de eventos matrimonios.
texts.en:
Natalia is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd) Community Bank. She is married, 58 years old, and has three children aged 31, 29, and 27. They have jobs and are independent. Natalia is a business administrator. She worked in a laboratory for twenty years, then stopped work to stay at home and raise her children. Over the next ten years she began to travel and to bring back things to sell. As time passed, she opened a bookstore/corner store selling a wide range of items. She also earns money as consultant for a Brazilian line of beauty products. Since joining Kiva partner Finca, Natalia has learned how to save money, and she has made many friends. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy stock for her store. Her dream is to start a family business with her children organizing wedding events.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to stock her cornerstore/book store

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina es socio del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Delfina es casada tiene 54 años, tiene  cinco hijos todos son mayores.
Desfina trabajo en un puesto de periódico como ayudante por un tiempo de dos años, y se independizó cuando tenia  17 años desde entonces ella solo se dedica a la venta de periódico, empezó en la victoria, pero se mudo a San Juan de Miraflores donde se compro un terrenito y hizo su casa, y  en una esquina se ha puesto a vender periódico con  la ayuda de su hija menor. 
Desde que Delfina esta en Finca   aprendió mas de cómo administrar  su negocio
Delfina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles para la compra de periódicos, revistas, álbumes, figuritas. 
El sueño de delfina es llenar su puesto con variedad de revista y periódicos.
texts.en:
Delfina is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd) Community Bank. She is married, 54 years old, and has five adult children. Delfina worked as an assistant in a newspaper kiosk for two years, and then at the age of 17 she started her own business selling newspapers. She began in La Victoria neighbourhood, and then moved to San Juan de Miraflores where she bought a piece of land and built a house. On one corner she has started to sell newspapers with the help of her youngest daughter. Since Delfina has been with Kiva partner Finca she has learned more about running her business. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy newspapers, magazines, albums, and figurines. Her dream is stock her kiosk with a wide range of magazines and newspapers.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy newspapers, magazines, albums, and figurines

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Bancomunal Mi buen Pastor.
Maria es  casada tiene 50 años  tres hijos de 28, 27,26 años que trabajan.   
Maria  estudio  para hacer manualidades en tela, en madera y  pinturas, tenia un taller y personal a su cargo, pero lo dejo por que se dedico  venta de productos por catalogó, le puso tanto empeño que ella tiene a su cargo 60 vendedoras y la han nombrado ejecutiva de ventas.
Desde que Maria esta en Finca esta en Finca, a prendió a organizarse  en su trabajó y a llegar a sus metas en el negocio.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de productos de bellezas por catalogo.
El sueño de Maria  es retomar su taller de manualidades y hacerlo mas grande.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd) Community Bank. She is married, 50 years old, and has three children aged 28, 27, and 26, all of whom are working. Maria has studied how to make handicrafts out of textiles and wood, and also how to paint. She used to have a workshop and assistants, but now she sells products from a catalogue. She put in so much effort that she now has 60 women selling the items and has been named director of sales. Since Maria joined Kiva partner Finca, she has learned how to better run her business and how to reach her goals. She needs a loan of 2000 soles to buy beauty products to sell via catalogue. Her dream is to start up her workshop once again and expand it.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89355&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Luís es socio del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor.
Luís. Se sigue dedicando a la repostería fina, se esta dedicando hacer tortas de matrimonio, quince años y para eventos especiales y el reparte en los mercados
Los prestamos ayudan para la compra de insumos y poder atender los pedidos que le realizan.
Luís necesita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de ingredientes para los pasteles, harina, huevo, leche.
El sueño de Luís abrir una pastelería y hacer pasteles para empresas grandes y distribuir a otros distritos.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Luis is a member of the Communal Bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). He continues to make and sell fine pastries and wedding cakes. Since he was 15, Luis has worked special events and produced baked goods for delivery to the markets.

He is requesting a loan of 2000 soles to buy ingredients for making pastries, such as flour, eggs and milk. Luis hopes to open a pastry shop and produce pastries for large businesses and distribution to other districts.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making pastries

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 89356&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Elena es socia del Bancomunal Mi Buen Pastor. 
Elena  se puso a trabajar en la venta de fruta  con su esposo en un puesto alquilado, también tiene un negocio de alquiler de moto-car.
Los préstamos le dan  una seguridad de poder invertir y ampliar su negocio. 
Necesita un crédito de 2000 soles,  para la compra de fruta de la estación.
El sueño de Maria es terminar de estudiar dermatología y trabajar enseñando cosmetología y poner  un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank Mi Buen Pastor (My Good Shepherd). She works selling fruit with her husband in a rented stand; she also has a rental car business.

These loans give her security becuase she can invest in and increase her business. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN to buy in-season fruit. Maria's dream is to finish her dermatology studies and to work as a cosmetology teacher and open a beauty salon. (Her previous loan can be seen here: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=89356&_tpos=7&_tpg=1)

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy in-season fruit

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y sus cinco hijos en el caserío Lagunas en el distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella se dedica a la confección y bordado artesanal de manteles, los cuales vende en el mercado de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero y dos de sus hijos estudian en un colegio cercano, los otros tres han tenido que dejar sus estudios e ir a trabajar para ayudar a sostener la economía de casa, esta situación es muy común en los caseríos de la zona.

El negocio que ella maneja con mucho esfuerzo es una pequeña ayuda para sostener a su familia, pero Margarita desea que sus hijos continúen estudiando para que se aseguren un futuro mejor.

Ella está solictando un crédito de 550 nuevos soles para comprar hilos seguir confeccionando los manteles, lo cual le permita juntar el suficiente dinero para volver a mandar a sus hijos a la escuela y que ya no tengan que dejarla por ir a trabajar.

Margarita goza de muy buenas referencias entre sus vecinos, los cuales reconocen su trabajo y la apoyan cuando es necesario.
texts.en:
Margarita is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her husband and their five children in the small town of Lagunas in the Mórrope district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. She earns her living making and embroidering tablecloths, which she sells at the city market. Her husband works occasionally as a laborer. Two of their children go to the high school nearby, while the other three have had to leave school and go to work to help support the family. This is a very common occurrence in the towns in this region. Margarita's business, which she works so hard on, helps support her family to a small degree, but she wants her children to stay in school so they can be assured of a better future. She is seeking a loan for 550 soles to buy thread so she can keep making tablecloths and earn enough money to send her children back to school and not out to work. Margarita is highly regarded among her neighbors, who recognize her work and help her out when she needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy thread for making embroidered tablecloths

loans.name: Caminando Juntas Group

texts.es: Los miembros del grupo “Caminando Juntas” esta representado por la señora Rosa del Carmen y conformado por 17 familias dedican a diferentes actividades como masajistas, venta D. cosméticos por catálogos, dueños D. lavadero D. autos, confección D. ropa D. varón, miembro D. un grupo D. música, venta D. jugos, transportista, veterinaria a domicilio, venta D. ropa, venta D. joyas. La competencia en el mercado en que los socios del grupo se mueven es bastante competitivo pero las socias saben como salir adelante ya que cuentan con la confianza y fidelidad D. su clientela. La mayoría D. los miembros del grupo destinaran su financiamiento a la adquisición D. materiales e insumos que ayuden a mejorar sus ingresos para poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Las socias ya trabajaron bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que conocen la responsabilidad y la unidad que se requiere para salir adelante con el apoyo D. la Fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The members of the group Caminando Juntas (Walking Together) are represented by Mrs. Rosa del Carmen, and are maD. up of 17 families. They are involved in various activities, including massage, catalog cosmetic sales, a car wash, making men's clothing, a music group, juice sales, transportation, home veterinarian, clothing sales, and jewelry sales.

The competition in the markets these members work in is difficult, but these members know how to succeed and they can count on the trust and loyalty of their customers. The majority of the group members will use their loans to acquire materials and supplies that will help them improve their incomes, in order to give their families a better quality of life.

These members have already worked as a joint group, so they understand the responsibilities and the unity that are necessary to succeed with the support of the Agrocapital Foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Usnara

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que reside en el caserío Huaca de Barro del distrito de Mórrope, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace un año que se dedica a la compra aves de corral en los caseríos cercanos y todos los dias viaja muy temprano al mercado de la ciudad para venderlas, este pequeño negocio le ayuda en parte con los gastos de su hogar ya que su esposo, al igual que la mayoría de hombres de la zona, trabaja eventualmente como peón de labores agrícolas.

María tiene tres hijas de 17, 14 y 8 años de edad que estudian en un colegio cercano al lugar donde viven. Ella sabe que el progreso de sus hijas depende de sus estudios, por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales y así hacer crecer su negocio para captar más ingresos y poder seguir educando a sus hijas.

Ella goza de muy buenas referencias entre los vecinos de Huaca de Barro, los cuales reconocen que es una persona responsable y muy colaboradora cuando se la necesita.
texts.en:
María is a 35-year-old mother who lives in the town of Huaca de Barro in the Mórrope district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year she has earned her living buying poultry in nearby towns, and going to the city market early every day to sell them. Her small business helps out with some of the household expenses since her husband, like most of the men in the area, works intermittently as a farm laborer. María has three daughters, aged 17, 14, and 8 who go to school nearby. She knows that her daughters’ progress depends on their education. Consequently, she has decided that she needs to seek a loan for 1000 soles to buy more animals so she can grow her business and earn more money to keep educating her daughters. She enjoys high regard among her neighbors in Huaca de Barro, who recognize that she is a very responsible person who contributes whenever necessary.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poultry to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101965&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Flor es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Flor  estaba como ambulante en el mercado D. comas, en la venta D. ropa, se mudo D. puesto y lo dejó ahora venD. ropa pero por pedidos y venta D. productos D. belleza  por catalogo también  Flor va empezar a vender cerveza en su casa, así tener un ingreso adicional. Y por las mañanas se dedica al mantenimiento y limpieza en un condominio. 
Flor necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles, implementar su nuevo negocio.
El préstamo le ayuda para invertir en otros negocios, su capital va aumentando.
El sueño D. Flor es terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Flor is a member of the community bank El Triunfo (Triumph). Flor was working as a clothing vendor in the Comas market. She moved and left that business. Now she sells clothing and beauty products by catalog. Flor is going to start selling beer from her home, to have an additional source of income. And, in the mornings, she maintains and cleans a condominium.

Flor needs a loan of 2000 PEN to start her new business. The loan will help her to invest in her other businesses, so her capital will go on growing. Flor's dream is to finish building her home.

Her previous loan can be seen at http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=101965&_tpos=7&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin her new business

loans.name: Casilda

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101966&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Casilda  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Casilda  sigue trabajando en su bodega, ella trabaja  todo el día, atienD. sola.  
Casilda necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para comprar bebidas. 
El préstamo ha hecho que su capital aumente y tiene su bodega mas surtida. 
El sueño D. Casilda es seguir trabajando hasta que  sus fuerzas le den.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Casilda is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She continues working every day at her grocery store, which she manages by herself.

She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy beverages. The money will increase her operating capital so that her store remains well stocked. She hopes to continue working as long as she has the strength.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages

loans.name: Gloria Angelica

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Gloria  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Gloria esta en el negocio de  venta de ropa, de segunda importada, tiene un puesto alquilado con su hermano. 
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  de dos  sacos de ropa de invierno.
El préstamo  es de gran ayuda  por que puede tener su puesto surtido.
El sueño de Gloria es tener una tienda para vender su ropa y seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101969&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Gloria is a member of the cooperative bank El Triunfo. Gloria sells second-hand, imported clothing; she and her brother rent a site. She needs a loan of $350 to buy two sacks of winter clothing. The loan is a great help because she can keep her site well-stocked. Gloria's dream is to have a clothes store and continued prosperity.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: two sacks of winter clothing

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101970&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Martina  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Martina contrató un chofer  y se pusieron a trabajar en la venta de materiales y agregados de construcción, ofreciendo a las ferreterías y constructoras. Ella se dedica al control de facturas.
Martina necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles, para el arreglo del motor de su Tráiler.
El préstamo siempre ayuda para imprevistos que se presentan en los arreglos de sus Trailers
El sueño de Martina es comprarse un trailers.
texts.en:
Previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101970&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Martini is a member of the cooperative bank El Triunfo. Martini hired a driver and they began to sell construction materials and aggregates to hardware stores and construction companies. She handles the billing. Martini needs a loan of $825 to repair the motor of her truck. The loan is always useful in case of unforeseen expenses which may occur during the repair. Martina's dream is to buy her own truck.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the motor of her truck

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102237&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Esther  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Esther  sigue en la venta D. arpillaría,    también   venD. productos D. belleza por catalogo, y  por las  mañanas esta trabajando como cajera en una ceviche ría    
Esther necesita un préstamo D.  1000 soles,  para invertirlos en la compra D. productos D. Belleza. 
El préstamo le ayuda, a comprar productos en ofertas para después venderlo a precio real. 
El sueño D. Esther es ayudar económicamente a sus hijos, hasta que puedan mantenerse por si mismo y terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Esther's previous loan: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102237&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Esther is a partner at El Triunfo Community Bank. Ester continues to sell arpilleras (colorful stitched fabrics such as vests, little handbags, mittens, and decorative patches), and she sells beauty products by catalog. Also, in the mornings she works as a cashier at a ceviche (citrus-marinated seafood dish) shop. Esther needs a loan of 1000 soles to purchase beauty products. The loan helps her to buy products on sale and then sell them at normal price. Esther’s dream is to help her children financially until they can support themselves. She also dreams of finishing the construction on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment through the purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102238&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Marivel  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Marivel  tiene un local alquilado en una avenida de San Juan  tiene una librería donde ofrece servicios  de fotocopiadoras, anillados y artículos para oficina. Ella es cosmiatra  por las tardes trabaja en un spa 
Marivel necesita 2200 soles, para la compra de artículos para oficina, papeles, fólder, tintas. 
El préstamo ayuda a que pueda estar  surtiendo  su librería  y pueda aumentar su capital.
El sueño de Marivel es tener un local propio para su negocio en un lugar mas céntrico.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Marivel is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She has a rented shop on San Juan Avenue in which she operates a bookstore that also offers office supplies, photocopying, and ring binding services. In the afternoons, she works as a cosmetologist at a spa.

She needs 2200 soles to buy office supplies such as paper, folders, and ink. The loan will help her restock her bookstore and increase her operating capital. Marivel dreams of relocating her business to a more central location.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase office supplies (paper, folders, & ink)

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 102239&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Georgina es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo. 
Georgina  tiene su hija de un año y esto le impide trabajar a tiempo completo en el negocio por que tiene que cuidar a su hija todavía esta muy pequeña y  trabaja vendiendo  por pedidos loceria y útiles de limpieza.     
 Georgina  necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,   para la compra de loceria, tazas, platos cubiertos.
El préstamo le ayuda por que ella compra al contado y da facilidades de pago a sus clientas.
El sueño de Georgina es poner una tienda.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Georgina is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. She has a one year old daughter, which prevents her from working full-time. Since she has to care for her daughter while she is still young, she sells utensils and cleaning supplies upon order.

Georgina needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy dishes, cups, plates, and cutlery. The loan will help her pay cash for the merchandise so that she can allow her customers to purchase on credit. She dreams of opening her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dishes, cups, plates, and cutlery

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Préstamo anterior: http://partners.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id= 101981&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Julia  es socia del Bancomunal El Triunfo.
Julia desde hace años  se dedica por años a la venta de ropa por pedidos, ha estudiado un curso de cosmetología y se esta dedicando  hacer tratamientos de belleza y paquetes de novia.   
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de ropa de vestir.
El préstamo es de mucha ayuda, porque puede cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas.
El sueño de Julia es tener una boutique o un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Click HERE to see the previous loan.

Julia is a member of El Triunfo (The Triumph) Communal Bank. For years, she has been selling clothes upon request. Julia studied cosmetology and prepares beauty treatments and bridal packages.

She needs a loan of 1200 soles to buy clothes. The loan will be very helpful because she can fulfill her customers’ orders. Julia dreams of opening a boutique or a beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
Banco D. Emprendimiento:LAS PAGADORAS fue fundado el 17 D. julio D. 2009, a iniciativa D. un grupo D. señoras que tienen un pequeño negocio y desean surguir en un negocio. El grupo  esta en su 1er ciclo, compuesto por 12 personas, en el grupo hay señoras que se dedican a la venta D. bijouteria, comida, promotoras D. cosmeticos, venta D. edredones y sabanas, venta D. pastillas y refresco D. mocochinchi,  venta D. horneados y panaderia, venta D. abarrotes, que son actividades que necesitan creditos rapidos.		
			
La Sra.Arminda A. es Presidenta del grupo, es nueva en este cargo en el Banco D. Emprendimiento LAS PAGADORAS. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa al credito además D. atender a su familia en sus horas libre, es una persona amigable y muy dinamica, ademas D. ello es una persona cumplida y responsable en el grupo y la oportunidad que le brinda Emprender no la defraudara.		
			
La Sra. Iris Lainer A. B. es la tesorera  del Banco D. Emprendimiento Las Pagadoras. Se dedica al rubro D. venta D. perfumes y cosmeticos D. Yanbal y Avon, ademas D. estudiar, dentro del rubro tiene 1 año D. antiguedad y tambien realiza labores D. casa. Con los ingresos que persibe ayuda al sustento D. su familia, colabora a sus padres con los gastos familiares, las socias del grupo la ven como alguien responsables y cumplida. La Sra .es unas D. las fundadoras del grupo.			
La Sra. Dina V. R.,  es la secretaria del Banco, se dedica a la confeccion D. ropa, se dedica a la costura D. ropa, trabaja D. lunes a domingo 12 horas al dia, su trabajo mayormente es atender a la gente que visita su negocio para llevarle las telas y ropas que ella debe cofeccionar, La Sra es fundadora en el grupo  y la  oportunidad que le brinda el Banco D. Emprendimiento Las Pagadoras es muy importante para ella.
texts.en:
Las Pagadoras Communal Bank was founded on July 17, 2009 by a group of women entrepreneurs who want to expand their businesses. The group consists of 12 members and this is their first loan cycle. These women are engaged in such retail businesses such as jewelry, food, cosmetics, quilts/sheets, medicines, mocochinchi (peach cider), baked goods, groceries, and other products that are bought and sold on credit.

Sra. Arminda A. is the group president and this is her first time in this position. She sells clothing while she looks after her family in her spare time. Sra. Arminda is very friendly and dynamic, as well as one of the most accomplished and responsible members of the group. She hopes not to disappoint with this opportunity Emprender has offered to her.

Sra. Iris Lainer A. B. is the group treasurer. She sells perfumes and cosmetics maD. by Yanbal and Avon. In addition to being a student, she also takes care of her one year old child and handles the household chores. With the income she earns, she is able to support her family and help her parents with their living expenses. The other group members view Sra. Iris as someone who is responsible and accomplished. She is one of the founders of the group.

Sra. Dina V. R. is the group secretary. She makes and sells clothing. Sra. Dina works 12 hours each day, Monday through Sunday. Her customers bring her the fabric she uses to make the clothing they request. She is one of the founders of the group and this opportunity presented by Emprender is very important to her.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital & purchase merchandise

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Fourteen years ago, Dora moved from Mexico to Queens to start a new life in the United States. Wanting to build her financial independence, she started a business selling perfume, jewelry and cosmetics. Now, she is able to put part of the income she earns towards her savings, therefore building her assets.

Dora heard about the availability of microloans from a friend who had borrowed from ACCION USA. Since then, she has taken out a few loans with ACCION USA. She says she feels more secure knowing that microloans are an option available to her – a much more affordable one than the credit cards she once used. She will use this loan to invest in new products for her beauty supply business, buying special brands requested by her customers. 

Since she has been able to get loans from ACCION USA, she’s sold more products, and she dreams of expanding her business to other states. She says that if she couldn’t get a loan, she would keep on struggling to maintain her business, but the extra capital gives her some ease and flexibility managing the business, and is helping her to expand.

loans.use: To invest in new products for her beauty supply business

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.en:
Olga is 33 years old and is married with three children.  She has a business selling clothing, shoes and dairy products such as yogurt, cheese and butter.  Olga’s husband works at a business which provides cleaning and security services to other companies.  Olga and her family live in the city of Pucallpa.

Olga has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She used her very first loan of 300 Peruvian soles (about $100 US) to invest in dairy products.  She has since expanded her business ventures and now sends money to the Peruvian capital, Lima, to purchase clothing and shoes to resell in Pucallpa.  Olga will use this loan of 1500 soles (about $525) to invest in clothing and shoes from Lima as well as in her dairy products.

Olga’s goal is to have her own store out of her home where she can sell her products.  In this way she will not have to travel around to visit her clients; they will come to her.  Olga hopes to grow her business in order to help her children get a good education.

loans.use: Clothing, shoes, and dairy products for sale

loans.name: Lupe

texts.en:
Lupe is 58 years old and has three adult children.  She owns a small motorcycle repair shop where she works with her son.

Lupe has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for three years and is a member of the communal bank “Las Almendras” (The Almonds).  She used her very first loan of 300 Peruvian soles (about $100 US) to invest in cold drinks for sale.  Lupe plans to use this loan of 1500 soles (or about $525) to purchase tools, an air pump, and other necessities for her repair shop.

Lupe’s goal is to expand and improve her repair shop.  She also wants to have a business locale from which she can sell cold drinks (such as beer and soda) as well as ice cream and sweets.

loans.use: Tools, an air pump and other necessities for a motorcycle repair shop

loans.name: San Gabriel Group

texts.es: La asociación "San Gabriel" esta formada por catorce mujeres, trabajan junto a Pro-Mujer hace trece años, se reúnen quincenalmente en el centro focal Villa tejada, actualmente su presidenta es Jeannette T., ella afirma que a lo largo de los años han formado un grupo de amigas que se apoyan cuando lo necesitan. Diversos son los negocios de este grupo, Norah por ejemplo vende joyas, otras elaboran y venden comida en  pensiones y puestos, también se dedican a la  venta de mandiles, muebles y comestibles. La asociación san Gabriel desea aumentar  sus ingresos, ya que la mayoría de sus hijos están en la universidad,para este objetivo necesitan comprar mercadería o insumos para invertir en sus negocios, tienen la seguridad de obtener mayores ventas y por ende mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The San Gabriel Association is a group of 14 women who have been working together with Pro Mujer for the past 13 years. They meet every two weeks in the Villa Tejada community center. Their current president is Jeannette T., who affirms that the members have formed friendships over the years and support one another when needed.

Different types of businesses are represented in this group. For example, Norah sells jewelry. Others prepare and sell food from boarding houses and vending stalls. Some members sell aprons, furniture and groceries. The San Gabriel Association desires to increase their earnings since most of their children attend university. For this reason, they need to buy more goods and supplies to invest into their businesses so that they can increase their sales and generate more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise & supplies

loans.name: Gaviotas Group

texts.es: En la zona de villa Tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Gaviotas” , esta formado por doce mujeres que trabajan de manera organizada hace seis años aproximadamente. Las actividades que realiza la asociación, son de todo tipo, una de ellas tiene un puesto de electrodomésticos, también se dedican a venta de cosméticos, ropa, celulares, maletines, además otras de ellas se dedican al tejido artesanal, ahora necesitan comprar materia prima y mercadería para ampliar sus ventas
texts.en:
In a district of the village Tejada, you will find the Gaviotas center to which the Gaviotas association belongs. It is comprised of 12 women who have worked together in an organized manner for, approximately, the last six years. The association includes activities of all types. One of the women has a household appliances stall, others sell cosmetics, clothing, cell phones and briefcases, and still others sell handcrafted weaving. Now they need to buy raw materials and merchandise to increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tess Siemer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials and Increase of Inventory

loans.name: Faete

texts.en:
Faete A. K. is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Fagalii-Uta.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Faete runs a general store.  The primary source of income for this business comes selling a variety of different products to the local community.  Faete has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

Faete joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Faete has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 Samoan tala (or about $725 US) from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to renovate her general store.  Faete is now requesting a new loan of 2500 tala (or about $950) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan Faete has taken out from SPBD.  Faete plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her store.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese F. is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Nuusuatia.  She is married and has 8 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Akenese raises crops.  Income for this business comes primarily from planting, harvesting, and selling breadfruit.  Akenese has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 300 Samoan tala (or about $125 US) from these activities.

Akenese joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Akenese has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1700 tala (or about $700) from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  Akenese is now requesting a new loan of 2400 tala (or about $925) which will be used to rent land to raise additional crops.  The loan will be Akenese's 4th loan from SPBD.  Akenese plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To rent land to raise additional crops
